content:
いさいをはなつ〔異彩を放つ〕
〈熟語〉To shine; to cut a conspicuous figure; to be conspicuous; to be in evidence

content.content: 彼女は社交界に異彩を放っている
She shines in society.
彼は政界に異彩を放っている
He cuts a conspicuous figure―cuts a brilliant figure―in the political world.
飛行機は欧州大戦に異彩を放った
The aeroplane was in evidence in the European war.
駆逐艦は日露戦争に初めて異彩を放った
The destroyer was first in evidence in the Russo-Japanese War.

content:
いさお〔勲〕
〈名〉A merit; a meritorious deed

content.content: いさをある
The man of meritorious deeds,
人を教えの親として
Let him exert his powers
おほし立てなむ
To tend the growth and culture of
大和なでしこ
Yamato's tender flowers.

いさおし〔勲し〕
〈名〉A merit; a meritorious deed

いさかい〔諍〕
〈名〉An alternation; a quarrel; high words:(=する) to altercate, quarrel, squabble, wrangle, jangle, brangle, have words (with one)

いざかや〔居酒屋〕
〈名〉A tavern; a public-house; a pot-house:(米国にては)a saloon

content:
いさぎよい〔潔い〕
〈形〉Clean (conduct); pure (heart); brave (death); manful (life)

content.content: いつも変わらぬ潔い言葉だ
You talk as bravely as ever.
彼は潔い心を持っている
He has a pure heart―a brave heart―a manful heart.
彼は(義務責任を回避せずに)潔い生涯を送った
He lived a manful life.
潔しとせず
to disdain to do anything
偽りを言うを潔しとせず
I am ashamed to tell a lie―above telling a lie.

content:
いさぎよく〔潔く〕
〈副〉Bravely; manfully; like a man; with a good grace

content.content: 潔く死ぬ
to die like a brave man―die game
潔く討死にする
to die bravely in battle
潔く最後を遂げた
He met his death like a man.
潔く人生の本分を尽した
He did his duty manfully―lived a manful life.
潔く折れる
to submit with a good grace
すまないと思ったら潔く謝罪する
Acknowledge your fault with a good grace.
負けたら潔く降参する
If you are beaten, acknowledge your defeat with a good grace―Acknowledge yourself fairly beaten.
潔く難事に当たる
to face the difficulty―face the music
一身を潔くする
to clear oneself from blame

content:
いさぎよしとせぬ〔潔しとせぬ〕
〈他動〉To disdain (to do anything)

content.content: 彼は人に恩恵を乞うを潔しとせぬ
He disdains to ask a favour―He is too proud to ask a favour―He is ashamed to ask a favour―He is above asking a favour―He considers it beneath him to ask a favour.

content:
いさご〔砂〕
〈名〉Sand

content.content: 浜の砂のよう
They are numberless as the sands on the seashore.

content:
イサコザ
〈名〉→『

content.content: イザコザ

content:
イザコザ
〈名〉Troubles

content.content: イザコザがあるとうるさいから
lest troubles should arise
何のイザコザも無く済んだ
The matter was settled without any trouble.

content:
いささか〔聊か〕
〈副〉A little, slightly; somewhat; rather:(=の) a little (money); slight (mistake); trifling (sum); inconsiderable (loss); insignificant (gain); trivial (matter); paltry (sum, etc.)

content.content: 彼とはいささかの知合いだ
I am slightly acquainted with him.
彼はいささかのことで立腹する
He gets angry at trifles.
いささかお礼の印までにさし上げます
Please accept of a trifling present in token of my gratitude.
彼はいささかの金を貰って働いている
He works for a trifling sum―a paltry sum―a mere pittance.
いささかの損ですんだ
I got off with a trifling loss―a trivial loss―an inconsiderable loss―an insignificant loss.
利益はいささかなものだ
The profits are not worth mentioning―nothing to speak of.
いささか閉口つかまつった
I am rather nonplussed.
彼はいささかも恥じる様子が無い
He seems not in the least abashed.
いささかのことだ
It is a trifle―a trivial matter.

いざさらば
〈間投詞〉Come; now; adieu!

content:
いざしらず〔いざ知らず〕
〈副〉Apart from; setting apart

content.content: 他の場合はいざ知らずこの場合だけはそうだ
Setting other cases apart, it is so in this case.
人はいざ知らず僕だけは不平は無い
As for me,―For my part,―I am satisfied.

content:
いざなう〔誘う〕
〈他動〉
1. (=招く)to invite (one to a party); to bid (one to a wedding); to ask (one to dinner)
2. (=誘惑する)to allure; to lure; to entice; to tempt

content.content: 誘われやすきは女の本性
Woman is liable to temptations.
誘う水あらばいなんとぞ思うという風情だ
She seems ready to yield to the first man who offers himself.

content:
いさましい〔勇ましい〕
〈形〉Brave (man); gallant (officer); dashing (young fellow); inspiring (sight); thrilling (tale); stirring (life); spirit-stirring (scene); inspiriting (deed, etc.)

content.content: 勇ましい少壮士官だ
He is a gallant young officer―a dashing young officer.
実に勇ましい光景だ
It is an inspiring sight―a spirit-stirring scene.
勇ましい物語を聞いて夜を明かした
We passed the night by listening to thrilling tales.
勇ましい戦報が来る
Thrilling news come from the front.
海上生活は勇ましくて壮快である
A seafaring life is stirring and exciting.

content:
いさみ〔勇み〕
〈名〉Gallantry; chivalry; dash; ?lan

content.content: 江戸っ子は勇みがある
The Edokko has ?lan.

content:
いさみたつ〔勇み立つ〕
〈自動〉To be stirred (to the depths of one's soul)

content.content: 開戦と聞いて皆勇み立った
Everybody was stirred by the declaration of war.
この記事を読んで勇み立った
The account stirred me to the depths of my being.

content:
いさみはだ〔勇み肌〕
〈名〉Bravado; dash

content.content: 勇み肌の若い者だ
He is a dashing lad―a desperado.
江戸っ子は勇み肌がある
The Edokko has some bravado in his composition―has some dash in him.

content:
いさむ〔勇む〕
〈自動〉
1. To be stirred; to be excited; to be inspired; to be spirited; to be in high spirits; to be full of glee

content.content: 義に勇む
to be inspired with noble ideas―chivalrous―heroic
勇んで
in high spirits―in high glee―with a light heart―with a good heart
一行は勇んで遠征に行った
The party went on the expedition in high spirits―in high glee.
勇んで仕事に取りかかった
I went to work with a good heart―with a light heart.
皆勇み勇んで出陣した
They went forth to battle in the highest of spirits.

content: 2. (A horse) prances

content.content: 咲いた桜に
Why tie thy steed
何故駒繋ぐ
To a blossoming cherry-tree?
駒が勇めば
The horse will prance,
花が散る
The flowers scattered be.

content:
いさめ〔諫め〕
〈名〉Expostulation; remonstrance:(=る) to expostulate (with one's master on his mistake); to remonstrate (with a friend on his folly); to reason (with a man on his error)

content.content: 彼は色を正して主人を諫めた
He seriously expostulated with his master (on his mistake).
いくら彼を諫めても聴かない
I have remonstrated with him in vain.
諫めをいれる
to listen to expostulation
主人はどうしても諫めをいれない
My master turns a deaf ear to my expostulations.
僕は友人の諫めによって思いとどまった
I have yielded to the remonstrances of a friend.
三度諫めて聴かれざれば臣死す
The last expostulation is death.

content:
いざよい〔十六夜〕
〈名〉The sixteenth night of the lunar month

content.content: いざよいの月
a moon sixteen-days old

content:
いさり〔漁り〕
〈名〉Fishing

content.content: いさり舟
a fishing-boat
いさり火
a fishing-fire

content:
いざり〔居行〕
〈名〉A cripple

content.content: いざりが足が立つ
A cripple walks―A cripple finds his legs.

いざる〔居行る〕
〈自動〉To creep along; to crawl about

content:
いさん〔違算〕
〈名〉An error in a calculation; miscalculation:(=する) to miscalculate; to commit an error in calculation

content.content: 違算があったために事が失敗に帰した
The thing failed through miscalculation.

content:
いさん〔遺産〕
〈名〉Property left by a deceased person; a legacy; a bequest; an inheritance; a fortune left

content.content: 彼の父は遺産を残して死んだ
His father left him a fortune.
僕の父は遺産は無かった
My father left me nothing.
兄弟が遺産を争った
The brothers quarrelled over the inheritance.
遺産を相続する
to succeed to a property―inherit a fortune
遺産相続
succession to a property
彼は遺産相続人だ
He is heir to the property.
遺産相続税
succession duty
遺産受取人
a legatee
遺産管理者
the administrator of the property

content:
いし〔意志〕
〈名〉
1. Will; volition; purpose; intention; design

content.content: 強固なる意志
a strong will―an iron will―an adamantine will
情欲を制するには強固な意志を要する
One must have a strong will to keep the passions under control.
彼は意志の強固な人だ
He is a man of strong will―a man of strong character―a strong character.
意志の薄弱な人だ
He is a man of weak will―a man of weak character―a weak character.
今時の学生は意志薄弱だ
Students nowadays are infirm of purpose.
意志があってしたことではない
The action was unintentional.
意志の自由
freedom of the will
自由意志
free will
(彼に勧めはしない)自由意志でしたのだ
He did it of his free will.
意志の人
a volitional
意志の力
will-power
意志動詞、無意志動詞
a volitional verb a non-volitional verb
意志を貫徹する
to carry a design through―carry through one's purpose―put it through―push it through―go through with it―drive a nail home
敵に対して意志を貫徹する
to impose one's will upon the enemy
意志が疎通する
to understand each other―come to an understanding (with each other)
意志の疎通を図る
to establish a good understanding between the two
日米間の意志疎通を図る
to promote good understanding between―bring about better understanding between―Japan and America
意志疎通を妨げるものがある
There is something that disturbs good understanding between the two.
二人の間は意志疎通を欠いている
There is a misunderstanding between the two―A gulf lies between the two.
貧富の間は意志が疎通せぬ
The barrier of rank stands between the rich and poor.

content:
いし〔異志〕
〈名〉A sinister design; rebellious mind; treachery

content.content: 異志を懐く
to harbour treacherous designs
彼に異志が無いかとあやしんだ
I suspected him of treachery.

いし〔遺子〕
〈名〉A child by deceased husband; a posthumous child

content:
いし〔遺志〕
〈名〉The intention of a deceased person; one's dying wishes

content.content: 遺志を果たす
to carry out the intention of the deceased
生前の遺志により
in pursuance of the intention of the deceased
親の遺志により
in compliance with my father's dying wishes
親の遺志を継ぐ
to tread in one's father's footsteps

content:
いし〔遺趾〕
〈名〉Ruins

content.content: 都会は僅かに遺跡を存するのみ
The city lies in ruins.

content:
いし〔医師〕
〈名〉A physician; a doctor

content.content: この病室の担当の医師はどなたですか
Who is the physician in charge of this ward?
智者三十にして医師を要せず
“A man is a fool or a physician at thirty.”

content:
いし〔石〕
〈名〉A stone:(石材なら)stone

content.content: 石を投げる
to throw a stone―shy a stone
石を投げるものじゃない
You should not throw stones.
石を投げたら届くところにある
It is within a stone's throw.
人に石をぶつける
to throw a stone at a man―(いくつもなら)―pelt a man with stones
石を敷く
to pave the ground with stone
道には石が敷いてある
The roads are paved with stone―paved with flag.
石は沈む
A stone sinks in the water.
石のように沈む
He will sink like lead.
石を山から切出す
to quarry stone
点滴石をうがつ
“Falling drops will wear a stone”―“Constant dropping wears the stone.”
石から綿を取る
to skin a flint―flay a flint―wring water from a flint―draw blood out of stone
石を起こし瓦を掘っても詮索する
I will leave no stones unturned.
石の上にも三年
Perseverance will not fail of its reward.
他山の石もって玉を磨くべし
One should learn by others' examples.
もって他山の石とすべし
It is a good example to follow.
彼の批評はもって他山の石とするに足る
His criticism has given me a good lesson.
石になる、石に化す
to petrify

content:
いし〔縊死〕
〈名〉Hanging oneself

content.content: 縊死を遂げた
He hanged himself―committed suicide by hanging himself.

content:
いじ〔意地〕
〈名〉
1. (=根性)nature

content.content: 意地が悪い(意地悪)
He is ill-natured―spiteful―cantankerous―cross-grained―crabbed―a crab―“a dog in the manger.”
わたしのことをそんなことを言うとは意地が悪いね
It is ill-natured of her to say such things of me.
意地の悪い女だ
She is a spiteful thing.
そんな意地の悪い質問をするものじゃない
You should not ask such captious questions.

content: 2. (=意気地)will; proper pride; sense of honour

content.content: あの少年は意地が強い
The boy has a will of his own.
意地を通す
to have one's own way
男の意地
pride of manhood―sense of honour
意地としてそんな卑劣なことはできない
My proper pride forbids my stooping to such baseness.
男子の意地としてやり通さなければならぬ
My sense of honour dictates that I should put it through.
あなたも男の意地なればよもや見捨てはなさるまい
As you are a man of honour, you will surely remain true to me.
女の意地
pride of womanhood
女の意地を立てる
The woman in her asserts itself.
女の意地を起こした
All the woman in her rose in rebellion.
彼の身体は意地一つで持っている
His iron will alone sustains him (from succumbing to a fatal illness).
昔の芸者は意地も張りもあった
The old time geisha had a high sense of honour and professional pride.
今の芸者は意地も張りも無い
The present-day geisha has no sense of honour or pride.

content: 3. (=強情)obstinacy

content.content: 意地を張る
to be obstinate―stubborn―headstrong
彼は意地を張ってどうしても誤りを直さない
He persists on his error.

content: 4. (=悪意地)spite

content.content: 止めるとかえって意地になる
If you try to dissuade him, he will do it all the more out of spite―from pure spite.
彼は僕に対する意地であんなことをするのだ
He does such things to spite me.
底意地の悪い批評だ
It is a spiteful criticism.
底意地の悪い男だ
He is a malicious man.
意地が汚ない
to be greedy―lickerish

content:
いじ〔維持〕
〈名〉Support; maintenance; preservation; up-keep:(=する) to keep up (a custom); to maintain (a school); to support (a family); to preserve (peace); to keep (a club) going

content.content: 田舎では古風を維持している
People keep up old customs in the country.
一家を維持する
to support a family―maintain a family
学校を維持する
to maintain a school―keep up a school
あの学校は寄付で維持している
The school is maintained by subscription.
あの学校は維持して行くだけの生徒が無い
That school has not enough students to keep it up.
現状を維持する
to maintain the status quo
平和を維持する
to maintain peace―preserve peace
公安を維持する
to preserve the public peace―maintain public order
風紀を維持する
to maintain discipline
体面を維持する
to keep up appearances
原案を維持する
to support the original bill
信用を維持する
to keep up one's credit
旦那が貧民会を起こして奥さんがそれを維持している
The squire set the poors' club going, and his wife keeps it going.
維持費
cost of maintenance

いじいじする〔意地意地する〕
〈自動〉To be greedy; to be lickerish

いしうす〔石臼〕
〈名〉A stone mortar:(ひき臼なら)a stone mill

いしがき〔石垣〕
〈名〉A stone wall

いしがめ〔石亀〕
〈名〉A kind of tortoise

content:
いしき〔意識〕
〈名〉Consciousness:(=の) conscious:(=する) to be conscious

content.content: 意識を失う
to lose one's consciousness―fall unconscious―lose one's senses―fall senseless―fall insensible―fall into a swoon―swoon―faint
意識を回復する
to recover one's consciousness―recover one's senses―come to one's senses―come to (oneself)
無意識
unconscious

content:
いしき〔違式〕
〈形〉Informal; irregular

content.content: 違式の手続きをする
to follow informal procedure
願書は違式だ
The application is not drawn up in due form.

いしき〔居敷〕
〈名〉The seat (of trousers, etc.)

いじきたない〔意地汚ない〕
〈形〉Greedy; lickerish

いしきり〔石切り〕
〈名〉A stone-cutter; a mason

いしきりば〔石切り場〕
〈名〉A stone-pit; a quarry

いしく〔石工〕
〈名〉A stone-cutter; a mason

いじくる〔弄くる〕
〈他動〉To fumble (a key); to twiddle (a finger); to finger (a button)

content:
いじける
〈自動〉
1. (=畏縮する)to shrink (for fear)
2. (=ひねくれる)to be stunted; to be gnarled; to be crabbed

content.content: いじけた木
stunted growths―scrubby trees
古木は面白くいじけている
The old trunk is gnarled and fantastic.
いじけた字を書く
He writes a crabbed hand―a cramped hand.
いじけた文章を書く
He writes a crabbed style.
心がいじけている
He has a warped mind―a perverse mind.

content: 3. (=かじかむ)to huddle oneself

content.content: 子どもらは寒がっていじけている
The children are huddled with cold.

いしころ〔石ころ〕
〈名〉A pebble; a cobble-stone

いしざいく〔石細工〕
〈名〉Atone-work; masonry

content:
いしじぞう〔石地蔵〕
〈名〉A stone image of Jizo

content.content: 石地蔵を抱いて寝たようだった
I slept with an iceberg.

content:
いしずえ〔礎〕
〈名〉The foundation

content.content: 大成の礎を置く
to lay the foundation of one's future greatness
あのような人は実に国家の礎である
Such a man is the foundation-stone of the state.

content:
いしずり〔石摺り〕
〈名〉A rubbed copy

content.content: 石摺りを取る
to rub a copy from a monument

content:
いしそつう〔意志疎通〕
〈名〉Mutual understanding; intelligence:(=する) to understand each other; to come to an understanding (with each other)

content.content: 意志疎通を図る
to establish a mutual understanding between the two
日米間の意志疎通を図る
to promote good understanding―bring about better understanding―between Japan and America
意志疎通を妨害するものがある
There is something that disturbs good understanding between the two.
二人の間に意志疎通を欠いている
There is a misunderstanding between the two―A gulf lies between the two.
上下意志疎通せず
The barrier of rank stands between the higher and lower classes.

いしだたみ〔石畳〕
〈名〉A stone pavement

content:
いしだん〔石段〕
〈名〉A stone-step; a flight of stone-steps

content.content: 石段を上がる
to go up the stone-steps―mount the stone-steps
石段を下る
to go down the stone-steps―descend the stone-steps
石段を上がると神社がある
A flight of stone-steps leads to a shrine.

content:
いしつ〔遺失〕
〈名〉Loss:(=する) to lose:(=せる) lost

content.content: 遺失物
lost property―lost articles
遺失品は三日以内に届け出るべし
Lost articles must be claimed within three days.
届け出での無い遺失品
unclaimed lost property
遺失者
the owner of lost property
遺失品の発見者
the discoverer of lost property
遺失品取扱所
the lost-property office

いしづき〔石突き〕
〈名〉The ferrule (of a cane); the butt-end (of a lance)

content:
いしづくり〔石造り〕
〈形〉(Built of) stone

content.content: 石造りの家
a stone-house

いしづち〔石槌〕
〈名〉A stone-hammer; a rammer

いじっぱり〔意地っ張り〕
〈形〉Obstinate; stubborn; headstrong

いしどうろう〔石灯籠〕
〈名〉A stone lantern

content:
いしなげ〔石投げ〕
〈名〉A sling

content.content: 石投げで石を投げる
to sling a stone

content:
いしばい〔石灰〕
〈名〉Lime

content.content: 厠{かわや}に石灰をまく
to sprinkle the privy with lime
石灰を焼く
to burn lime
石灰窯
a lime-kiln

content:
いしばし〔石橋〕
〈名〉A stone-bridge

content.content: 石橋を叩いて渡る
to be over-cautious―over-prudent

いしはじき〔石弾き〕
〈名〉Marbles:(=する) to play (at) marbles

いじばる〔意地張る〕
〈自動〉To be obstinate; to be stubborn; to be headstrong

いしぶみ〔碑〕
〈名〉A stone monument (with an inscription on it)

いしべきんきち〔石部金吉〕
〈名〉A man of strict morals; a Joseph

いしぼとけ〔石仏〕
〈名〉A stone Buddha; a tombstone

content:
いしめ〔石目〕
〈名〉Grain

content.content: この大理石は石目が細い、石目が荒い
The marble is fine-grained―coarse-grained.

content:
いじめる〔苛める〕
〈他動〉To persecute (people); to oppress, grind down (the poor); to bully (the weak):(冗談半分なら)to tease (a girl)

content.content: 姑が嫁をいじめるということは西洋では無いことだ
In foreign countries, there are no instance of mothers-in-law persecuting their daughters-in-law.
弱い者いじめをする
to bully the weak
あの男は弱い者いじめをする
He is a bully.
貧民をいじめる
to grind down the poor―grind the faces of the poor
彼は継母にいじめ放題いじめられた
He was left to the tender mercies of a stepmother.
庭木をいじめる
to torture a tree

content:
いしゃ〔慰藉〕
〈名〉Comfort; consolation; solace:(=する) to comfort; to console; to solace

content.content: 読書に慰藉を求める
I take comfort in reading.
彼は宗教に慰藉を求める
He finds solace in religion―solaces himself with religion.
人に慰藉を与える
to comfort―console―solace―others
慰藉金
a solatium

content:
いしゃ〔医者〕
〈名〉A physician; a doctor; a medical man; a medical practitioner; a medico:(外科医は)a surgeon

content.content: 医者をする
to practise medicine
医者にかかる
to be treated by a doctor―have a doctor
医者にかかったか
Have you had a doctor?
生まれてから医者というものにかかったことが無い
I never had a doctor in my life.
彼は今医者にかかっている
He is under the treatment of a doctor―under medical treatment.
病人を医者にかける
to commit an invalid to the doctor's care
かかりつけの医者
the family doctor―my doctor
医者に見て貰ったか
Have you consulted a doctor?
医者に見て貰うがよい
You ought to see the doctor.
たいしたことではないが気休めに医者に見てもらったのだ
It is nothing serious, but I consulted a doctor for conscience' sake.
医者の診察を受ける
to consult a doctor―take medical advice
医者が患者を診察する
The doctor examines a patient.
医者の診察料
the doctor's fee
医者が患者の手当てをする
The doctor attends to the patient.
医者が患者を治療する
The doctor treats the patient.
医者が病気を治す
The doctor cures a patient.
医者が匙を投げる
A doctor gives over a patient―A doctor gives up a case.
医者に見放される
to be given over by one's doctor
医者を呼べ
Send for the doctor.
ひと走り行って医者を呼んで来る
I will run for the doctor.
医者を開業する
to set up as a physician
開業医者
a medical practitioner
あの医者ははやる
He has a large practice.
医者の免状をとる
to take a physician's licence
医者や薬の奉公をする
to lay out one's earnings in the doctor's bill
腹八合に医者要らず
Moderation in eating keeps the doctor away.
医者の不養生
“It is a good physician who follows his own advice.”
君は医者勝りだ
You ought to have been a doctor.
藪医者
a quack (doctor)―a medicastor

いしや〔石屋〕
〈名〉
1. (=石商)a stone-dealer
2. (=石工)a stone-cutter; a mason

content:
いじゃく〔胃弱〕
〈名〉Dyspepsia; indigestion

content.content: 彼は胃弱だ
He is a dyspeptic.

content:
いしやま〔石山〕
〈名〉A stone-pit; a quarry

content.content: 石山から石を切り出す
to quarry stone

content:
いしゅ〔意趣〕
〈名〉Grudge; spite; malice

content.content: 彼は意趣を含んでいる
He bears me a grudge―owes me a grudge―has a grudge against me―owes me a spite―has a spite against me―bears me malice.→『いしゅがえし〔意趣返し〕』

content:
いしゅ〔異種〕
〈名〉A different kind; a variety

content.content: 植物の異種を作る
to differentiate a plant by cultivation―vary a plant

いしゅう〔異宗〕
〈名〉A different religion

content:
いしゅう〔異臭〕
〈名〉A stench

content.content: 異臭を放つ
to give out a stench―stink

content:
いじゅう〔移住〕
〈名〉(外国へは)emigration:(外国よりは)immigration:(人種や鳥獣などの移住は)migration; transmigration:(=する) to emigrate; to immigrate; to migrate; to transmigrate; to settle

content.content: 近頃は南米へ移住する者が多い
Many people emigrate to South America.
彼は一家を挙げて東京へ移住した
He has settled in Tokyo with his family.
移住民
an emigrant―an immigrant―a settler―a colonist
移住団
a colony
移住地
a settlement

content:
いしゅがえし〔意趣返し〕
〈名〉A revenge; a retaliation

content.content: 意趣返しをする
to revenge oneself (upon one's enemy)―have one's revenge―retaliate upon one's enemy―get even with one―pay one out

いしゅくする〔畏縮する〕
〈自動〉To shrink from (a difficulty); to flinch from(one's duty); to recoil from (a horrible sight); to wince (under pain); to quail (beneath one's glance); to blench (at a danger)

content:
いしゅくする〔萎縮する〕
〈自動〉To wither; to shrivel; to be daunted (be failure); to boggle (at a difficulty)

content.content: 霜に逢うと花が萎縮する
Flowers are withered by frost.
失敗に萎縮するような男ではない
He is not the man to be daunted by failure.
困難を見て萎縮するものでない
You should not boggle at difficulties.

content:
いじゅつ〔医術〕
〈名〉The medical art; medicine:(=の) medical

content.content: 医術を開業する
to practise medicine―commence practice
医術開業試験
the examination for medical practitioners
医術開業免状
a medical practitioner's license

いしょ〔遺書〕
〈名〉
1. (=遺言書)a will; a testament
2. (=遺稿)a posthumous work

いしょ〔医書〕
〈名〉A work on medicine; a medical treatise

content:
いしょう〔意匠〕
〈名〉A design:(紋の意匠)a device

content.content: 意匠を案出する
to think out a design
意匠を凝らす
to elaborate a design
凝った意匠
an elaborate design
斬新の意匠
a novel design
意匠の専用
exclusive use of a design
意匠専用権
a right to the exclusive use of a design
意匠家
a designer
意匠物
fancy-works

content:
いしょう〔衣裳〕
〈名〉Clothes; garments; dress; costume; apparel

content.content: 芝居の衣裳
theatrical costume―stage costume―property
(芝居の)衣裳方
the costumer―The property-man
衣裳で人物がわかる
“The apparel oft proclaims the man.”
馬子にも衣裳
“Clothes make the man.”

content:
いじょう〔以上〕
〈前置詞相当〉Above; over; beyond; more than; upwards of; in excess of

content.content: 五円以上
over five yen―more than five yen―five yen and upwards
五銭以上お預かり申可候
Sums over five sen may be deposited.
株は平価以上
The shares are above par―at a premium.
彼は四十以上に違いない
He must be above forty―over forty.
五十以上の中老人だ
He is an elderly man past fifty―gone fifty―turned of forty―on the shady side of fifty.
五歳以上の子ども
Children of over five years―children of five years and upwards.
彼は十年以上も洋行していた
He has stayed abroad for upwards of ten years.
四間以上七間以下の家を求む
Wanted a house of more than four and less than seven rooms.
定額以上の費用は払わん
I will not pay expenses in excess of the fixed sum.
結果は想像以上だ
The result is beyond my expectations―The result exceeds my expectations.
収入以上の生活をするものではない
You should not live above your means.
必要以上
more than is needed
必要以上の金は要らぬ
I do not want more money than is necessary.

content: 〈形〉(=の) the above; the above-stated; the above-mentioned; the aforesaid; the said; the foregoing

content.content: 以上の如く
as above―as mentioned above
以上述べる如く
as stated above
大要は以上の如し
The outline is as stated above.
彼の演説の大要は以上の如くである
The above is the gist of his speech.
以上は正教員です
The above-mentioned are the regular teachers.

content: 〈接続詞〉(=は) since; seeing that; now that; if... at all

content.content: 言い出した以上は後へは退けぬ
Since I have said it, I must act up to it.
見た以上は信ぜざるを得ぬ
Now that I have seen, I must believe.
戦う以上はあくまで戦え
If you do fight at all, fight it out.

content:
いじょう〔異常〕
〈名〉Anything unusual:(=な) unusual; extraordinary; uncommon; abnormal; singular; remarkable

content.content: 彼は一見して異常な人であることがわかる
You can see at a glance that he is no common being―a remarkable man.
ご不在中、別に異常なことはありませんでした
Nothing particular happened during your absence.

content:
いじょう〔異状〕
〈名〉Signs of derangement; abnormal symptoms; something wrong

content.content: 異状あり
Something is the matter―Something is wrong―It―is deranged―affected―abnormal.
異状無し
Nothing is the matter―Nothing is wrong―It is all right.
異状を呈す
to show signs of derangement―develop abnormal symptoms
精神に異状あり
He is deranged in mind―out of his mind―out of his wits―out of his senses―not right in his mind―not right in his head―wrong in the upper story―off his head―crack-brained―cracked―slightly touched.
悲歎のあまり精神に異状を来した
Excessive grief has deranged his mind.
精神に異状無し
He is sound in mind―of sound mind―in his right mind―in full possession of his faculties.
脈搏呼吸ともに異状無し
His pulse and respiration are normal.
機関に異状無し
Nothing is wrong with the engine―The engine is all right.
身体は少しも異状を呈しておらぬ
The system shows no abnormal signs―The system is not affected at all.
室内はなんらの異状も無かった
Nothing was amiss in the room.

いじょうふ〔偉丈夫〕
〈名〉A great man

content:
いしょく〔委嘱〕
〈名〉A request:(=する) to request, ask (one to do something)

content.content: 知事の委嘱により講習をすることになりました
I am going to lecture at the request of the governor.

content:
いしょく〔移植〕
〈名〉Transplantation; naturalization:(=する) to transplant; to naturalize

content.content: 人を別天地に移植する
to take a man out of his proper sphere

content:
いしょく〔衣食〕
〈名〉Food and clothing; food and raiment; back and belly; means of subsistence; means of livelihood; a livelihood; a living:(=する) to live

content.content: 衣食の道を講ずる
to find some means of livelihood
文筆に衣食する
to live by the pen
貧民に衣食を給す
to feed and clothe the poor
衣食こちら持ちで彼を雇っておく
We keep him back and belly.
衣食に奔走する
to work for one's bread―toil for one's living
衣食に窮す
to be straitened for means of livelihood
彼らは衣食に不足は無い
They are well fed and well clothed.
遺族は衣食には困らない
The family is well provided for.
彼は衣食にさしつかえ無いだけの財産がある
He has a competent fortune―a competency.
衣食足りて礼節を知る
One must be well fed before one can be well bred―Well-fed, well-bred―Good feeding before good breeding―Bread before breeding.

いじょく〔居職〕
〈名〉A sedentary occupation

content:
いしょくじゅう〔衣食住〕
〈名〉Food, clothing and shelter; creature comforts

content.content: 彼らは衣食住が豊かだ
They are well fed, well clothed and well housed―They are rich in creature comforts.

content:
いじらしい
〈形〉Pitiful; lovely

content.content: その心情を察するといじらしくていじらしくてたまらない
Her mood must needs be pitied.

content:
いじる〔弄る〕
〈他動〉To finger (a button); to fumble (a key); to twiddle (a finger); to touch (a worm); to meddle with, play with, fool with, monkey with, concern oneself with (a tool, etc.)

content.content: (危ないから)その鉄砲をいじるな
Don't fool with that gun!―Don't monkey with that gun!
時計をいじるな、こわすといけないから
Don't meddle with the clock, for fear you should break it.
彼はボタンをいじる癖がある
He has a way of fingering a button.
誰か機械をいじったな
Somebody has been meddling with the machine.
赤ん坊が刃物をいじっている
Baby is playing with an edged tool.
蚕をいじるのは気味が悪い
I have a horror of touching silkworms.
彼は骨董をいじる
He concerns himself with curios―affects curios.
彼は読書と庭いじりに日を暮らしている
He passes his time between the library and the garden.

いしわら〔石原〕
〈名〉A stony plain

content:
いじわる〔意地悪〕
〈形〉Ill-natured; spiteful; cantankerous; cross-grained; crabbed

content.content: あの人は意地悪だ
He is an ill-natured man―a crab―(人の邪魔をしてなら)―a dog in the manger.

content:
いしん〔威信〕
〈名〉Prestige

content.content: 威信を保持する
to maintain one's prestige
国家の威信に関する問題だ
The question involves the national prestige.
帝国の威信を発揚する
to enhance the national prestige
ドイツの威信地に落つ
Germany's prestige is gone―Prestige has departed from Germany.

content:
いしん〔維新〕
〈名〉The Restoration

content.content: 維新の元勲
the veterans of the Restoration
彼も維新の元勲だ
He is one of the veterans of the Restoration.
維新の際に功労があった
He rendered services at the Restoration.
維新前に
in the pre-Restoration days
維新このかた廃れたる日本刀
The Japanese sword has been in disuse since the Restoration.

content:
いじん〔偉人〕
〈名〉A great man

content.content: 偉人は単純なり
Great men are simple.
凡人無くば偉人無からん
But for ordinary men, there would be no great men.
とかく偉人は誤解される
To be great is to be misunderstood.
偉人は事に臨んで大なり
A great man is equal to any occasion―A great man will rise to the occasion.
人の長所を見るは偉人たるを証す
It is a sign of greatness to see the good in others.
彼は学会の偉人だ
He is a prodigy of learning.

〈名〉Telepathy; mind-transference

content:
いしんどうたい〔異身同体〕
〈名〉One flesh

content.content: 夫婦は異身同体
Man and wife are one bone and one flesh.

content:
いす〔椅子〕
〈名〉
1. A chair

content.content: いすにかける
to sit on a chair―sit in a chair
いすにおかけなさい
Please take a chair.
いすにどっかと腰をかけた
I sank into the chair.
いすを離れる
to rise from a chair―rise off a chair
ひじかけいす
an arm-chair
安楽いす
an easy-chair
長いす
a sofa―a settee―a lounge
寝いす
a couch
籐いす
a cane chair―a rattan chair
回転いす
a revolving chair
たたみいす
a folding-chair
揺りいす
a rocking-chair

content: 2. (=地位)a post

content.content: 外務大臣のいす
the portfolio of Foreign Affairs
彼は田中氏の後を襲って次官のいすにすわった
He succeeded Mr. Tanaka in the post of vice minister.
後任者にいすを譲る
to resign one's post in favour of a successor
内閣のいすに坐る
to have a seat in the Cabinet

content:
いすう〔異数〕
〈名〉An exception:(=の) exceptional

content.content: 異数の出世だ
It is an exceptional promotion.

content:
いすか〔交喙〕
〈名〉The crossbill

content.content: イスカのくちばしは喰い違っている
The mandibles of the crossbill's bill cross each other.
することなすことイスカの嘴{はし}と喰い違い
Everything I did went wrong with me.

いすぐ
〈他動〉To rinse (one's mouth, clothes, etc.)

content:
いずく〔何処〕
〈疑問副詞〉→『

content.content: いずこ〔何処〕

いすくまる〔居竦まる〕

content:

content.content: いずくんぞ知らん
How should I know?
いずくんぞ学ばざる

content:
いずこ〔何処〕
〈疑問副詞〉Where?

content.content: 何処より来たりて何処へ行くや
Whence comest thou? and whither goest thou?
彼は何処の者とも知れぬ
He comes from no one knows where.
何処ともなく消え失せた
He vanished no one knows where―God knows where.

Autumn is autumn everywhere.

content:
いすぱにあ〔西班牙<イスパニア>〕

content.content: イスパニア人
a Spaniard
イスパニア語

content:
いすぱにあ〔西班牙<イスパニア>〕
〈固名〉Spain:(=の) Spanish

content.content: イスパニア人
a Spaniard
イスパニア語
(the) Spanish (language)

content:
いずまい〔居住い〕
〈名〉A sitting posture

content.content: 居住いを直す
to sit up straight
居住いを崩す
to make oneself at home
居住いの悪い女だ
She does not know how to sit properly.

content:
いずみ〔泉〕
〈名〉A spring; a fountain

content.content: 泉が湧く
Water wells up.
岩間から泉が湧く
Water gushes out of rocks.
泉が涸れる
A spring dries up.

いずものかみ〔出雲の神〕
〈名〉The god of marriage; Hymen

content:
いする〔委する〕
〈他動〉To abandon (a house to the rats)

content.content: 泥土に委す
to lay a city in the dust

content:
いする〔医する〕
〈他動〉To cure (an illness)

content.content: 渇を医す
to quench one's thirst―slake one's thirst

content:
いずれ〔何れ〕
〈疑問代名詞〉Which?

content.content: 仏独いずれを選ばんとするや
Which will you take, French or German?
眇{すがめ}なるは左右いずれの目なるか
In which of his eyes is he blind?
いずれを見ても山ばかり
Whichever way I may turn, I see nothing but mountains―I see only mountains on all sides.

content:
〈副〉
1. (=どのみち)in any case; in either case; either way; one way or another; anyhow

content.content: いずれ行きます
I am going in any case.
(及第しても落第しても)いずれ一度は帰省します
I am going home in either case.
いずれそんなことになるだろうと思った
That is what I expected anyhow.

content: 2. (=他日)some day; one of these days; all in good time

content.content: いずれまたお目にかかります
I hope I shall see you again some day.
いずれ近いうちに伺います
I shall call on you one of these days.
いずれお返事致します
You shall have an answer all in good time.

content:
いずれか〔何れか〕
〈不定疑問代名詞〉Either?

content.content: 独語仏語いずれか学ばんと欲するか
Are you going to study either French or German?

content: 〈不定代名詞〉Either

content.content: 学生は独語仏語いずれかを選ぶことを要す
The student must choose either French or German.

content:
いずれでも〔何れでも〕
〈不定代名詞〉Either

content.content: いずれでもよろしい
Either will do.

content:
いずれとも〔何れとも〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: いずれにしても〔何れにしても〕
諾否いずれともお返事を乞う
Whether you accept or not, let me have an answer in either case.

content:
いずれにしても〔何れにしても〕
〈副〉In any case; in either case; either way; one way or the other

content.content: いずれにしても行きます
I am going in any case.
(及第しても落第しても)いずれにしても帰省します
I go home in either case.
いずれにしても僕にとっては同じことだ
It is all one to me either way―one way or the other.

content:
いずれも〔何れも〕
〈不定代名詞〉Both:(打消せば)neither

content.content: 独語仏語いずれも知っている
I know both French and German.
独語仏語いずれも知らぬ
I know neither French nor German.
いずれも好い
Both are good.
いずれも間に合わぬ
Neither will do.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: いずれも様方おさらばでござる
Farewell to you all!

content:
いすわり〔居坐り〕
〈名〉(事)remaining in the same position:(人)a fixture:(=の) stationary; sedentary

content.content: あの女優は帝劇の居すわりだ
She is a fixture of the Imperial Theatre.
居すわりの地位
a stationary position
居すわりの仕事
sedentary occupation

content:
いすわる〔居坐る〕
〈自動〉To remain in the same position; to make oneself at home; to occupy (a house); to be in possession of (a place)

content.content: 彼は十年間今の地位に居すわっている
He has remained in his present position for ten years.
陸海軍大臣は居すわった
The Ministers of War and Navy remained in office.
その女がズルズルベッタリに居すわった
She installed herself in the family as its mistress.
英国人はインドに居すわってなかなか動きそうもない
The British are at home in India, and seem in no hurry to leave.
居すわった者が勝ち
“Possession is nine points of the law.”

content:
いせい〔以西〕
〈前置詞相当〉West of

content.content: これより以西は石川県
West of this is Ishikawa prefecture.

content:
いせい〔威勢〕
〈名〉
1. (=威力)power; might

content.content: 威勢の盛んな王
a mighty potentate
威勢を揮るう
to exert one's power―make one's power felt
威勢を示す
to display one's power

content: 2. (=元気)spirits; dash

content.content: 威勢の好い男だ

Not at all!―Don't mention it!

content: 2. (=起こす)to cause; to bring about

content.content: この椿事は不注意の致すところ
Carelessness has brought about this accident―The accident is due to carelessness.
僕の成功は僥倖の致すところだ
My success is due to luck.
事ここに至れるは小生の不徳の致すところ
It is owing to my unworthiness that things have come to this.
この失敗は全然小生の不才の致すところ
It is all owing to my want of ability that I have failed―I must thank myself for my failure.

content: 3. (=招く)to bring (anything) upon oneself

content.content: それは自ら致せる災難だ
You have brought the calamity upon yourself.
富を致す
to become rich―amass wealth
繁栄を致す、隆盛を致す
to become prosperous―attain prosperity
これその隆盛を致せし所以なり
This is what made him prosperous.
力を致す
to exert oneself
君に仕えて身を致す
to devote oneself to one's lord
命を致す
to sacrifice one's life

いだす〔出す〕
〈他動〉To take out (anything); to yield (fruit); to produce (a great man, etc.)

content:
いたずら〔悪戯〕
〈名〉
1. (抽象名詞に用いれば)mischief; roguery; devilment :(普通名詞に用いれば)a prank; a trick; a practical joke; a devilry; a deviltry:(=な) mischievous; naughty; prankish; impish:(=に) out of mischief:(=する) to do mischief; to get into mischief; to play pranks; to play a trick on (one); to serve (one) a trick; to play a prank on (one); to play a practical joke on (one); to meddle with (tools); to tamper with (the seal); to dabble with (the text); to fool with (a gun); to monkey with (one); to take liberties with (a horse); to take freedoms with (a woman)

content.content: この子はいたずらでちょっとも目を離されぬ
The child is so mischievous that I can't take my eyes off him for a moment.
いたずらばかりしている
He is always getting into mischief.
いたずらばかり考えている
He is always bent on mischief.
いたずら好きだ
He is full of mischief.
いたずら盛りだ
He is at the most mischievous age.
これからはきっといたずらをさせません
I will see that he gets into no mischief.
ああいう男は蔭へ廻っていたずらする
Such men will do mischief on the sly.
いたずらに男の羽織を隠した
Out of mischief, she concealed his coat.
彼奴は僕にいたずらをしおった
He has played a trick on me―served me a trick.
悪いいたずらだ
It is a low trick―a devilry―a deviltry.
少年はいたずらが好きだ
Boys are fond of playing pranks.
あの人は人のかけようとする椅子を後ろから引くようないたずらが好きだ
He loves such practical jokes as pulling a chair from under you.
道具にいたずらすると職人に叱られるぞ
If you meddle with the tools, you will get into trouble with the workmen.
お前は今にいたずらをして失錯するぞ
You will meddle too much some day.
鉄砲にいたずらするな
Don't fool with that gun!―Don't monkey with that gun.
誰か僕の机にいたずらしおったな
Some one has been meddling with my things.
競馬馬の急所にいたずらをした者があった
Somebody had been tampering with the racer.
誰か僕の原稿にいたずらをして筆を入れおった
Somebody has been dabbling with my copy.
あの人は女だと思ってけしからんいたずらをしました
He has taken liberties with me―taken freedoms with me.
その馬はいたずらをすると危ぶないぞ
It is dangerous to take liberties with that horse.
女にいたずらをするな
Let her be!―Let her alone!
女に何いたずらをしたか
What have you done to her?
何かいたずらをしたろう
You have done something to her, have you not?
(患者が医者に向かって)先生、そろそろいたずらを始めてもよいでしょうか
Doctor, may I be naughty now?
男の子のいたずらはしかたがない
“Boys will be boys.”
頭禿げてもいたずら止まぬ
He is an old boy.
いたずら小僧
a mischievous urchin―a naughty boy―an imp
彼はいたずらなら何でもござれだ
He is ready for any mischief―ripe for any mischief―game for any mischief.

content: 2. (=女の不義いたずら)an indiscretion; indiscreet behaviour

content.content: 女がいたずらする
A woman commits an indiscretion―forgets her discretion―forgets her decorum―forgets her prudent carriage.

いたずらこぞう〔いたずら小僧〕
〈名〉A mischievous urchin; a naughty boy; an imp

content:
いたずらに〔徒らに〕
〈副〉In vain; vainly; idly; for nothing; to no purpose

content.content: 徒らに日を送る
to pass one's time in idleness―live to no purpose
徒らに日を送るものでない
You should live to some purpose.
徒らに一生を送る
to pass one's life in idleness―lead an idle life
徒らに時を費す
to waste time―fritter away one's time
徒らに金を費す
to waste money―squander money―fritter away one's money―make ducks and drakes of one's money
僕は徒らに学問をしたのでもない
I have not studied for nothing.
せっかくの苦心も徒らになった
All my labours have been in vain―All my efforts have come to naught.

content:
いたずらもの〔いたずら者〕
〈名〉(男なら)a naughty man; an old boy:(女なら)a profligate woman; a lewd woman; a skittish woman; a wanton girl

content.content: あの男はなかなかいたずら者だ
He has something of the devil in him.

content:
いただき〔頂〕
〈名〉The summit (of a mountain); the top (of a hill); the crown (of the head or a hat); the crest (of a wave, etc.)

content.content: 頂に神社がある
There is a shrine at the summit.

content:
いただく〔戴く〕
〈他動〉
1. (=被ぶる)to wear (a crown); to be covered with (snow)

content.content: 冠を戴く
to wear a crown
頂上は年中雪を戴く
The summit is covered with snow―crowned with snow―capped with snow―all the year round.
富士は千古の雪を戴く
Mt. Fuji is capped with eternal snow―crowned with perennial snow.
雪を戴ける山
a snow-capped mountain―the snow-capt heights (of the Alps)

content: 2. (=天を戴く、君を戴く)to have (the heavens) over one's head; to live under (the heavens); to have (a sovereign) over one; to live under (a sovereign); to work under (a master)

content.content: 天を戴く
We have the heavens over our heads―We live under the heavens.
君父の仇は倶に天を戴かず
One should not live under the same heavens with one's lord's or father's slayer.
屋根を戴く
We have the roof over our heads―We live under the roof.
我々は上に天皇を戴く
We have an Emperor over us―We live under an Emperor.
彼は首領として戴くに最も好い人だ
He is an excellent man to work under.

content: 3. (=押し戴く)to raise (anything) to one's forehead (in token of respect)

content.content: 殿のお墨つきを恭しくいただいてこれを開いた
He respectfully raised his lord's autograph to his head before opening it.

content: 4. (=頂戴する)to receive; to take; to eat; to drink

content.content: 一週間お暇をいただきたい
I wish to have a week's leave.
勘定はいただきました
The bill has been paid.
本の代はまだいただきません
We have not been paid for the books yet.
いつお薬をいただきに上がりましょうか
What shall I call for the medicine?
たくさんにいただきました
I have made a good meal.
腹がいっぱいでもういただけません
I am quite full, I can eat no more.
お茶を一杯いただきたい
I should like a cup of tea.
父は酒も煙草もいただきます
My father drinks and smokes.
お払い物なら何でもいただきます
I shall buy anything you have to dispose of.
何でもいただきます
I shall buy anything.
いただく物なら夏もお小袖
Nothing comes amiss to a needy man―“Look not a gift-horse in the mouth. ”

content: 5. (=何々していただきたい)I beg you will; I wish you would

content.content: ちょっとこの作文を見ていただきたいものです
I wish you would look over my composition.
明日来ていただけましょうか
Could you come tomorrow?

content:
いたたまらない〔居た堪らない〕
〈形〉Unable to stay

content.content: とてもいたたまらないようにしてやろう
We will make it hot for him―make the place too hot to hold him.
そういう風に仕向けたら誰でもいたたまるまい
Such treatment will drive away anybody.
暑くていたたまらないから家を飛び出した
The heat drove me out of the house.

content:
いたち〔鼬〕
〈名〉The weasel

content.content: 鼬の道
cessation of one's visits
この頃はとんと鼬の道だ
He has turned his back on me.

content:
いたっきん〔委託金〕
〈名〉Money in trust

content.content: 委託金を費消する
to defalcate

いたっきんひしょう〔委託金費消〕
〈名〉Defalcation

content:
いたって〔至って〕
〈副〉Very; extremely; exceedingly

content.content: 彼は至って正直者だ
He is remarkable for his honesty.
彼は年をとっても至って達者だ
He is very strong for his age.
あれは至ってばか者だ
He is a great fool―an egregious fool.
僕は勝負ごとは至って下手だ
I am a very poor hand at all games.

content:
いたっては〔至っては〕
〈前置詞相当〉As for; as to

content.content: 文体に至っては間然するところ無し
As for the style, it leaves nothing to be desired.
朝起きの習慣に至っては自分が朝起きできないからお勧め申すわけには行かない
As to early rising, I have no right to recommend it, as I am not an early riser myself.

content:
いたで〔痛手〕
〈名〉A severe wound; a great blow; a home thrust

content.content: 痛手を負う
to sustain a severe wound―be severely wounded
この法律は私営者にとっては痛手だ
The new law is a heavy blow to private enterprise.
あの攻撃は痛手であった
It was a home thrust.
株の暴落で痛手を受けた
I was hard hit by a slump in the shares.

content:
いだてん〔韋駄天〕
〈固名〉A Buddhist deity

content.content: 韋駄天走りに走る
to run like a shot

content:
いだてんばしり〔韋駄天走り〕
〈名〉Running like a shot

content.content: 韋駄天走りに走る
to run like a shot

content:
いたのま〔板の間〕
〈名〉A wooden floor

content.content: 板の間を拭く
to scrub the floor
湯屋の板の間を稼ぐ
to steal clothes at bath-houses

いたのまかせぎ〔板の間稼ぎ〕
〈名〉A bath-house thief

content:
いたばさみ〔板挟み〕
〈名〉A dilemma

content.content: 板挟みになる
to be in a dilemma―on the horns of dilemma―between two fires―between the devil and the deep sea
(両方から反対の註文を受けて)板挟みになって実に困る
I find myself between two fires.

いたばし〔板橋〕
〈名〉A wooden bridge:(船から陸へかけるのは)a gang-board

いたばり〔板張り〕
〈名〉Boarding; planking:(=する) to board; to plank; to board over, board up (a space); to plank over, plank up (a space)

content:
いたぶき〔板葺き〕
〈名〉A shingle-roof

content.content: 板葺きにする
to thatch the roof with shingles
板葺きの家
a shingle-roofed cottage

いたぶる
〈他動〉To extort (money from a man); to blackmail (a man)

いたべい〔板塀〕
〈名〉A board fence; a wooden wall

いたまえ〔板前〕
〈名〉A cook; the chef

content:
いたましい〔痛ましい〕
〈形〉Pitiful; sorrowful; lamentable; painful; sad

content.content: さてさてお痛ましいことでござる
Alas! he is to be pitied.

content:
いたまらない〔居堪らない〕
〈形〉Unable to stay

content.content: 彼をとても居たまらないようにしてやろう
We will make it too hot to hold him.

content:
いたみ〔傷み〕
〈名〉Injury; damage

content.content: 品物に傷みができた
The goods are damaged.
品物の傷みは思ったほどでない
The goods are not so much damaged as I expected.

content:
いたみ〔痛み〕
〈名〉Pain:(身心の痛み)anguish

content.content: この薬を一滴飲むと痛がたちまち去る
Swallow a drop of this medicine, and the pain will be gone in a moment.
底の方に痛みがある
I feel a dull pain.

content:
いたみいる〔痛み入る〕
〈自動〉To feel obliged; to be put to shame

content.content: お賞めにあずかっていたみ入る
I am obliged to you for your good opinion.
これしきのことにお礼を言われてはいたみ入ります
You put me to shame by thanking me for such a trifle.
ご挨拶いたみ入る
Not at all!―Don't mention it!

content:
いたむ〔傷む〕
〈自動〉To be damaged; to be injured; to be spoiled

content.content: 品物が傷んだ
The goods are damaged.
雨で花が傷んだ
The rain has spoiled the flowers.
痛みやすい品
a fragile article―perishable goods

content:
いたむ〔痛む〕
〈自動〉To pain (one); to hurt (one); to ache; to smart; to sting; to tingle

content.content: 頭が痛む
My head aches―I have a headache.
歯が痛む
I have a toothache.
どの歯が痛むのか
Which is the tooth that aches?
痛む歯を抜いてお貰い
Have the aching tooth pulled out!
腹が痛む
I have a stomach-ache―a colic.
横腹が痛む
I have a stitch in the side―a twinge in the side.
産婦は後腹が痛む
A woman in childbed suffers after-pains.
そんなことをすると後腹が痛む
If you do such a thing, you will pay dearly for it―There will be the devil to pay―Such a step may be attended with serious consequences.
それでは僕の腹が痛む
That will put me to expense.
足が痛む
My foot hurts (me)―My foot stings―(あまり歩いてなら)―My feet are sore―(靴の為なら)―My shoe pinches (me)―(靴が締まってなら)―My shoes draw.
目が痛む
I have sore eyes―My eyes pain me―My eyes sting.
喉が痛む
I have a sore throat.
胸が痛む
My chest pains me―I feel a pain in the chest.
節々が痛む
I feel a pain in my joints.
底の方が痛む
I feel a dull pain.
もう痛まない
The pain is gone.

いたむ〔悼む〕
〈他動〉To lament (one's death); to mourn (over one's death)

いため〔板目〕
〈名〉(=木材の板目)Cross grain

いためつける〔痛め付ける〕
〈他動〉To reprove (one) severely; to blow (one) up

content:
いためる〔痛める、傷める〕
〈他動〉To hurt (one's foot); to injure(one's name); to impair(one's health); to damage (goods); to spoil (flowers); to mar (one's reputation, etc.)

content.content: 身体を傷める
to injure one's health―impair one's health
足を傷めた
I have hurt my foot.
細かい文字を読むと目を傷める
Small print hurts the eye.
喉を痛めた
I have a sore throat.
大夫音声を痛めております
The performer is troubled with a sore throat.
腹を痛めた子だ
He is a child of her own bearing.
腹を痛めた子でないから遠慮している
She keeps her distance, because he is not a child of her own bearing.
頭を痛める
to beat one's brains―cudgel one's brains―rack one's brains―ransack one's brains
心を痛める、胸を痛める
to distress oneself―worry oneself
試験でだいぶ心を痛めている
The examination worries me―I am worried over the examination.
そんなことをすると親の心を痛めるばかりだ
Such a step will only grieve your parents.
彼は当てがはずれて心を痛めている
He is smarting under disappointment.
苦労は心を痛める
“Care preys upon the mind.”
失敬なことを言われて胸を痛めている
His insulting words rankle in my breast.

content:
いためる〔痛める、傷める〕
〈他動〉To hurt (one's foot); to injure(one's name); to impair(one's health); to damage (goods); to spoil (flowers); to mar (one's reputation, etc.)

content.content: 身体を傷める
to injure one's health―impair one's health
足を傷めた
I have hurt my foot.
細かい文字を読むと目を傷める
Small print hurts the eye.
喉を痛めた
I have a sore throat.
大夫音声を痛めております
The performer is troubled with a sore throat.
腹を痛めた子だ
He is a child of her own bearing.
腹を痛めた子でないから遠慮している
She keeps her distance, because he is not a child of her own bearing.
頭を痛める
to beat one's brains―cudgel one's brains―rack one's brains―ransack one's brains
心を痛める、胸を痛める
to distress oneself―worry oneself
試験でだいぶ心を痛めている
The examination worries me―I am worried over the examination.
そんなことをすると親の心を痛めるばかりだ
Such a step will only grieve your parents.
彼は当てがはずれて心を痛めている
He is smarting under disappointment.
苦労は心を痛める
“Care preys upon the mind.”
失敬なことを言われて胸を痛めている
His insulting words rankle in my breast.

いたや〔板屋〕
〈名〉A single-roofed house

いたやね〔板屋根〕
〈名〉A single-roof

content:
いたらぬ〔至らぬ〕
〈形〉Imperfect; inexperienced; raw; green

content.content: 至らぬ者ですがなにぶんよろしくお願い申します
I wish to place this raw youth under your care.
至らぬところ
one's faults―failings―shortcomings
至らぬところはどうぞお注意を願います
You will kindly remind me of my failings.

content:
いたり〔至り〕
〈名〉The utmost limit, the height (of anything)

content.content: そんなことをするのは愚の至りだ
It is the height of folly to do such a thing.
感謝の至りに堪えず
I am most grateful―My gratitude is beyond my power of expression.
恐縮の至りです
I am extremely obliged to you―overwhelmed with your goodness.
彼の行為は噴飯の至り、笑止の至りだ
His conduct is simply ridiculous―simply ludicrous.
冥加の至り
I am most thankful for the blessing.
(こうお賞めにあずかっては)汗顔の至り
Spare my blushes!
ご健勝の体を拝し大慶の至りに存じ奉る
I rejoice to behold your lordship in such excellent health.

content:
いたりあ〔伊太利<イタリア>〕
〈固名〉Italy:(=の) Italian; Italic

content.content: イタリア人
an Italian
イタリア語
(the) Italian (language)
イタリア文字
Italics

content:
いたりあ〔伊太利<イタリア>〕
〈固名〉Italy:(=の) Italian; Italic

content.content: イタリア人
an Italian
イタリア語
(the) Italian (language)
イタリア文字
Italics

content:
いたる〔至る、到る〕
〈自動〉
1. (=往く)to go (to some place)

content.content: 米国を経て欧州に到る
I go to Europe by way of America.
彼は到らざるところ無し
He is here, there and everywhere―He is ubiquitous.
彼は日本国中到らざるところ無し
He has been all over Japan―throughout Japan―over the length and breadth of Japan.

content: 2. (=来る)to come

content.content: 警報四方より到る
Alarms came from all quarters.
苦楽こもごも到る
Pleasure and pain come by turns.
暮色蒼然として到る
Evening closes―The shades of eve come slowly down.
報未だ到らず
Information has not been received yet―No news is as yet to hand.

content: 3. (=達する)to reach

content.content: 徳行は幸福に到るの道、不徳は不幸に到るの道
Virtue leads to happiness, vice to misery.
学校は未だ開校の運びに至らず
The school is not yet ready for opening.
線路は未だ開通の運びに至らず
The line is not yet ready for operation.

content: 4. (=事ここに至る)to come (to this pass)

content.content: 事ここに至らんとは
That things should have come to this!
事ここに至れるは小生の不徳の致すところ
It is owing to my unworthiness that things have come to this―(他動詞構文にすれば)―It is my unworthiness that has brought things to this.
大事に至らずして事すむ
Nothing came of the affair―The affair came to nothing.

content: 5. (=何々するに至る)to come (to do something); to get (to do something); to begin (to do something); to end in (something); to result in (something)

content.content: かくして彼を愛するに至った
Thus I came to love him.
やがて彼をよく知るに至った
Soon I got to know him well.
非難の声を耳にするに至った
Censure began to be heard.
怠惰の結果困窮に至る
Idleness ends in want.
ぜいたくの結果身を亡ぼすに至った
His extravagance ended in his ruin.
無謀の投機に身を投ぜし結果破産するに至った
Rash speculation resulted in his bankruptcy.
この失錯が彼をして辞職するに至らしめた
The blunder led him to resign.
殴打死に至らしめた
The assault resulted in his death―They beat him to death.

content: 6. (=その極み何々するに至る)to go so far as to (do something); to go the length of (doing something)

content.content: 節倹の極み灯火までも倹約にするに至った
He carried his economy so far as to do without a lamp―carried his economy to the length of doing without a lamp.
その極み遂に彼を殺すに至った
They went so far as to kill him―went the length of killing him.

content: 7. (=至らざる無し)to carry (anything) to all lengths; to exhaust one's powers; to do everything in one's power

content.content: 暴行至らざる無し
They carried violence to all lengths.
彼らを奨励して至らざる無し
He exhausted his powers to encourage them―did everything in his power to encourage them.

content: 8. (=至らぬ)to come short; to fail:(形容詞に用いれば)imperfect; inexperienced; raw; green

content.content: 至らぬところ
one's shortcomings―failings―faults
至らぬところはどうぞそうおっしゃって下さい
You will please remind me of my faults.
誠に至らぬ者ですがどうぞよろしくお願い申します
I wish to place this raw youth under your care.

content:
いたる〔至る、到る〕
〈自動〉
1. (=往く)to go (to some place)

content.content: 米国を経て欧州に到る
I go to Europe by way of America.
彼は到らざるところ無し
He is here, there and everywhere―He is ubiquitous.
彼は日本国中到らざるところ無し
He has been all over Japan―throughout Japan―over the length and breadth of Japan.

content: 2. (=来る)to come

content.content: 警報四方より到る
Alarms came from all quarters.
苦楽こもごも到る
Pleasure and pain come by turns.
暮色蒼然として到る
Evening closes―The shades of eve come slowly down.
報未だ到らず
Information has not been received yet―No news is as yet to hand.

content: 3. (=達する)to reach

content.content: 徳行は幸福に到るの道、不徳は不幸に到るの道
Virtue leads to happiness, vice to misery.
学校は未だ開校の運びに至らず
The school is not yet ready for opening.
線路は未だ開通の運びに至らず
The line is not yet ready for operation.

content: 4. (=事ここに至る)to come (to this pass)

content.content: 事ここに至らんとは
That things should have come to this!
事ここに至れるは小生の不徳の致すところ
It is owing to my unworthiness that things have come to this―(他動詞構文にすれば)―It is my unworthiness that has brought things to this.
大事に至らずして事すむ
Nothing came of the affair―The affair came to nothing.

content: 5. (=何々するに至る)to come (to do something); to get (to do something); to begin (to do something); to end in (something); to result in (something)

content.content: かくして彼を愛するに至った
Thus I came to love him.
やがて彼をよく知るに至った
Soon I got to know him well.
非難の声を耳にするに至った
Censure began to be heard.
怠惰の結果困窮に至る
Idleness ends in want.
ぜいたくの結果身を亡ぼすに至った
His extravagance ended in his ruin.
無謀の投機に身を投ぜし結果破産するに至った
Rash speculation resulted in his bankruptcy.
この失錯が彼をして辞職するに至らしめた
The blunder led him to resign.
殴打死に至らしめた
The assault resulted in his death―They beat him to death.

content: 6. (=その極み何々するに至る)to go so far as to (do something); to go the length of (doing something)

content.content: 節倹の極み灯火までも倹約にするに至った
He carried his economy so far as to do without a lamp―carried his economy to the length of doing without a lamp.
その極み遂に彼を殺すに至った
They went so far as to kill him―went the length of killing him.

content: 7. (=至らざる無し)to carry (anything) to all lengths; to exhaust one's powers; to do everything in one's power

content.content: 暴行至らざる無し
They carried violence to all lengths.
彼らを奨励して至らざる無し
He exhausted his powers to encourage them―did everything in his power to encourage them.

content: 8. (=至らぬ)to come short; to fail:(形容詞に用いれば)imperfect; inexperienced; raw; green

content.content: 至らぬところ
one's shortcomings―failings―faults
至らぬところはどうぞそうおっしゃって下さい
You will please remind me of my faults.
誠に至らぬ者ですがどうぞよろしくお願い申します
I wish to place this raw youth under your care.

content:
いたるところ〔到る所〕
〈副〉Wherever one goes; everywhere; in every quarter; at every turn:(前置詞に訳せば)all over (the country); throughout (the land)

content.content: 彼は到るところに歓迎される
He is welcomed wherever he goes.
成金は到るところに傍若無人の振舞をした
The upstarts made themselves at home everywhere.
到るところで知人に逢った
I met an acquaintance at every turn.
全国到るところの雑貨店にあり
Sold by every grocer all over the country―throughout the land.
英語は世界到るところに通ずる
English is spoken all over the world―all the world over.
そんな物は全市到るところにある
Such things are to be found all over the city―in every quarter of the city.
埋骨何期
What though I may not lay my bones
墳墓地
Where my forefathers lie!
人間到処
Where'er I stay, I still may find
有青山
Some green spot where to die.

content:
いたるまで〔至る迄〕
〈前置詞相当〉To; up to; down to; till

content.content: 古より今日に至るまで
from ancient times down to the present
五月より八月に至るまで
from May till August
八時より十二時に至るまで
from 8 to 12
今日に至るまで
to this day―up to date―down to date
今日に至るまで事実がわからぬ
The fact remains unknown to this day.
今日に至るまでわかった事実はこれだけ
These are all the facts ascertained up to date―down to date.
上御一人より我々の果に至るまで各自尽すべき義務がある
From the Emperor down to ourselves, each man has his duty to perform.
微細な点に至るまで注意周到に研究してある
The matter is thoroughly investigated to the minutest details.

content:
いたれりつくせり〔至れり尽せり〕
〈形〉Thorough; thorough-going; thorough-paced

content.content: 彼は何事も至れり尽せりだ
He is thorough in everything―He leaves nothing to chance.
準備至れり尽せりだ
The preparations are thorough.

content:
いたわる〔労わる〕
〈他動〉To pity (the weak); to sympathize with (the unfortunate); to care for (the sick); to take care of (a child); to do well by (one's servants); to be kind to (one's wife, etc.)

content.content: 病人を労れ
Care for the sick!
弱者を労れ
Pity the weak!
彼はよく不幸な人を労る
He sympathizes with the unfortunate.
部下を労る
He does well by his subordinates.
よく妻子を労る
He is very kind to his wife and children.

content:
いたん〔異端〕
〈名〉Heresy:(=の) heretical

content.content: 異端を唱える
to advocate a heretical doctrine
異端者
a heretic

content:
いち〔位置〕
〈名〉
1. (=場所)situation; position; location; site

content.content: その家は位置が好い
The house stands in a good location―The house is well located.
学校は位置が好い
The school is well situated.
今度立つ学校の位置がまだ決まってない
The site for the new school is not yet fixed upon.

content: 2. (=人の位置)a situation; a place; standing

content.content: 僕は苦しい位置だ
I am in a delicate situation.
君は僕と位置を換えたならどうするか
What would you do (if you were) in my place?
僕をして君の位置に立たしめたならそんなことはせぬ
If I were you, I would not do such a thing.
僕は何を貰っても彼と位置を換えるのはいやだ
I would not change places with him―stand in his shoes―for the world.
彼は勉強ずくで位置を保っている
He keeps his place by dint of diligence.
外国人だから何をするにも損な位置に立っている
As he is a foreigner, he is at a disadvantage in doing anything.
位置のある人だ
He is a man of standing.
ちい〔地位〕

content:
いち〔一〕
〈名、形〉
1. One:(カルタやさいころの一は)ace

content.content: 第一
the first
第一にどんな本を読めばよいか
What sort of books shall I read in the first place?
一をもって万を知る
to infer the whole from one
その徳一にして足らず
His virtues are manifold.
一は不注意のため一は不幸のため、哀れや彼は滅亡に瀕している
What with negligence, what with misfortune, the poor fellow is on the brink of ruin.
一と言って二とは下らぬ
to be second to none
彼の英語は一と言って二とは下らぬ
He is second to none in English.
一二を争う
to contend for the first place
彼は大阪で一二を争う富豪だ
He is one of the richest men, if not the richest man, in Osaka.
一も二も無く
flatly―squarely―point-blank―peremptorily
一も二も無く断る
to refuse flatly―refuse squarely―refuse point-blank
一も二も無く断られた
I was met by a flat refusal.
一も二も無く発言を禁じられた
I was peremptorily forbidden to speak.
一か八かやってみよう
I will take my chance―take the chances―take the risks―risk it―chance it―put it to the hazard.
一を知って二を知らぬ
He knows only one side of the question.
一に看病二に薬
Nursing first and medicine next.
智者は一を聞いて十を知る
“A word to the wise is sufficient.”
彼は一から十までのことを知っている
He knows everything.
一から十までご命令通りに致しました
I have obeyed your orders in every particular.

content: 2. (=同一)the same; identical

content.content: 忠孝は一にして二ならず
Loyalty and filial piety are one and the same thing―identical.

content:
いち〔市〕
〈名〉(日々の市)a market:(定期の市)a fair

content.content: 市が立つ
There is a market―A market is held―There is a fair―A fair is held.
市の立つ町
a market-town
市の立つ日
a market-day
市へ行く
to go to market
市で売買する
One buys or sells in market.
品物を市へ出す
to send commodities to market
品物は市へ出すばかりだ
The goods are ready for the market.
馬市
a horse-fair

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 門前市をなす
The door is besieged by a crowd―He has a flood of callers.
市に虎を放つよう
It is letting loose a tiger upon a crowd.
あんな人を世に出すのは市へ虎を放つようなものだ
It is dangerous to let loose such men on society.

content:
いちい〔一位〕
〈名〉The first rank; the first place; the premier place

content.content: 一位を占める
to hold the first place―stand first
彼は優に第一位を占める
He is a safe first.

content:
いちい〔一意〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: せんしん〔専心〕

いちい〔水松〕
〈名〉A kind of yew-tree

content:
いちいせんしん〔一意専心〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: せんしん〔専心〕

content:
いちいち〔一々〕
〈副〉One by one; every one of them; without omission

content.content: 品物を一々手に取っては見ない
I did not look over the articles one by one.
さて一々手に取って見ると合格する品は少ないものだ
Now I come to examine the articles one by one, I find few of them pass muster.
生徒の名を一々は知らぬ
I do not know every one of the students by name.
名前は一々控えてある
I have noted down the names without omission.
僕の言うことを一々冷やかされては困る
You make fun of everything I say.
一々払うのは面倒だから月末に一緒に取りに来い
It is troublesome to pay every time, so bring a bill at the end of the month.
家ごとに一々訪問するのか
Do you visit from door to door?―pay a house-to-house visit?

content:
いちいん〔一員〕
〈名〉A member

content.content: 社会の一員
a member of society

いちいんせい〔一院制〕
〈名〉The single-chamber system

content:
いちえん〔一円〕
〈名〉The whole extent (of a district)

content.content: 損害は武蔵一円に行きわたっている
The damage extends over the whole of Musashi.

content:
いちおう〔一応〕
〈副〉Once; at first sight; in the first place; for form's sake; duly

content.content: 一応書類に目を通しておこう
I will look through the papers once.
君の言わるることも一応ごもっともだが僕は僕だけの意見がある
What you say is all very well at first sight, but I have my own views on the subject.
一応当人に聞いて見るのが順序だろう
We must, in the first place, ask the person concerned.
一応事実を確かめるのが順序だろう
We ought, in the first place, to ascertain the fact.
社長に一応相談した上でお返事を致します
I will give you an answer after consulting my president for form's sake.
一応お耳に入れておきます
You ought to be duly informed of that.
一応取調べた上でお返事を致します
I will give you an answer after due investigation.

content:
いちがいに〔一概に〕
〈副〉Sweepingly; indiscriminately; unqualifiedly

content.content: 一概に言う
to make a sweeping statement
一概にそうは言えぬ
The statement is too sweeping.
東京の学生だって一概に品行が悪いとは言えぬ
It would be too sweeping to say that Tokyo students are ill-conducted.
回々教だって一概に迷信とばかりは言えぬ
We are not justified in the unqualified statement that Mohammedanism is a superstition.
一概にけなす
to make a sweeping condemnation―condemn anything in the gross―condemn anything in the lump
彼は一概にそう思い込んでいる
He is possessed with the motion.

content:
いちがつ〔一月〕
〈名〉January

content.content: 一月三日
the 3rd of January―Jan. 3rd

content:
いちかばちか〔一か八か〕
〈副〉Sink or swim

content.content: 一か八かやってみよう
Sink or swim, I will try―I will take my chance―take the chance―chance it―take the risks―risk it―put it to the hazard.

content:
いちぎょう〔一行〕
〈名〉One line

content.content: 一行おきに書く
to write on every other line

いちぐん〔一群〕
〈名〉A crowd (of people); a throng (of pleasure-seekers); a group (of philosophers); a troop (of children); an army (of heroes); a bevy (of girls or quails); a galaxy (of beauties); a host (of angels); a gang (of convicts); a horde (of savages); a herd (of deer, cattle, wild horses, etc.); a flock (of sheep or geese); a drove (of oxen); a pack (of wolves); a flight (of swallows); a covey (of partridges); a swarm (of bees or mosquitoes); a shoal (of herrings); a school (of whales); a group (of islands); a cluster (of stars)

content:
いちげい〔一芸〕
〈名〉An art; a business

content.content: 一芸を極める
to make oneself master of one's business―(女なら)―make oneself mistress of one's business
一芸を極めた人だ
He is master of his business―She is mistress of her business.
一芸に達する
to become proficient in an art―attain proficiency in an art―perfect oneself in an art
彼は一芸に達している
He is proficient in his art.
一芸に秀でた人
a specialist

content:
いちげき〔一撃〕
〈名〉A blow

content.content: 一撃を加える
to deal one a blow―give one a blow
一撃の下に
at a blow
敵艦隊は一撃の下に全滅した
The enemy fleet was annihilated at a blow.

content:
いちげつ〔一月〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: いちがつ〔一月〕

content:
いちげん〔一言〕
〈名〉A word

content.content: 君子の一言は証文よりも確か
The word of a man of honour is as good as his bond.
あえて一言せん
I will speak a word on the subject.
このことについては一言せざるべからず
I can not pass over the matter unnoticed.
一言で尽している(一言もってこれをおおう)
The whole matter lies in a nutshell.
一言で尽せる
I can put the matter in a nutshell―give it in a nutshell.
一言の下に排斥する
to condemn anything at a word
一言の下に拒絶する
to refuse flatly―refuse point-blank
一言の下に拒絶された
I was met by a flat refusal.
一言一句いやしくもせず
He weighs every word he utters―He is choice of his words―He is guarded in his speech.

いちげんきん〔一絃琴〕
〈名〉A single-stringed instrument

content:
いちげんろん〔一元論〕
〈名〉Monism

content.content: 一元論者
a monist

content:
いちご〔一期〕
〈名〉An age

content.content: 哀れや彼は二十歳を一期として世を去った
He departed this life at the age of twenty.

content:
いちご〔苺〕
〈名〉A berry:(殊に)the strawberry

content.content: オランダ苺
the strawberry
木苺
the raspberry―the blackberry

content:
いちごん〔一言〕
〈名〉A word

content.content: 男子の一言、誓って本当だ
Upon my word,―Upon my word of honour,―it is true.
男子の一言、金鉄の如し
A word of honour is as good as a bond.
彼は一言も無く立ち去った
He left me without saying a word.
一言の挨拶も無く去った
He has left without notice.
一言一句いやしくもせず
He weighs every word he utters―He is choice of his words―He is guarded in his speech.
一言の下に排斥する
to condemn anything at a word
一言の下に拒絶する
to refuse flatly―refuse point-blank
一言の下に拒絶された
I was met by a flat refusal.
一言もってこれを蔽う
The whole matter lies in a nutshell.
そう出られりゃ一言も無い
That's a silencer―a poser―a clincher―a choker―a floorer―a staggerer.

content:
いちごんはんく〔一言半句〕
〈名〉(Not) a word; (not) a syllable

content.content: 一言半句も漏らすな
Do not breathe a syllable of it (to any one).
一言半句も出ない
Not a word can he utter―(問われてなら)―Not a word can he say in reply.

content:
いちざ〔一座〕
〈名〉
1. (=同席者)the company; the party:(=する) to attend the same party; to meet (one) at a party

content.content: 太鼓持は一座を浮かす
A buffoon entertains the company―sets the table in a roar.
一座が白ける
A chill comes over the party.
彼は一座の花だ
He is the life of the party―the life and soul of the party.
彼とは時々一座する
I often meet him at parties.
初めて彼と一座した
I met him at a party for the first time.

content: 2. (=役者の連中)a company, a troupe (of actors)

content.content: 河合一座
Kawai's troupe

content:
いちじ〔一事〕
〈名〉One thing

content.content: 一事が万事
One instance shows all―One instance shows the rest―The rest may be inferred―“One who steals a pin, will steal anything”―“One who steals an egg, will steal an ox.”

content:
いちじ〔一時〕
〈副〉
1. (=一度)once; one time

content.content: あの店は一時は栄えた
The firm flourished once.
一時有名であった学校
a once-famous school
あの人は一時は利けたものだ
He was somebody in his day.
一時金
a single sum―a lump sum
退職して一時金を貰う
to retire on a single sum
一時賜金
grant of a single sum―grant of a lump sum
一時払い
payment in a single sum―payment in a lump
一時に払う
to pay in a single sum―pay in a lump

content: 2. (=永久に対し)for a time; for a while; temporarily:(=の) temporary; momentary; passing

content.content: 君の禁酒は一時か永久か
Have you given up drinking only for a time or for good and all?―Is your abstinence temporary or permanent?
悪人も一時は栄える
The wicked may prosper for a while―“The devil's child has the devil's luck.”
一時の出来心
an impulse of the moment
一時の出来心でしたことなら罪は軽い
If he acted on the impulse of the moment, he is not much to blame.
問うは一時の恥、問わぬは一生の恥
Be not ashamed to ask, and you escape a lifelong shame.
これだけあれば一時しのぎがつく
This sum will help me to tide over the crisis―bridge over the difficulty.
彼は一時の慰みにその女と関係したのだ
He intrigued with the girl for the amusement of the hour―to beguile an idle hour.
一時の景気
a boom
一時の考え
a passing fancy
一時の間に合わせ
a temporary expedient―a stop-gap
一時のがれに言ったのさ
I only made a temporary excuse―temporized.
一時雇い
a temporary employee
(政府の)一時借入金
a floating debt―an unfunded debt

いちじきょう〔一事狂〕
〈名〉Monomania

content:
いちじきん〔一時金〕
〈名〉A single sum; a lump sum

content.content: 一時金を賜わる
to be granted a single sum
退職して一時金を貰う
to retire on a single sum

content:
いちじく〔無花果〕
〈名〉The fig

content.content: 無花果の木
a fig-tree

いちじしきん〔一時賜金〕
〈名〉Grant of a single sum; grant of a lump sum

content:
いちじつ〔一日〕
〈名〉A day

content.content: 一日千秋の思いであった
The day dragged on.
一日千秋の思いで待った
I waited a weary day.
一日千秋の思いで幾日も幾日も待った
I waited many a weary day.
この職にあること十年一日の如し
He filled the post for ten years as one day.

content: 〈副詞〉One day:(は過去、未来は)some day

いちじほうていしき〔一次方程式〕
〈名〉A simple equation

content:
いちじょ〔一助〕
〈名〉A help; an aid

content.content: 社会進歩の一助ともならん
It will serve as an aid to social progress.

content:
いちじょう〔一場〕
〈名〉A scene

content.content: 一場の悲劇を演ずる
to enact a tragedy
一場の喜劇を演ずる
to enact a comedy
一場の演説を試みる
to make a speech
一場の演説を求める
to call upon one to make a speech
栄華は春宵一場の夢
Splendour is but a summer night's dream.

content:
いちじょう〔一条〕
〈名〉
1. (=ひと筋)a line; a stripe

content.content: 一条の路
a path
一条の流れ
a stream

content: 2. (=事件)an affair; a matter

content.content: 彼の一条もすんだ
The matter is settled.

content:
いちじるしい〔著しい〕
〈形〉Remarkable (progress); marked (difference); striking (figure); signal (victory); conspicuous (figure); notable (fact); noteworthy (fact); patent (fact); (to be) in evidence

content.content: 彼は著しく進歩した
He has made remarkable progress.
十九世紀は科学が著しく進歩した
Science made remarkable progress in the Nineteenth Century.
これとかれとは著しい差がある
There is a marked difference between the two.
本年の外国貿易は著しく増進した
Foreign trade shows a marked increase this year.
その場に著しい姿が現れた
A conspicuous figure appeared on the scene―A striking figure broke on the scene.
西洋館と土人の小屋とは著しき対照をなす
The foreign houses and the native huts form a striking contrast―present a marked contrast.
彼は著しい成功を獲得した
He achieved a signal success.
これは著しい事実である
This is a notable fact―a noteworthy fact―a patent fact.
欧州大戦では飛行機の働きが著しかった
The aeroplane was in evidence in the European war.

content:
いちじん〔一人〕
〈名〉The Emperor

content.content: 上御一人より我々の果てに至るまで
from the Emperor down to ourselves

content:
