〈名〉One dog

content.content: 一犬吠えれば万犬
One barking dog sets the whole street barking.
一犬虚を吠ゆれば万犬実を伝う
One dog bays the moon, and the whole street barks in earnest.

content:
いっけん〔一見〕
〈名〉A look; a sight; a glance; a glimpse:(=する) to take a look at, have a look at (anything); to cast a glance at (anything); to catch a glimpse of (anything)

content.content: 一見して
at a glance
彼は一見して非凡な人だということがわかる
You can see at a glance that he is no common being.
一見して悪計を看破した
I saw through his design at a glance―One glance was enough for me to see through his design.
この話の嘘なことは一見して明らかだ
One may see with half an eye that the story is false―He who runs may read that the story is false―The story is false on the face of it.
一見したところでは
at first sight―at the first blush―prima facie
一見したところではおかしな説だ
The statement sounds strange at first sight.
百聞一見に如かず
Seeing is better than hearing―“One eye-witness is better than ten hearsays.”
一見旧知の如し
It seemed as if they had known each other for an age.

content: 〈副〉Apparently; seemingly

content.content: 彼は一見痴鈍の如し
He is apparently stupid.
彼の一見痴鈍らしいのは長く脳病を煩ったためだ
His seeming stupidity comes of a long brain disease.

content:
いっけん〔一軒〕
〈名〉One house

content.content: 彼は一軒ごとに遊説して歩く
He goes canvassing from house to house―from door to door.

content:
いっけんだち〔一軒立ち〕
〈名〉A house standing by itself

content.content: 家は邸内に一軒立ち
The house stands in its own grounds.

content:
いっけんや〔一軒屋〕
〈名〉A solitary house

content.content: 山中の一軒家
a solitary cottage among the mountains

content:
いっこ〔一個〕
〈名、形〉One

content.content: これは一個いくらか
How much are they each?―How much apiece?
この蜜柑は一個三十銭
These oranges are thirty sen each―thirty sen apiece.
一個五十銭に買った
I bought them at fifty sen apiece.
僕は一個の教員に過ぎぬ
I am only a teacher.
一個一個の人(物)
individual persons―individual objects

content:
いっこ〔一己〕
〈名〉Oneself:(=の) one's own; personal; private

content.content: これは私一己の考えです
This is my personal opinion―my private opinion.
私一己の所存ではご返事致しかねます
I can not give you an answer on my own judgment―on my own authority―on my own responsibility.
僕一己としては異存は無い
Personally,―For myself,―Myself,―I have no objection.

content:
いっこ〔一戸〕
〈名〉A house; a household

content.content: 一戸をかまえる
to keep house―keep one's own house
一戸をかまえている人(戸主)
a householder
保証人は一戸を有する者に限る
The surety must be a householder.

content:
いっこ〔一顧〕
〈名〉A notice:(=する) to notice

content.content: 一顧の価値無し
It is unworthy of notice―It is beneath notice.

いっこいっこの〔一個一個の〕
〈形〉Individual (persons of things)

content:
いっこう〔一向〕
〈副〉Quite; (not) at all; (not) in the least

content.content: 僕は暑い寒いはいっこう平気だ
I am quite indifferent about heat or cold.
いっこう疲れません
I am not tired at all―not in the least tired.
その事はいっこう存じません
I know nothing of the matter.
そんなことはいっこうかまいません
I do not care a straw about it.

content:
いっこう〔一考〕
〈名〉A thought:(=する) to give a thought to, bestow a thought on (a matter)

content.content: この件についてはぜひご一考を煩わしたい
You will please bestow a thought on the matter.

content:
いっこう〔一行〕
〈名〉A party; one's suite; one's troupe

content.content: 一向に加わる
to join the party―make one (of the party)
彼は一行中の元気者だ
He is the life of the party.
一行の人々
the members of the party
大使の一行
the ambassador and suite
鶴ケ浜の一行
Tsurugahama's troupe

content:
いっこく〔一刻〕
〈名〉A short space of time; a moment

content.content: 一刻も早く
The sooner, the better―without a moment's delay.
一刻も早く病人の手当てをしろ
You must lose no time in attending to the patient―The patient needs prompt attention.
一刻を争う
Time is precious―Every moment is precious―There is no time to lose―There is not a moment to be lost.
一刻千金
Every moment is golden―Time is money.

いっこくもの〔一国者〕
〈名〉
1. (=強情者)an obstinate person; a stubborn fellow; a headstrong fellow; an opinionated man
2. (=怒りっぽい人)a touchy man; a choleric man; a quick-tempered man; a short-tempered man; a hot-tempered man

content:
いっこじん〔一個人〕
〈名〉An individual; a private person:(=の) individual; personal; private

content.content: 一個人としては
as an individual―individually―personally
同じ役所には勤めているが、一個人としては彼とは何の関係も無い
We serve in the same office, but I have no personal relations with him.
支那人は一個人としてはなかなか開けている
The Chinese are individually―as individuals―highly civilized.
一個人の資格で訪問した
I called on him in my private capacity―in my individual capacity―in the capacity of a private individual.

content:
いつごろ〔何時頃〕
〈疑問副詞〉When?

content.content: いつごろ行ったら彼はいるだろうか
When shall I find him at home?
雲井龍雄はいつごろの人か
When did Kumoi Tatsuo live?
君はいつごろからここに居るか
How long have you been here?
いつごろまでここに居るか
How long shall you stay here?

content:
いっこん〔一献〕
〈名〉A cup of sake offered

content.content: 一献さし上げたい
I wish to offer you a glass of wine―Will you honour me with your company at a party?

content:
いっさい〔一災〕
〈名〉A calamity

content.content: 一災起これば二災
“Misfortunes never come singly.”

content:
いっさい〔一切〕
〈副〉All; wholly; altogether:(打消に伴えば)never:(=の) all; every

content.content: いっさいで費用はいくらかかるか
What will it cost in all?
訴訟その他いっさいの事件を取扱う
Actions at law and all other matters accepted.
事務上のことはいっさい田中君に委任してある
All business matters are committed to the management of Mr. Tanaka.
僕は勝負ごとはいっさいやらないことにしている
I abstain from all sporting.
事の真相はいっさい秘密に付してある
Absolute secrecy is preserved as to the truth of the affair.
本件にはいっさい関係無し
I have no hand in the affair―no art or part in the affair.
掛け売一切不仕候
We never sell on credit.

いっさいがっさい〔一切合切〕
〈名、副〉Any and everything; altogether
いっさいしゅうじょう

いっさいしゅうじょう〔一再衆生〕
〈名〉All living things; all life; all flesh

いっさいたふ〔一妻多夫〕
〈名〉Polyandry

content:
いっさいならず〔一再ならず〕
〈副〉Not once or twice; more than once; several times

content.content: 彼に一再ならず注意した
I have warned him several times.

content:
いっさく〔一策〕
〈名〉A plan

content.content: 一策を案じ出した
I have thought of a plan―hit upon an idea.
一策を献じよう
I will suggest a plan―make a suggestion.

いっさくさくじつ〔一昨昨日〕
〈名〉Three days ago

いっさくさくじつ〔一昨昨日〕
〈名〉Three days ago

いっさくさくねん〔一昨昨年〕
〈副〉Last year but two; three years ago

いっさくさくねん〔一昨昨年〕
〈副〉Last year but two; three years ago

いっさくさくや〔一昨昨夜〕
〈副〉Last night but two; three nights ago

いっさくさくや〔一昨昨夜〕
〈副〉Last night but two; three nights ago

content:
いっさくじつ〔一昨日〕
〈名、副〉The day before yesterday

content.content: 一昨日の朝
the morning before last
一昨日の晩
the evening before last

いっさくねん〔一昨年〕
〈名、副〉The year before last

いっさくや〔一昨夜〕
〈名、副〉The night before last

content:
いっさつ〔一札〕
〈名〉A document; a paper

content.content: 後日のため一札お認め下さい
Please sign a paper for future reference.

content:
いっさんに〔逸散に〕
〈副〉At the top of one's speed

content.content: 一人の男がいっさんに走って来た
A man came running at the top of his speed―making a bee-line.

content:
いっし〔一死〕
〈名〉Death

content.content: 一死もって国恩に報ずる
to repay one's debt to one's country with one's life
一死もって赤誠を証す
to seal one's devotion with one's blood

content:
いつじ〔逸事〕
〈名〉An anecdote

content.content: あれは逸事の多い人だ
He is full of anecdotes―His life is rich in anecdotes.

content:
いつしか〔何時しか〕
〈副〉Before one knows; before we know where we are

content.content: 彼はいつしか行ってしまった
He was gone before I knew.
いつしか夏が来る
Summer will be here before we know where we are.
いつしか時が経つ
Time slips away―Time glides on.

content:
いっしき〔一式〕
〈名〉A complete set (of tools); a suite (of furniture); a stand (of arms)

content.content: 道具一式
a complete set of tools
茶道具一式
a set of tea-things
勝手道具一式
a complete set of kitchen utensils
家具一式
a suite of furniture
銃及び付属品一式
a stand of arms

いっしじん〔一私人〕
〈名〉A private individual

content:
いっしそうでん〔一子相伝〕
〈名〉Transmission to one son

content.content: 奥義は一子相伝になっている
The mysteries of the art are transmitted to only one son―handed down to only one son.

content:
いっしどうじん〔一視同仁〕
〈名〉Regarding all men with equal love; universal brotherhood

content.content: 彼は一視同仁主義をとっている
He regards all men with equal love―He is an advocate of universal brotherhood.

content:
いっしはんせん〔一紙半銭〕
〈名〉A mere trifle

content.content: 彼は一紙半銭といえども無駄にせぬ
He never wastes the merest trifle.
一紙半銭を惜しむ
He grudges the veriest trifle.

content:
いっしみだれず〔一糸乱れず〕
〈熟語〉To be in perfect order

content.content: 日本艦隊は一糸乱れず整然としておった
The Japanese squadron kept in perfect order.

いっしゃく〔一酌〕
〈名〉A drink; a glass of wine

content:
いっしゃせんり〔一瀉千里〕
〈副〉Full drive; full gallop; like wildfire

content.content: 過激思想が一瀉千里の勢で広がった
Bolshevism spread like wildfire.
一瀉千里の勢で書く
He writes full drive.
一瀉千里の勢で用をかたづける
Business is despatched full gallop.
彼は一瀉千里の勢で述べ立てた
He dashed along full drive.

content:
いっしゅ〔一種〕
〈名〉A kind; a sort; a species:(=の) a kind of (animal); a sort of (wisdom); a species of (rose, etc.)

content.content: 竹は草の一種である
The bamboo is a kind of grass.
賭は一種のばくちである
Betting is a form of gambling.
彼には一種のこっけいがある
He has a sort of humour―He is humourous in a sort―He is a wag in his way.
一種の天才がある
He has a sort of genius―He is a genius in a sense.
侠客は一種の崇拝を受けている
The commoner's champion is worshipped after his sort.
その話には一種のこっけいなところがある
There is something comical in the story.
一種異様な臭気が鼻をつく
A strange smell greets your nose.
この語には一種特別な用法がある
The word has a special use.
この果物には一種特別な香がある
The fruit has a peculiar flavour.
いたるところに傍若無人の振舞いをする点においては英国人は一種特別の才がある
For making himself at home wherever he goes, John Bull has a talent all his own.

content:
いっしゅう〔一周〕
〈名〉One round; a revolution; a circumnavigation:(競走場の一周)a lap:(=する) to sail round (the world); to go round, revolve round (the sun); to circumnavigate (the globe); to make a revolution; to run a lap

content.content: 世界を一周する
to sail round the world―circumnavigate the globe
Magellan というポルトガル人が初めて世界を一周した
Magellan, the Portuguese, was the first to sail round the world.
世界一周旅行
a tour round the world―a round-the-world trip
地球は一年で太陽を一周する
The earth goes round the sun―revolves round the sun―in a year.
一枚の新聞が近所を一周する
One paper goes the round―makes the round―of the neighbourhood.

content:
いっしゅう〔一週〕
〈名〉A week

content.content: 一週三回
three times a week
米国では下宿を一週いくらで決める
In America, they board by the week.

content:
いっしゅうかん〔一週間〕
〈名〉A week:(副詞に用いれば)for a week

content.content: あそこに一週間おった
I stayed there for a week.

content:
いっしゅうき〔一周忌〕
〈名〉The first anniversary of one's death

content.content: 明日は親の一周忌に当たる
Tomorrow is the First Anniversary of my father's death.

content:
いっしゅうき〔一周期〕
〈名〉A period

content.content: 金星の一周期
a period of Venus

いっしゅうねん〔一周年〕
〈名〉The first anniversary

content:
いっしゅうりょこう〔一周旅行〕
〈名〉A round trip

content.content: 世界一周旅行
a tour round the world―a round-the-world trip

いっしゅつ〔溢出〕
〈名〉Overflow; extravasation (of blood):(=する) to overflow; to extravasate

content:
いっしゅとくべつ〔一種特別〕
〈形〉Special; peculiar

content.content: この語には一種特別の用法がある
The word has a special use.
この果物は一種特別の香がある
This fruit has a peculiar flavour.
その点においては一種特別の才を有しておる
For that, he has a talent of his own―a talent of his own―a talent all his own.

いっしゅんかん〔一瞬間〕
〈名〉A twinkling; a moment; an instant:(副詞に用いれば)for a moment; for an instant

content:
いっしょ〔一緒〕
〈副〉
1. (=共に)together:(前置詞に用いれば)with; together with; along with; in company with:(=の) the same

content.content: 彼と学校は一緒だ
We attend the same school.
兄弟は一緒に住んでいる
The brothers live together―live in the same house.
一緒に来給え
Come along (with me)!
僕も一緒に行こう
I will go with you.
道が違うから一緒に行けない
I can not go with you, for we are going different ways.
途中まで一緒に行こう
I will go with you a part of the way.
誰かに一緒に行って貰おう
I will get some one to go with me.
従兄弟と一緒に上京しました
I came to town in company with my cousin.
二人はめったに一緒にならない
We are seldom in each other's company.
人と一緒になる
to join a companion
友達が運動場にいたから行って一緒になった
I joined some companions who were in the play-ground.
僕は連中と一緒になった
I joined the party.
君も一緒に行かないか
Won't you join us?―Won't you make one (of the party)?
一緒に何かする
to join in doing something
人が話しをしていても彼は一緒に話さない
He never joins in our talk.
彼奴までが一緒になって僕の悪口を言った
He impertinently joined in abusing me.
僕も一緒にその事業をやろう
I will join in the undertaking.
先生も一緒になって遊戯をやる
The teacher joins in the games.
五年生も一緒に騒いだ
The Fifth Year students joined in the riot.
違うものを一緒にする
to confound one thing with another―mix up one thing with another
名詞と動詞を一緒にする奴があるものか
Who ever heard of one confounding nouns with verbs?―mixing up nouns and verbs?

content: 2. (=同時に)at the same time; all at once; all together

content.content: 彼と僕は一緒に学校へ入った
He and I entered the school at the same time.
僕と一緒に電車を降りた人があった
A man got out of the car at the same time as myself.
そう一緒に口を出してはいかん
You must not speak all at once.
(先生が生徒に向かって)さあ一緒に
Now, all together!
盆と正月が一緒に来たよう
It is as if the four quarter-days had come together.

content: 3. (=まとめて)in the gross; in the lump; in a lump

content.content: 一年分の給料を一緒に貰った
I received a year's pay in a lump.
あんな奴らと一緒にされちゃ割に合わない
It does not pay to be lumped with such fellows.
一々払うのは面倒だから月末に一緒に取りに来い
It is troublesome to pay every time. Bring a bill at the end of the month.
一緒になる(夫婦になる)
to be united―be joined―be married―be spliced
二人は一緒になるのを楽しみにしている
They look forward to being united.
二人を一緒にする
to marry the two―unite a couple―join a couple

content:
いっしょ〔一書〕
〈名〉A letter

content.content: 未だ拝顔の栄を得ず候えども失礼を顧みず一書拝呈仕候
I take the liberty of addressing you―I make bold to write to you―though I have not the honour of your acquaintance.

content:
いっしょう〔一将〕
〈名〉A general

content.content: 一将功成って万骨枯る
“The many must perish for the one.”

content:
いっしょう〔一章〕
〈名〉A chapter

content.content: 第一章
Chapter Ⅰ

content:
いっしょう〔一笑〕
〈名〉A laugh; a smile:(=する) to laugh a laugh; to smile a smile

content.content: 一笑に付す、一笑し去る
to laugh a matter off―dismiss the subject with a laugh
一笑に付して話頭を転じた
He changed the subject with a laugh.
美人の一笑を買う
to win a beauty's smile
一笑にも価せぬ
It is beneath contempt.

content:
いっしょう〔一生〕
〈名〉One's life; a lifetime:(副詞に用いれば)for life; through life; all one's life; as long as one lives; to the end of one's life:(=の) lifelong

content.content: 一生の連合いを選ぶのは人間一生の大事だ
On the choice of a partner for life depends a lifelong happiness or misery.
一生独身で暮らす
to live single all one's life―continue single through life―(男なら)―remain a bachelor through life―live and die a bachelor―(女なら)―live and die a virgin
彼は一生独身で暮らした
He remained a bachelor all his life―continued single to the end of his days.
彼は一生安楽に暮らした
He lived at his ease all his life―He lived an easy life.
それから一生楽隠居で暮らした
He spent the remainder of his life in easy retirement.
一生を捧げる
to devote one's life to some cause
彼は一生を科学研究に送った
He devoted his life to scientific researches.
一生の不具者となる
to become a cripple for life―a lifelong cripple
これが僕の一生の仕事だ
This is my life-work.
これが一生の別れになるかも知れぬ
This may prove a parting for life―This may be our last meeting.
小生一生の恨事にて候
It will be a lifelong regret with me―a matter for my lasting regret.
一生を棒に振る
to waste one's life
このご恩は一生忘れません
I shall remember your kindness as long as I live―the longest day I have to live.
女は一度操を破ると一生の疵物だ
If a woman once loses her chastity, she is ruined for life.
一生に一度は行ってみたいものだ
I should like to be there once in my lifetime.
一生かかっても読み切れないほど本がある
I have more books than I can read in my lifetime―I have books enough to last me all my life.
こんなところにいては一生頭が上がらない
I shall never be able to hold up my head in my present situation.
一生のお願いです、聴いて下さい
For Heaven's sake, grant my request!
九死に一生を得る
to have a narrow escape―be snatched from the jaws of death
悪筆は一生の損
A bad handwriting is a lifelong curse.
問うは一時の恥問わぬは一生の恥
Be not ashamed to ask, and you escape a lifelong shame.
泣いて暮らすも一生笑って暮らすも一生
Better live a merry life than a sad one.
父無し子は女の一生の恥
A bastard is a standing reproach to his mother.
習うは一生
Live and learn.

content:
いっしょういっぱい〔一勝一敗〕
〈名〉Victory and defeat

content.content: 一勝一敗は兵家の常
Success or failure is incidental to warfare.

content:
いっしょうがい〔一生涯〕
〈副〉All one's life (through); through life; throughout the whole course of one's life

content.content: 彼は一生涯科学を研究した
He devoted himself to scientific researches throughout the whole course of his existence.

content:
いっしょうけんめい〔一生懸命〕
〈副〉For one's life; for dear life; with might and main; hammer and tongs; tooth and nail

content.content: 一生懸命逃げた
I ran for my life.
一生懸命つかまっていた
I held on for dear life.
一生懸命働いた
I worked with might and main.
一生懸命やれ
Go at it tooth and nail!―Go it hammer and tongs!
彼は成功するつもりで一生懸命になっている
He is doing his utmost―straining every nerve―to succeed.

content:
いっしょく〔一食〕
〈名〉A meal

content.content: 一食いくら取るか
What do they charge you for a meal?

いっしん〔一審〕
〈名〉The first instance

content:
いっしん〔一心〕
〈名〉Whole-heartedness; intentness; concentration of mind:(=の) whole-hearted; intent; intense:(=に) whole-heartedly; intently; intensely

content.content: 一心になる、一心込める
to concentrate one's mind upon anything―set one's heart on anything―be bent on doing anything―be intent on anything―be the whole man at anything―set one's countenance―set one's eyes
一心込めればできないことは無い
Concentration of mind will enable a man to do anything.
一心は恐ろしいものだ
Such is the power of concentration.
一心は恐ろしいもので、どんな困難でも打ち勝てる
Such is the power of concentration that it will enable one to overcome any difficulty.
彼は一心に勉強している
He is intent on his studies.
勉強に一心だから余事を省る暇が無い
He is too intent on his studies to think of anything else.
彼は一心に目的を遂げようとしている
He is bent on accomplishing his purpose.
勉強する時は一心に勉強し、遊ぶ時は一心に遊べ
Be the whole man at anything―Work while you work, and play while you play.
皆一心になって勝負を見ていた
They watched the contest with set countenance―with set eyes.
一心になって聴いている
They are all attention―all ears.
ばかの一心
Even a fool, when his heart is set on one thing, will do wonders.
一心込めた注意
intense attention
一心込めた勉強
intense application
一心込めた考え
intense thought

content:
いっしん〔一新〕
〈名〉Renewal; renovation; a reform; a revolution; a complete change:(=する) to renew; to renovate; to reform; to revolutionize; to find it brick and leave it marble:(自動詞に用いれば)to undergo a complete change

content.content: あの学校ができて英語教授法を一新した
That school has revolutionized―wrought a revolution in―the method of teaching English.
日本の国民生活が一新した
The national life of Japan has completely changed―undergone a complete change.
彼は都内を一新した
He has effected a sweeping reform in the service.
生活を一新する
to turn over a new leaf―put on the new man
面目を一新する
to undergo a transformation
鉄道が通じてから市は面目を一新した
Since the railway communication was opened, the city has undergo a complete transformation―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The railway has transformed the city.
学校は面目を一新した
It is quite a new school.
彼が校長になって学校は面目を一新した
He found the school brick and left it marble.

content:
いっしん〔一身〕
〈名〉Oneself; one's welfare; one's life

content.content: 一身を立てる
to establish oneself in life―advance in life―get on in life
国家の為に一身を犠牲にする
to sacrifice oneself for one's country
一身上に関する大事だ
The matter concerns my welfare―The matter lies near my heart―lies next my heart―The matter concerns me nearly―It is a near concern.
友人達が僕の一身上について心配してくれる
My friends are concerned for my welfare.
一身に関する大事な事をする
to take a step in life
一身上の大事件が起こった
A great event has happened to me.
一身を誤る
to fall into error―drift into error
一身の利益を図る
to look to one's own interests―look to the main chance―have an eye to the main chance
教育の為に一身を投じている
He has devoted himself―committed himself―to the cause of education.
彼は一身を賭して人を助けた
He saved others at the risk of his life.
彼は衆望を一身に集めている
He is the centre of all hopes―All hopes are centred on him.
夫婦は一身同体となる
Man and wife become one flesh.
一心同体の友
one's second self―one's alter ego

content:
いっしんいったい〔一進一退〕
〈名〉Advance and retreat

content.content: 彼の病気は一進一退ではかばかしくない
His illness hangs in the balance.

content:
いっしんきょう〔一神教〕
〈名〉Monotheism

content.content: 一神教徒
a monotheist

content:
いっしんじょう〔一身上〕
〈名〉One's welfare

content.content: 一身上に関する大事だ
The matter concerns my welfare―The matter lies near my heart―lies next my heart―The matter concerns me nearly―It is a near concern.
友人達は僕の一身上について心配してくれる
My friends are concerned for my welfare.
一身上に関する大事な事をする
to take a step in life
結婚は一身上に関する一大事だ
Marriage is an important step in life.
一身上に大事件が起こった
A great event has happened to me.

content:
いっしんどうたい〔一心同体〕
〈名〉One flesh

content.content: 夫婦は一心同体になる
Man and wife become one flesh.
一心同体の友
one's second self―one's alter ego

content:
いっしんふらん〔一心不乱〕
〈形〉Intent, bent (on anything):(=に) intently; with set eyes; with set countenance

content.content: 彼は一心不乱に勉強している
He is working intently―intent on his studies.
学問に一心不乱だから余事を省る暇が無い
He is too intent on his studies to think of anything else.
彼は一心不乱に目的を遂げようとしている
He is bent on accomplishing his purpose.
皆一心不乱に勝負を見ていた
They watched the contest with set eyes―with set countenance.
一心不乱に聴いている
They are all attention―all ears.

content:
いっすい〔一睡〕
〈名〉A wink of sleep:(=する) to get a wink of sleep

content.content: 一睡を貪る
to get a wink of sleep―snatch a short sleep
昨夜は一睡もしなかった
I did not get a wink of sleep―did not sleep a wink―last night.

content:
いっする〔逸する〕
〈他動〉To miss, let slip (an opportunity); to deviate from (a course)

content.content: 機会を逸する
to miss an opportunity―let slip an opportunity
君は千載一遇の機会を逸してしまったのだ
You have thrown away a golden opportunity.
機会を逸するな
“Take time by the forelock.”
この機逸するべからず
Now is the time, or never―Now or never!
常軌を逸する
to deviate from the normal course of action―leave the beaten track
常軌を逸した行動
erratic behaviour―escapades
彼の行動は常軌を逸している
He indulges in erratic behaviour―He makes escapades―He is eccentric.

content: 〈自動〉To run away; to scamper away

content.content: 馬逸す
A horse got loose―broke loose.

content:
いっすん〔一寸〕
〈名〉One tenth of a foot

content.content: あの人は一寸さきも見えない
He can not see an inch before him.
(暗くて)一寸先も見えない
We can not see an inch ahead.
戸の口一寸出られない
There is no stirring a step out of doors.
一寸先は闇の世
The future is a sealed book―Life is not worth an hour's purchase.
飲めや歌えや一寸先は闇よ
“Eat and drink and make merry, for tomorrow you die.”
一寸の虫にも五分の魂
“A worm will turn.”―“A fly has its anger.”
一寸の光陰軽んずべからず
Improve every moment.
一寸伸びれば一尋{ひろ}伸びる
Get an inch, and you get an ell.

一寸試めし五分試めし
いっすんだめしごぶだめし

いっすんだめしごぶだめし〔一寸試めし五分試めし〕
〈熟語〉To hew and hack (a man); to hew (a man) to pieces

content:
いっすんのがれ〔一寸遁れ〕
〈名〉An excuse for putting one off

content.content: 一寸のがれを言う
to put one off with an excuse

いっすんぼうし〔一寸法師〕
〈名〉A dwarf; a manikin

content:
いっせ〔一世〕
〈名〉One life; one existence

content.content: 親子は一世
The relation between parent and child holds good for one existence only.

content:
いっせい〔一世〕
〈名〉An age; a generation

content.content: 一世を驚かす
to astonish one's generation―do wonders―set the river on fire
一世の豪傑なりき
He was the greatest man of his age.
彼は一世の師表として仰がれた
He was looked up to as the Crichton of his age.
英名一世に冠たり
His fame was the highest in his age.
Napoleon 一世
Napoleon Ⅰ(the First―と読む)

いっせい〔一声〕
〈名〉A voice; a cry

いっせいき〔一世紀〕
〈名〉A century

content:
いっせいしゃげき〔一斉射撃〕
〈名〉A salvo(は大砲):(小銃なら)a volley; volley-firing

content.content: いっせい射撃を行う
(小銃なら)to fire a volley―(大砲なら)―give a salvo―(片舷なら)fire a broadside―discharge a broadside―deliver a broadside
(小銃の)連続いっせい射撃
a fusillade

content:
いっせいちだい〔一世一代〕
〈名〉A lifetime

content.content: 一世一代の作だ
It is the greatest work of his life.
一世一代のできであった
It was the greatest success of his life.
一世一代の芝居
one's last appearance on the stage
一世一代の芝居をする
He will appear on the stage for the last time.

content:
いっせいに〔一斉に〕
〈名〉Simultaneously; in concert; in a chorus; in a breath; with one voice

content.content: 皆いっせに叫んだ
They cried out in concert―in a chorus―in a breath.
いっせいに「然り」と叫んだ
They cried out “Yes” with one voice.

content:
いっせいめん〔一生面〕
〈名〉A new field

content.content: 研究の一生面を開く
to open a new field of inquiry

content:
いっせき〔一席〕
〈名〉A sitting; a game (at go)

content.content: この詩は一席には読み切れぬ
This poem is too long to be read at a sitting.
一席に千円取られた
He lost 1,000 yen at a sitting.
一席願いましょうか
Shall we have a game?
一席弁ずる
to make a speech―deliver a speech
(落語家が)罪の無いお噺を一席伺います
I will tell you a story that will make you laugh.

いっせつ〔一節〕
〈名〉A paragraph:(詩の一節)a stanza:(聖書の一節)a verse:(語の一節)a syllable

content:
いっせつ〔一説〕
〈名〉Another statement; another version (of the story)

content.content: 一説には義経が満洲へ渡ったともいう
Some say that Yoshitsune went over to Manchuria.

content:
いっせつな〔一刹那〕
〈名〉An instant; a moment

content.content: 土手の上に顔を出した一せつな銃弾が飛んで来てあたった
A bullet came flying and hit him at the instant he showed his face above the bank.

content:
いっせん〔一戦〕
〈名〉A battle; a fight; an engagement:(=する) to fight a battle

content.content: 一戦に勝敗を決せん
We will decide the war by a single battle―fight a decisive battle.

content:
いっせんする〔一洗する〕
〈他動〉To wash away

content.content: 悪弊を一洗する
to wash away all abuses

content:
いっそ
〈副〉Rather; sooner; better; first

content.content: 生きて恥をかくならいっそ死んだ方がましだ
I would rather die than live in dishonour―I would sooner die than live in dishonour―I would as soon die as live in dishonour―I should prefer death to dishonour―I would choose death before dishonour.
(そんなことをするくらいなら)いっそ死んでしまう
I would die first.
いっそ止し給え
You had better give it up―Better give it up!
いっそひと思いに殺しておくれ
Release me from my miseries―Put an end to my miseries―Put me out of misery.

content:
いっそう〔一層〕
〈副〉More; still more; the more; all the more; only the more

content.content: 今後はいっそう勉強します
I will work harder in future.
これからはいっそう慎みます
I will be still more careful in future.
ばかな子はいっそう可愛い
A dunce is all the dearer to his parents.
時がたてばたつほどいっそうむつかしくなる
Time will make it only the more difficult.
その光景は意外なだけにいっそう面白かった
The sight was the more amusing as it was unexpected.

content:
いっそう〔一艘〕
〈名〉A ship

content.content: 一艘の帆船
a sailing ship
船一艘の金銀
a shipload of treasure

content:
いっそうする〔一掃する〕
〈他動〉To sweep away (abuses); to make a clear sweep of (old furniture); to clear (the sea of pirates); to carry everything with it

content.content: 弊害を一掃する
to sweep away abuses
老朽者を一掃する
to make a clean sweep of superannuated officials
この海上より海賊を一掃せん
I will clear these seas of pirates.
彼が笑うと欝気を一掃する
His laugh clears the air―clears the atmosphere.
雪なだれは路に当たるものをことごとく一掃する
An avalanche carries everything with it.

いっそうする〔逸走する〕
〈自動〉To scamper away

content:
いっそく〔一足〕
〈名〉A pair

content.content: 靴一足
a pair of shoes

content:
いっそくとびに〔一足飛びに〕
〈副〉At a bound; at a jump; at a leap

content.content: 彼は一足飛びに大臣になった
He rose at a bound to be a minister.
物価は一足飛びに騰貴した
The prices have made a jump.

content:
いつぞや〔日外〕
〈副〉Once; one time; one day; the other day

content.content: いつぞや園遊会でその人に逢った
I met him once at a garden party.
これがいつぞやお話しの本ですか
Is this the book you spoke of the other day?

content:
いったい〔一体〕
〈名〉One body; one flesh

content.content: 君臣一体
Sovereign and subject are united into one body.
夫婦は一体となる
Man and wife become one flesh.

content:
〈副〉
1. (=また実際)in fact

content.content: いったい君が悪い
In fact, you are to blame.
いったい君の言うことが間違っている
In fact, you are wrong.
いったいこの本が気に入らない
In fact, the book is not to my taste.

content: 2. (=概して)generally

content.content: 彼は一体品行が悪い
He is generally ill-conducted.
彼は一体勉強しない
He does not work hard at the best of times.

content: 3. (=いったいあるのか)(any) at all?

content.content: いったい君は金があるのか(無いのじゃないか)
Have you any money at all?
君はいったい英語を知っているのか(知らないのじゃないか)
Do you know any English at all?
いったい君は金を出すつもりか(出さないつもりじゃないか)
Are you going to give any money at all?
彼はいったいこんなとろへ来るのが間違っている
He ought not to be here at all.
いったい何故こんなところへ来るのだ
Why does he come here at all?

content: 4. (=いったいそうかしら)(can) possibly

content.content: いったいそうかしら(そんなはずは無い)
Can it possibly be so?
いったい何事かしら
What can possibly be the matter?
いったいわしに用と言うのは何事だね
What can you possibly want with me?

content: 5. (=一体全体)(Who or what) ever, on earth, in the world, in the name of God, the devil, the deuce, the dickens(?)

content.content: いったい誰がそんなことを言ったのか
Who ever said so?
いったいどうすればよいのか
What ever would you have me do?
君はいったい誰か
Who on earth are you?
いったいどうしたと言うのだ
What in the world is the matter?
こりゃいったい何だ
What, in the name of all that's wonderful, is this?
いったい何用だ
What the devil do you want?
いったい今までどこへ行っていたんだ
Where the deuce have you been all this while?
いったいどういうわけなんだ
What the dickens is the reason?

content:
いったいぜんたい〔一体全体〕
〈副〉(Who or what) ever, on earth, in the world, in the name of God, the devil, the deuce, the dickens(?)

content.content: 一体全体誰がそんなことを言った
Who ever said so?
一体全体どうすればよいのか
What ever would you have me do?
一体全体君は何者だ
Who on earth are you?
一体全体どうしたというのだ
What in the world is the matter?
一体全体こりゃ何だ
What, is the name of all that's wonderful, is this?
一体全体何用か
What the devil do you want?
一体全体今までどこへ行っていたのだ
Where the deuce have you been all this while?
一体全体どういうわけなんだ
What the dickens is the reason?

content:
いったいに〔一体に〕
〈副〉Generally speaking; broadly speaking; on the whole; in the main, as a rule; as a general thing

content.content: 一体に女子の方が語学が好い
Generally speaking, girls make better linguists than boys.
成績は一体に良い
The results are, on the whole, excellent.
支那人は一体に体格が大きい
As a rule, Chinese have large physiques.
一体に日本人は愛国心がある
As a general thing, Japanese are patriotic―As a nation, the Japanese are patriotic.
一体に日本のキリスト教信者は熱心だ
As a body, the Japanese Christians are earnest believers.

content:
いったん〔一旦〕
〈副〉Once; for better or for worse

content.content: いったんうんと言わせさえすりゃこっちのものだ
Once he consents, he is ours.
威信はいったん落すと挽回し難い
Prestige, once lost, is hard to retrieve.
いったん為さんと決心したことはこれを遂げるまでは死すとも止むな
When you once determine to do a thing, do it or die.
いったん決めたら変えられぬ
When once you make your choice, it will be for better or for worse.
いったん夫婦になった以上はどんなことがあっても離れぬ
Since we have taken each other for better or for worse,―became man and wife for weal or woe, nothing can separate us.
いったん緩急あれば義勇公に奉ぜよ
In case of emergency, offer yourself bravely to the State.

content:
いったん〔一端〕
〈名〉One end; a part

content.content: この書面にて事件の一端を知るに足る
The document serves to show a part of the affair―throws some light on the affair.
これを見れば事の一端をうかがうに足る
This will give you a glance into the matter.
ご参考の一端に事の顛末を物語ることにしましょう
I will relate the circumstances by way of suggestion.

content:
いっち〔一致〕
〈名〉
1. (=合致)agreement; accord; concurrence; coincidence; consistence; correspondence; consensus; unanimity:(=する) to agree with (each other); to accord with, be in accord with (the truth); to concur with (each other); to coincide with (each other); to consist with, be consistent with (one's principles); to correspond with (each other); to square with (each other); to be at one with (each other); to be in keeping with (one's words); to be unanimous

content.content: 皆この点においては一致している
They all agree in this point.
言行一致している
His actions accord with his words―His actions are in keeping with his words.
言行一致せぬ
His action are not in keeping with his words―The performance does not correspond with the promise―His practice does not square with his principles.
彼の日々の行動がかねての主義と一致せぬ
His daily actions do not consist with his avowed principles―His practice is inconsistent with his principles.
君の言わるることは事実と一致せぬ
Your statement is not in accord with―not in strict accord with―the truth.
作成は考案と一致せぬものだ
The execution never corresponds with the conception.
皆の話が一致しない
The accounts do not agree with one another―The accounts are not at one with one another―The accounts are at variance with on another.
この点においては歴史家の説が皆一致している
The historians are all at one on this point.
皆の説は大体において一致している
Their views agree in substance.
この点については輿論が一致している
Public opinion is unanimous on this point.
輿論の一致
the consensus of public opinion

content: 2. (=一致共同)harmonious cooperation; union; unity; concert; unanimity

content.content: 一致団結
union―solidarity―harmonious―cooperation
一致協力
united efforts
一致協力しよう
We will unite our efforts―unite our powers in harmonious cooperation.
兄弟一致協力して親の仇を討った
The brothers avenged their father by their united efforts.
一致行動
concerted action
一致の行動をとる
to act in concert―act in union―with each other
官民一致して事に当たった
Government and people acted in concert.
一致の態度をとる
to present a united front
満場一致
unanimity―unanimous consent―universal consent
満場一致で議案を可決した
The bill was passed unanimously―with unanimous consent―with universal consent―with one consent.
挙国一致
national unity―unanimity of the whole nation
挙国一致して起つ
The nation rises as one man.
挙国一致して敵に当たる
The whole nation was up in arms against the enemy.
挙国一致の敵には勝てぬ
There is no fighting against a nation in arms.
挙国一致して軍事公債に応募した
The whole nation subscribed for the war-loan with one accord.

content: 3. (=一致和合)harmony; concord; union; unity

content.content: 皆一致して仲良く暮らしている
They live in harmony―They live in concord―They live together in perfect union―They live together in perfect unity―They are at unity with each other.

content: 4. (=一致統一)unification:(=する) to be unified

content.content: 言文を一致せしむ
to unify the spoken and written languages
言文一致
unification of the spoken and written languages
言文一致体
the colloquial style
言文一致体で書いてある
It is written in colloquial style.

content:
いっちきょうどう〔一致共同〕
〈名〉Union; unity; concert; unanimity; harmonious cooperation:(=する) to be united; to be unanimous; to cooperate in harmony; to act in concert

content.content: 陸海軍一致共同して目的を達した
Army and navy worked in harmony to attain the object.

content:
いっちきょうりょく〔一致協力〕
〈名〉United efforts

content.content: 一致協力しよう
We will unite our efforts―unite our power in harmonious cooperation.
兄弟は一致協力して親の仇を打った
The brothers avenged their father by their united efforts.

content:
いっちこうどう〔一致行動〕
〈名〉Concerted action

content.content: 一致行動をとる
to act in concert―act in unison―with each other

いっちだんけつ〔一致団結〕
〈名〉Union; solidarity; harmonious cooperation:(=する) to be united

いっちとういつ〔一致統一〕
〈名〉Unification:(=する) to unify

content:
いっちはんかい〔一知半解〕
〈名〉Smattering; sciolism

content.content: 一知半解の徒だ
He is a smatterer―a sciolist.

content:
いっちゃく〔一着〕
〈名〉
1. (=競争の第一着)the first arrival

content.content: 誰が一着か
Who came in first?―Who was the first to come in?

content: 2. (=洋服のひと揃え)a suit (of clothes)

content.content: 春着一着
a suit on spring wear

いっちゅうや〔一昼夜〕
〈名〉A day; a day and night; twenty-four hours

content:
いっちょう〔一朝〕
〈副〉One morning; once

content.content: 一朝目覚めてみれば有名な身となっていた
He awoke one bright morning to find himself famous.
一朝事あらば
in case of need―in case of emergency―in an emergency
一朝事あらば躊躇せずして身を国家に捧げよ
Be prompt at the call of duty!
一朝事ある時の奉公
yeoman's service

content:
いっちょう〔一挺〕

content.content: 墨一挺
a piece of indian ink
ろうそく一挺
a candle

いっちょういっせきに

content:
いっちょういっせきに〔一朝一夕に〕
〈副〉In a day

content.content: 大事業は一朝一夕にはならぬ
“Rome was not built in a day.”
一朝一夕にできる事ではない
It is not to be done in a day.
何芸でも一朝一夕に学べるものではない
No art is to be learned in a day.

いっちょうら〔一張羅〕
〈名〉One's only gala dress

content:
いっちょくせん〔一直線〕
〈名〉A straight line

content.content: 一直線に
in a straight line―in a bee-line―as the crow flies
一直線に進む
to go straight on―keep straight on―hold on one's course―make a bee-line

いっちわごう〔一致和合〕
〈名〉Harmony; concord; union; unity

content:
いつつ〔五〕
〈名〉Five

content.content: 五つ目
the fifth―No.5 (= number five)

いづつ〔井筒〕
〈名〉A well-crib; a well-curb

content:
いっつい〔一対〕
〈名〉A pair; a couple; a brace (of ducks); a yoke (of oxen)

content.content: 一対の花瓶
a pair of vases
一対の片々
one of a pair―a counterpart
これとあれで一対だ
This and that form a pair―This forms a counterpart to that.
一対にする
to pair―twin
二人は好一対だ
They are a good pair―a good match―a well-matched pair.
二人は好一対の夫婦になる
They will make a well-matched couple―They are made for each other.

content:
いっつう〔一通〕
〈名〉A copy

content.content: 手紙一通
a letter
一通の証文
a bond

content:
いつづけ〔居続け〕
〈名〉Staying on (after night):(=する) to stay on (at a brothel)

content.content: いつぞや主の居続けに弾く三味線の面白さ
Once, when you were staying on after a night of pleasure, how we enjoyed playing the samisen!

content:
いっつける〔云っつける〕
〈自動〉To tell on (one); to peach on (one); to blow upon (one); to split on (one); to squeal on (one); to let on (to some one); to sneak

content.content: いっつけるぞ
I'll tell on you.
先生にいっつけちゃいかんぞ
Don't let on to Grim!
あの生徒は何でも彼でも先生にいっつける
He is a sneak.
そんなことをするとお父様にいっつけますよ
Your father shall know what you have done.

content:
いっつべし〔謂つ可し〕
〈副詞相当〉So to say; so to speak; in a manner (of speaking); in a sense; as it were

content.content: 彼は成人せる赤ん坊ともいっつべし
He is, so to speak, a grown-up baby.
ある意味にては天才ともいっつべし
He is a genius in a sense.
非凡の凡人ともいっつべし
He is, as it were, a rare mediocrity.
生は死の始めともいっつべし
Birth is, in a manner, the beginning of death.

content:
いって〔一手〕
〈名〉
1. A single hand:(=の) single-handed; sole:(=で) single-handed

content.content: 一手に引受ける
to undertake anything single-handed
一手販売
sole agency

content: 2. (=将棋の一手)a move

content.content: 一手で勝つ
to win the game by a single move

content:
いってい〔一定〕
〈形〉Fixed (standard); settled (convictions); definite (object); regular (occupation); uniform (size); set (form); standing (rule); established (custom); prescribed (form); certain (place):(=する) to fix (the standard); to standardize (the size); to uniform (the student's dress); to make (the prices) uniform

content.content: 一定の標準が無い
There is no fixed standard.
一定の規則が無い
There is no standing rule―no established rule.
一定の法式がある
There is a set form―a prescribed form―an established form.
一定の職業が無い
He has no regular occupation.
一定の住家が無い
He has no fixed habitation.
一定の定見が無い
He has no settled convictions.
一定の目的が無い
He has no definite object.
机は一定の大きさにできている
The desks are of uniform size.
価格は一定してある
The prices are made uniform.
一定の場所で営業を許す
The business is permitted in certain places.
大小は一定してある
The size is standardized.
時間が一定してある
The hours are fixed.
生徒の服装は一定してある
The student's dress is uniformed―The students are in uniform.

content:
いっていじ〔一丁字〕
〈名〉A single character

content.content: 目に一丁字無し
He is illiterate.

content:
いっていふどう〔一定不動〕
〈形〉Invariable; inflexible; unalterable; hard and fast

content.content: 一定不動の規則は無い
There is no hard and fast rule.
一定不動の規則
the inflexible laws of nature
一定不動の法律
an unalterable law―the law of the Medes and Persians

content:
いっていふへん〔一定不変〕
〈形〉Fixed and unchangeable; immutable; constant

content.content: 一定不変の法則
immutable laws―eternal laws

content:
いってき〔一滴〕
〈名〉A drop

content.content: 彼は酒を一滴も飲まぬ
He does not drink a drop of wine.
近頃は酒は一滴も飲まぬ
I have not touched liquor of late.
雨は一滴も降らぬ
Not a drop of rain falls.
一滴の涙をこぼした
I dropped a tear.
一滴ずつ
drop by drop
大海の一滴だ
It is only a drop in the ocean.

content:
いってつ〔一徹〕
〈名〉Obstinacy; stubbornness

content.content: 老の一徹でなかなか承知しない
He persists in refusing with an old man's obstinacy―with the obstinacy of old age.
彼は忠義一徹の人だ
He is fidelity itself―staunch to the backbone.

content:
いってはんばい〔一手販売〕
〈名〉Sole agency

content.content: 一手販売の特約を結ぶ
to enter into a special contract for sole agency
特約一手販売
special sole agency
一手販売人
a sole agent

content:
いつでも〔何時でも〕
〈不定副詞〉Any time; at any time; at moment's notice; always:(打消に伴えば)never

content.content: いつでもよろしい
Any time will do.
(わざわざ傘を返しに来たのか)いつでもよかったに
Any time would have done―You might have returned it amy time.
いつでもお出でなさい
You may come at any time.
いつでも午後は家におります
I am always at home in the afternoon.
人はいつでも死ぬ覚悟でいるべきものだ
A man should always be prepared for death.
彼はいつでも遅刻する
He is always late.
いつでも時間通りに来ない
He is never on time.
いつでもこんなことばかりはない
This is not always the case.
(命令一下)いつでも出発ができます
I am ready to start at a moment's notice.
金はいつでもお間に合わせます
I can have the money ready at a moment's notice.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 仕事ならいつでも引受けます
I am ready to undertake any work.
国家の為ならいつでも死ぬ
I am ready to die for my country.

content: 〈接続詞〉Whenever

content.content: いつでも好きな時にお出でなさい
You may come whenever you like―at any time (that) you like.
いつでもご都合の好い時に金をお返しなさい
You may pay back the money whenever convenient to yourself―at your own convenience―You may take your own time for payment.

content:
いってん〔一天〕
〈名〉The whole sky

content.content: 一天にわかにかき曇る
The sky suddenly becomes covered with clouds.
一天墨を流すが如し
The sky is black as ink.
一天拭うが如し
The sky is clear from clouds.

content:
いってん〔一点〕
〈名〉
1. A point; a speck; a spot

content.content: 全艦一点の塵無し
There is not a speck of dust―not a particle of dust―in the whole ship.
碧空一点の雲無し
There is not a cloud in the sky.
一点の疑い無し
There is not a shadow of doubt―not the shadow of a doubt―not the faintest shadow of a doubt.
彼の行為は一点の非難すべきところも無し
His conduct is quite free from blame.
心中一点のやましきところ無し
I have a clear conscience―I am conscious of having done right.
操に一点の曇り無し
There is not a spot on her honour.
僕の誇り得るところは勉強の一点である
The only merit I can lay claim to, is that of diligence.
万緑叢中紅一点
She is an oasis in the desert―the only lady in the company.

content: 2. (=一品)an article; a piece

content.content: 衣類の一点
an article of clothing―a piece of clothing

いってんすい〔一点水〕
〈名〉An eye-water; An eye-wash

content:
いってんばり〔一点張〕
〈名〉Persistently sticking to one thing; one's only redeeming point; the personification (of something)

content.content: 彼は文法一点張だ
Grammar is his only forte.
勉強一点張だ
Diligence is his only merit.
彼は勉強一点張で成功した
He has succeeded by dint of perseverance.
正直一点張だ
Honesty is his only recommendation―He has nothing but his honesty to recommend him.
利益一点張だ
Interest is his only care―He looks to his interests only.
彼は利己一点張の男だ
He is the personification of egoism―He is egoism itself.
頑固一点張の老翁だ
The old man is the personification of obstinacy―He is obstinacy itself.
証人は知らぬ存ぜぬの一点張で通した
The witness persisted in denying all knowledge of the affair.
家は堅牢一点張にできている
The house is built with a sole view to strength.

いってんばんじょうのきみ〔一天万乗の君〕
〈名〉A sovereign; a monarch; an autocrat

content.content: 一天万乗の君たり
He holds the sceptre over the realm―wields the sceptre over the realm―sways the sceptre over the realm.

content:
いっと〔一途〕
〈名〉
1. (=一方針)one course

content.content: 今は辞職の一途あるのみ

content: 2. (=終始一貫)consistency

content.content: 命令は一途に出でざるべからず

一等道路

一等乗客
a first-class passenger
一等車
(英国にては)a first-class carriage―(米国にては)―a first-class car

I travel first-class.
一等船客
a cabin passenger―a saloon passenger
一等船室
the cabin―the saloon

content: 〈名〉One degree

content.content: 罪一等を減ずる

あの人は野球が一等上手だ
He is the best baseball player.

content.content: 一刀両断の処置

一刀両断の処置をする

content.content: 茶腹も一時

content:

content.content: これも貧の一得だ

content:
いっとくいっしつ〔一得一失〕
〈熟語〉→『

content.content: いっとくいっしゅつ〔一得一失〕

content:
いっとくいっしゅつ〔一得一失〕
〈熟語〉Every advantage has its disadvantage; every gain has its loss; if anything gains in one respect, it will lose in another

content.content: 何事も一得一失だ
Everything has its advantages and disadvantages.

content:
いつとはなしに〔何時とはなしに〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: いつしか〔何時しか〕

content:
いっとんざ〔一頓挫〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: とんざ〔頓挫〕

content:
いつなんどき〔何時なんどき〕
〈副〉(May) at any moment

content.content: 人はいつなんどき死ぬかわからぬ
A man may die at any moment.
いつなんどき戦争が始まるかも知れぬ
War may break out at any moment.
僕はいつなんどき用があるかわからぬ
I may be wanted at any moment.
亭主がいつなんどき帰って来るかも知れぬ
Her husband may return at any moment.
いつなんどき免職になるかも知れぬ危ぶない地位だ
I may lose my place at any moment―It is a precarious position.

content:
いつに〔一に〕
〈副〉Solely; wholly; entirely

content.content: 今日の勝利は一には貴大隊の奮戦の致すところ
Today's victory is entirely due to the hard fighting of your battalion.
成功は一に君の努力による
Success will entirely depend on your efforts.
一には不幸二には怠慢のため哀れや彼は破滅に瀕している
What with misfortune, what with negligence, he is on the brink of ruin.

content:
いつになく〔何時になく〕
〈副〉Unusually; unwontedly

content.content: 彼は今日はいつになく機嫌が好い
He is in unusual good humour―in unwonted good humour―today.
彼女はいつになく愛嬌をふりまいた
She was profuse of her smiles, which was not her wont.

content:
いつのまにか〔何時の間にか〕
〈副〉Before one knows; before we know where we are

content.content: いつのまにか彼が来ていた
He was there before we knew.
いつのまにか夏になる
Summer will be here before we know where we are.
いつのまにか時が経つ
Time slips away―Time glides on.

content:
いっぱ〔一派〕
〈名〉A party; a sect; a school

content.content: 一派を立てる
to found a school

content:
いっぱい〔一敗〕
〈名〉A defeat

content.content: 一敗地に塗(まみ)る
to suffer a crushing defeat―be humbled in the dust

content:
いっぱい〔一杯〕
〈名〉
1. (=一盃、一茶椀)a cup (of tea); a glass (of wine)

content.content: 茶一杯
a cup of tea
葡萄酒一杯
a glass of wine
珈琲一杯
a mug of coffee
ビールをもう一杯やらないか
Won't you have another glass of beer?
匙に一杯の砂糖
a spoonful of sugar
バケツに一杯の水
a bucket of water
馬車にいっぱいの乗客
a coach-load of passengers

content: 2. (=ひと飲み)a drink

content.content: 一杯飲む
to have a drink―(火酒なら)―take a drop
ちょいと一杯
a wee drop
お祝いに一杯やろうじゃないか
Let us have a drink in honour of the occasion.
これをやるから一杯飲め
Here is something for you to drink my health with.
彼は一杯機嫌でそう言ったのだろう
He must have said so under the influence of wine.
いっぱい食わせる
to play a trick on one―serve one a trick
いっぱい食わされる
to be taken in
まんまといっぱい食わされた
I was nicely taken in.

content: 〈形〉Full (of something)

content.content: 病院がいっぱいで入院を断わっている
The hospital is full, and declines to take in new patients.
客がいっぱいで入る隙が無い
The house is full, and there is no room for more.
電車がいっぱいで乗れない
The car is full, and we can not get in.
紙入に札がいっぱい入っている
The pocket-book is full of banknotes.
船に水がいっぱい入っている
The ship is full of water―filled with water.
盃は溢れそうにいっぱいだ
The cup is full to the brim―full to overflowing.
教室がいっぱいになった
The class-rooms are filled with students―packed with students―crowed with students.
教室はギシギシいっぱいだ
The class-rooms are chock full of students.
教室はいっぱいで立錐の地無し
The class-rooms are closely packed―filled to overflowing―crowded in suffocation.
鞄はいっぱいではち切れそう
The trunk is ready to burst.
紙入れは札がいっぱいではち切れそう
The pocket-book is bursting with bank-notes―crammed to bursting with bank-notes.
コップに水をいっぱいに張る
Fill the tumbler full of water.
盃に酒をいっぱいに注ぐ
Fill the cup full of wine.
手いっぱいに仕事をしている
My hands are full.
手いっぱいに商売を広げた
I have extended my business to the full.
女は目にいっぱい涙をためておった
Her eyes were filled with tears―suffused with tears.
腹がいっぱいだ
I am full.
腹いっぱい食う、腹いっぱい飲む
to eat one's fill―drink one's fill
悲しくて胸がいっぱいになった
My heart swells with grief―I am chocked with emotions―I feel a lump in my throat.
嬉しくて胸がいっぱいになった
My heart swells with joy―My heart is full.
胸がいっぱいでものが言えぬ
My heart is too full for words.

content: 〈副〉All

content.content: 今月いっぱいここにいる
I shall stay here all this month.
工事は今年いっぱいかかる
The works will take all this year.
今年いっぱいででき上がる
They will be finished by the end of the year.
精いっぱい働く
I work with all my might.
力いっぱい引張れ
Pull with all your might!
縄をいっぱいに繰り出せ
Pay out all the rope.

content:
いっぱいきげん〔一杯機嫌〕
〈名〉A slight intoxication

content.content: 一杯機嫌でそう言ったのだ
He must have said so under the influence of wine.

content:
いっぱく〔一泊〕
〈名〉A night's lodging:(=する) to stay overnight; to stop for the night; to stop the night; to pass the night; to spend the night; to put up (at a hotel) for a night

content.content: 今夜ここに一泊するから夜具をどうかしてくれ
I shall stay here overnight, so please see to my bedding.
日がくれたから途中で一泊した
The night fell, and I stopped (for) the night―stayed (for) the night―on the way.
藤屋に一泊した
I put up at Fujiya for a night.
静岡に一泊した
I passed the night in Shizuoka.

content:
いっぱし
〈形〉
1. (=人並)→『

content.content: ひとなみ〔人並〕
ひとかど〔一と廉〕

content:
いっぱつ〔一発〕
〈名〉A shot; a round:(火薬一発分)a charge

content.content: 念のためいま一発
I will fire another shot, to make sure of my game.
一発で見事に仕とめた
He fairly killed it at a shot.

content:
いっぱつ〔一髪〕
〈名〉A hair

content.content: 間一髪
a hair's breadth
間一髪のところを免れた
I had a hairbreadth escape―The bullet missed me by a hair's breadth.
危機一髪
The issue hangs on a hair―A feather might turn the scale.

いっぱん〔一半〕
〈名〉A half; a moiety

content:
いっぱん〔一斑〕
〈名〉The view of a part

content.content: 一斑を見て全豹を知る
to infer the whole from a part

content:
いっぱん〔一版〕
〈名〉An edition

content.content: 第一版
the first edition

content:
いっぱん〔一般〕
〈形〉
1. General; universal:(=に) universally; generally; in general; at large

content.content: 一般の人々、一般公衆
the general public―people at large
学生一般のことを言うのだ
I speak of students in general.
一般に言えば語学は男子より女子の方が好い
Generally speaking, girls make better linguists than boys.
彼は大家として一般に認められている
He is universally acknowledged as an authority―It is acknowledged on all hands that he is an authority on the subject.
一般を知る
to have a general idea of anything
一般を知らせる
to give one a general idea of anything
この事実は一般に知れわたっている
The fact is generally known―patent to the world.
一般にわたって論ずる
to discuss a subject at large
一般概念
a general notion
一般方略
the general plan of a campaign

content: 2. (=同一般)the same (as, as if)

content.content: それでは洋行したも一般だ
It is the same as if you had been abroad.

いっぱんとうひょう〔一般投票〕
〈名〉Plebiscite; referendum

content:
いつび〔溢美〕
〈名〉Flattery; exaggeration

content.content: というも決して溢美の言にあらず
It is no exaggeration to say that―It is not much to say that...

content:
いっぴつ〔一筆〕
〈名〉A line

content.content: 一筆啓上、金送れ
Just a line to ask you to send me some money.

content:
いっぴん〔一品〕
〈名〉An article

content.content: 一品の衣類
an article of clothing
一品の食物
an article of food
料理一品
a dish―a course
一品料理
a one-course dinner
天下一品
unique

いっぴん〔逸品〕
〈名〉A first-rate article; a ripper; stunner; a rattler; a scorcher; a screamer; a smasher; a spanker; a whopper

content:
いっぷいっぷ〔一夫一婦〕
〈名〉Monogamy

content.content: 一夫一婦主義者
a monogamist

content:
いっぷう〔一封〕
〈名〉An enclosure

content.content: 一封の金
money under cover

content:
いっぷうかわった〔一風変わった〕
〈形〉Eccentric (character); original (man, etc.)

content.content: あれは一風変わった男だ
He is an eccentric character―an original.
それは一風変わった傾向だ
The plan is a new departure.

いっぷうりゅう〔一風流〕
〈形〉Eccentric (character); original (man)

content:
いっぷく〔一服〕
〈名〉A dose (of medicine); a potion (of poison); a smoke (of tobacco); a cup (of tea)

content.content: この薬を一服飲むと直る
A dose of this medicine will set you right.
一服盛る
to administer poison
一服吸う
to have a smoke
ご一服お上がりなさい
Won't you have a smoke?
一服やろう
Let us have a smoke―have a rest.
お茶を一服召し上がれ
Will you take a cup of tea?

content:
いっぷたさい〔一夫多妻〕
〈名〉Polygamy

content.content: 一夫多妻主義者
a polygamist

content:
いっぺいそつ〔一兵卒〕
〈名〉A private

content.content: 一兵卒より身を起こして大将になった
He rose from the ranks to be a general.

content:
いっぺん〔一変〕
〈名〉A change; a complete change:(=する) to undergo a change; to take a turn (for the better―for the worse)

content.content: 形勢一変する
The tables turn―The scale is turned.
形勢を一変する
to turn the tables―turn the scale―give a new turn to affairs
形勢一変して我が軍の有利(不利)となった
The tide has turned―in our favour―against us.
十六インチ砲出でて形勢が一変した
The 16-inch gun turned the tide of war―turned the scale of fortune―in favour of Germany.
局面一変す
The face of affairs has changed―The whole face of the war is altered.
局面を一変する
to change the face of affairs―alter the whole face of the war―put a new face on the state of affairs
(傲慢な)態度を一変する
to change one's note―change one's tune
彼は今に態度を一変するから見ておれ
He will soon sing another tune―sing another song―laugh on the wrong side of his mouth―laugh out of the other corner of his mouth.
彼は旗色が変わるとたちまち態度を一変する
He will turn his coat at the first turn of the tide.
場面一変
The scene shifts.
僕は生活を一変しようと思う
I think I will turn over a new leaf.
病勢が一変した
(好くなれば)His disease has taken a turn for the better―taken a favourable turn―(悪くなれば)―taken a turn for the worse―taken an unfavourable turn.
飛行機が戦術に一変を来した
The aeroplane has revolutionized the mode of warfare.
彼は人間が一変した
He is another man―a new man.
洋行してから人間が一変した
Foreign travel has worked a complete change in him.

content:
いっぺん〔一片〕
〈名〉A piece; a bit; a slice; a scrap

content.content: 一片の肉
a piece of meat―a slice of meat
開戦の暁には条約は一片のほごに過ぎぬ
A treaty is only a scrap of paper on the morrow of a war.
一片の同情あらば救い給え
If you have a particle of sympathy, save him.
一片の挨拶も無く去った
He left without a word of farewell.
彼は一片の良心あらば金を返すだろう
If he has a spark of conscience, he will repay the money.

content:
いっぺん〔一篇〕
〈名〉A piece

content.content: 一篇の詩
a piece of poetry―a copy of verses―a poem

content:
いっぺん〔一遍〕
〈副〉
1. Once:(=に) at a time; at a stroke; at a heat; at a breath; at a fling

content.content: 彼はいっぺんに一万円儲けた
He made 10,000 yen at a stroke.
いっぺんに千円取られた
He lost a thousand yen at a sitting.
この詩はいっぺんに作り上げたものらしい
The poem seems to have been struck off at a heat.
いっぺんこっきりよ
It will be once and only once.
通り一遍の挨拶
the usual greetings
この問題は通り一遍の注意ではすまぬ
The question deserves more than a passing notice.
通り一遍のお世辞を言っただけさ
I only paid him the customary compliments.
通り一遍の客
a chance customer
彼は正直一遍の人だ
He has nothing but his honesty to recommend him.
お世辞一遍の人さ
He is nothing without his smooth tongue.

content:
いっぽ〔一歩〕
〈名〉A step

content.content: 一歩進む
to take a step
一歩前へ進む、一歩後へ退く
to take a step forward―take a step backward
一歩進むごとに水が深くなる
The water becomes deeper at every step.
君の方が僕より一歩進んでいる
You are a step ahead of me.
僕は一歩進んでこの方法を採用したいと思う
I will go a step further, and adopt the method.
一歩進んでこの方法の安全なことがさらにその取柄である
Further, the safety of the method is another recommendation.
一歩進むにも奮闘して進んだ
We fought every inch of the ground.
一歩も退かぬ、一歩退くにもただは退かぬ
We contested every inch of the ground―disputed every inch of the ground.
そこ一歩でも動くな
Do not stir from the spot!
一歩でも動くと命が無いぞ
Stir a step, and you are a dead man.
一歩を譲る
to yield a step―concede a point―strain a point―stretch a point
しかたがないから一歩を譲って賛成しておこう
I will strain a point, and endorse your views.
あの人はいったん言い出したら一歩も譲らぬ
Once he puts his foot down, he will not yield an inch.
二人はお互いに一歩も譲らぬ
They will not yield an inch to each other.
先方では一歩も譲らぬ
The other party will not yield an inch―not bate a jot of his demands.
一歩を誤る
to take a false step
一歩を誤れば一大事となる
A single mis-step would be attended with serious consequences.
千里の道も一歩より始まる
“He who would climb the ladder, must begin at the bottom.”

content:
いっぽう〔一報〕
〈名〉Information; a notice:(=する) to inform (one of an event); to give (one) notice

content.content: ご到着の上は早速ご一報下さい
You will write and let me know as soon as you arrive.
御一報次第店員参上可仕候
We shall wait upon you immediately on receipt of your notice.

content:
いっぽう〔一方〕
〈名〉
1. (=一面)one side (the other side); one hand (the other hand)

content.content: 一方は絶壁、 一方は地獄谷
On one side a perpendicular cliff, a bottomless ravine on the other.
一方には労働者の利益を図り、他の一方には資本家の権利を保護しなければならぬ
On the one hand, the interests of labour must be consulted; on the other hand, the capitalists must be looked after.
また一方を見ればいま一つの希望が起こる
There is another possibility if we look the other way.

content: 2. (=一人)one party (the other party)

content.content: 一方の言い分を聞いたからこれからまた一方の言い分を聞こう
Now I have heard one party, I will listen to the other.
一方聞いて下知立たず
Hear both parties before you decide―Consider both sides of the question―“Look on both sides of the shield.”
一方だけの陳述
an ex-parte statement

content: 3. (=ひとつ)one (the other)

content.content: 会が衝突して一方へ出席すれば一方へ出席することができない
The meeting clash with each other, so that, if I should one, I can not go to the other.

content: 〈副〉Only; solely; always

content.content: あの先生は訳読一方だ

彼は金儲一方だ

飲む一方だ

彼は勉強一方だから進む一方だ

content.content: 彼は文法の一本槍だ

content:

〈疑問副詞〉Till when?; How long?

content.content: 君はいつまでここに居るか
How long shall you stay here?
いつまで待ってもしようがない
I can not wait for ever.
いつまで待っても来なかった
I waited and waited, but he did not appear.
いつまで泣いたって限りが無い
You will never have done crying.
この本はいつまでなりともお使いなさい
You may keep the book as long as you like.
ここにいつまで居てもよろしい
You may stay here as long as you like.

content:

content.content: いつまでに仕上げればよいのです

content.content: 人はいつまでも生きているわけにはいかぬ

いつまでも人の厄介にばかりなっておられぬ

You may stay here as long as you like.
いつまでもいつまでもこうしていたい
I should like to remain in this state for ever and ever―eternally.

いつみん〔逸民〕
〈名〉A man who has renounced the world

content:
いつも〔何時も〕
〈不定副詞〉Always; ever; invariably; constantly; every time:(打消に伴えば)never:(=の) usual; wonted

content.content: いつもこうだ
This is always the case―This is invariably the case.
いつもこんなことばかりは無い
This is not always the case.
いつも午後は在宅です
I am always at home in the afternoon.
人はいつも死ぬ覚悟でいるべきものだ
A man should always be prepared for death.
あの先生はいつも同じことばかり繰り返している
He is constantly harping on the same string.
日本はいつも武運が好い
Fortune ever smiles on Japan's arms.
彼はいつも遅刻する
He is always late.
いつも時間通りに来ない
He is never on time.
いつもこれだけあればよろしい
This much will do every time.
いつものように朝寝坊をした
I got up late as usual.
今日はいつもよりも早く起きた
I got up earlier than usual today.
あれがいつもの癖だ
That is his usual way.
彼はいつもの元気が無い
He is not in his wonted spirits.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: あの男はいつも元気が好い
He has a remarkable flow of spirits.
いつも柳の下に鰌は居ない
Chances are not blackberries.
彼はいつも本を放さない
He is a steady reader―a constant reader.
あの人はいつも酒を飲んでいる
He is a constant tippler.

content:
いつもながら〔何時も乍ら〕
〈副〉As... as ever; as usual; as of old

content.content: 彼はいつもながら勉強だ
He is working as hard as ever.
いつもながら親切だ
He is kind as usual―as of old.

content:
いつやのらん〔乙夜の覧〕

content.content: おつやのらん〔乙夜の覧〕

〈名〉Pleasure; enjoyment

content.content: 彼は逸楽に耽っている
He is addicted to pleasure―He leads a voluptuous life.

content:
いづる〔出づる〕
〈自動〉To come out (of a place); to be derived (from some origin)

content.content: 英語にはラテン語より出づる語多し
Many English words are derived from Latin.
日は東より出でて西に入る
The sun rises in the east, and sets in the west.
私慾より出づる行為
an action dictated by interest
暴挙に出づる
to resort to violence
穴より出でて穴に入る
“From dust thou comest, and unto dust returnest.”
門を出でずして天下を知る
to know the world without going abroad―sit at home and know the world
好事門を出でず
“Good news walk on crutches.”
忠臣は孝子の門に出づ
A good son will make a good citizen.
家貧にして孝子出づ、国乱れて忠臣出づ
“Adversity brings out a man's virtues.”
汝に出づるものは汝に還る
“Harm watch, harm catch”―“Harm set, harm get,”
彼の右に出づる者無し
No one can compare with him.

content:
いつわ〔逸話〕
〈名〉An anecdote

content.content: 西郷には面白い逸話がたくさんある
Saigo is full of interesting anecdotes―Many amusing anecdotes are told of Saigo―His life was rich in anecdotes.

content:
いつわり〔偽り〕
〈名〉A lie; (a) falsehood; (a) deception; (a) deceit:(=の) false

content.content: 偽りを言う
to tell a lie―tell a falsehood―(子どもに言わせると)―tell a story
彼は白々しい偽りを言う
He tells glaring lies―barefaced lies.
彼は偽りを言うような人でない
He is not the man to tell a lie―He is above telling a lie.
君子に偽り無し
A man of honour is above deception―Deception has no place in a gentleman's heart.
彼は偽りの無い人だ、生来偽りの無い人だ
He is a lover of truth―He has an innate love of truth.
天に誓って偽りは言わぬ(天ご照覧あれ)
I call Heaven to witness that I speak the truth―Witness Heaven that I speak the truth!―So help me God (as I speak the truth)!
いつの世にも偽りはあったものだ
In no age was man free from falsehood.
何事も偽り
In this our world of falsity,
多き世の中に
Where all men lie,
死ぬるばかりは
The only way to show your truth―
誠なりけり
It is to die.
看板に偽り無し
His appearance does not belie his character―His appearance does not give the lie to his character.
兵は偽りを厭わず
“All is fair in love and war.”
偽りをあばく
to nail a lie

content:
いつわる〔偽る〕
〈自他動〉To lie; to pretend (to be ill); to feign (illness); to personate (a character)

content.content: 名を偽る
to assume a false name
(何と)名を偽って敵陣に入る
He entered the enemy's camp under a false name―under the name of A. B.
名を偽って世を渡る
to sail under the false colours
病と偽る
to pretend to be ill―feign illness
彼は病と偽って面会を謝絶した
He declined to see me under pretence of illness―on the pretence of illness―under pretext of illness―on the pretext of illness―under plea of illness―on the plea of illness.
彼は海軍将校と偽って婿に入った
He married an heiress by personating a naval officer.
偽って金を取った
He obtained the money by fraud―under false pretences.

居ても立ってもおられぬほど痛かった

居ても立ってもおられないような苦しい思いをした

居ても立ってもおられないほど嬉しかった

新宅へ移転しました

明日は荷物を引まとめて移転する

content:

〈名〉Heredity; transmission:(=の) hereditary; inheritable:(=せる) inherited; transmitted:(=する) to inherit (a disease from one's parent); to transmit (a disease to one's child); to be transmitted; to be inherited; to be hereditary; to run in the blood; to run in the family

content.content: ある病いは遺伝する
Certain diseases are inherited―are transmitted―run in the blood―run in the family.
あの病いは父から遺伝したのだ

あの病いは子に遺伝する

この家には精神病の遺伝がある

遺伝性
hereditary nature―transmissibility
遺伝性梅毒
inheritable syphilis―transmissible syphilis
遺伝梅毒
inherited syphilis
遺伝法
the law of heredity
隔世遺伝
atavism

〈名〉A well

content.content: 井戸の水を汲む

女中は井戸へ水を汲みに行っている
The servant is (drawing water) at the well.

〈他動〉

content.content: 多少の冒険は厭わぬ

字書を引く労を厭わずば容易にわかることだ

労を厭わぬ

露をだに厭う

大和のおみなえし

降るアメリカに

袖は濡らさじ

content:
いとま〔暇、遑〕
〈名〉
1. (=閑暇)leisure; spare time; time to spare

content.content: 返答するいとまも無く彼は行ってしまった
He was gone before I had time to reply―before I could reply.
席暖まるにいとま無し
I am too busy to keep my scat.
応接にいとまあらず
to be kept busy
敵をして応接にいとま無からしむ
We kept the enemy busy.
変化急速にして応接にいとまあらず
The rapid changes keep one busy.
終夜の水雷攻撃は敵をして応接にいとま無からしむ
The torpedo-attacks kept the enemy busy all night.
来訪者溢れて応接にいとまあらず
We are flooded with callers.
枚挙するにいとまあらず
They are too numerous to be mentioned―innumerable.

content: 2. (=賜暇)leave (of absence); furlough

content.content: いとまを貰う
to ask leave
主人に暇を貰おう
I will ask leave of my master.
一週間のおいとまをいただきます
Will you give me a week's leave?―May I have a week's leave?
三日間いとまを貰った
I have (been granted) three days' leave.
彼はいとまを貰って家(国)へ帰っている
He is home on leave―home on furlough.
いとまをくれる
to give one leave
彼にいとまをくれて家へ返した
I have given him leave to go home.
花が今日おいとまをいただきたいと申します
Hana wants to have the day to herself―have a day off.

content: 3. (=解雇)discharge (from service); dismissal (from service)

content.content: 雇人にいとまを出す、いとまをやる
to discharge a servant (from one's service)―dismiss a servant (from one's service)
あの者は不都合があっていとまを出しました
I have dismissed him for irregularity.
お前には今日限りいとまをやる
I discharge you this very day.
奉公人に一カ月の猶予でいとまを出す(のが西洋の習慣)
to give a servant a month's warning
主人がいとまを出すと言って脅かしている
My master threatens to give me a month's warning.
あの男はいとまが出たそうだ
He has been discharged from service, I hear.
主人をしくじっていとまが出た
He was dismissed in disgrace.
やっといとまが出た
I have got my discharge at last.
いとまを取る
to leave one's service
彼は主人からいとまを取って独立に商売をしている
He has left his master's service, and set up for himself.
少し都合があっておいとまをいただきます
I wish to leave your service for certain reasons.
いとまを取りたい時は(西洋風に)一カ月前に断ってくれ
You must give me a month's notice.
永のおいとま
dismissal―banishment
彼は永のおいとまになった
He has been banished from his master's presence.

content: 4. (=暇乞い)leave-taking

content.content: おいとまいたします
I will take my leave―say good-bye.
おいとまつかまつる
I humbly take my leave.
それからいとまを告げて立ち帰った
Then I took my leave.
