content:
いにん〔委任〕
〈名〉Trust; charge; commission:(職権の委任)delegation; authorization:(ローマ法では)mandate:(=する) to entrust (a person with a matter―a matter to a person); to charge (one with a duty); to commit (a matter) to one's care; to leave (a matter to one); to delegate (authority to a person); to authorize (one to do anything); to invest (one with authority); to empower (one to do anything)

content.content: 事件を弁護士に委任した
I have entrusted a lawyer with a matter―entrusted the matter to a lawyer.
事務上のことはいっさい田中君に委任してある
I have committed all business matters to the care of Mr. Tanaka.
私は代理を委任されている
I am authorized to act for him―empowered to act for him.
全権を委任する
to invest one with full powers―give one carte blanche

いにんじょう〔委任状〕
〈名〉A letter of attorney; a power of attorney; letters of procuratory

content:
いにんとうじ〔委任統治〕
〈名〉Mandate; mandatory rule

content.content: 日本はある南洋諸島に対し委任統治権を有す
Japan has mandatory rule over certain South Sea Islands.

content:
いぬ〔犬〕
〈名〉
1. A dog

content.content: 犬がほえる
A dog barks.
犬が人にほえる
A dog barks at people.
犬にほえられた
I was barked at by a dog.
犬が唸る
A dog growls (at a man).
犬がいがむ
A dog snarls (at a larger dog).
犬が遠ぼえする
A dog howls.
犬が月を見て遠ぼえする
A dog bays the moon.
犬が打たれてキャンキャンなく
A dog yells when he is beaten.
犬を飼う
to keep a dog
犬は三日の恩を三年忘れぬ
Keep a dog from three days, and he will not forget you for three years.
犬が家の番をする
The dog watches the house.
犬には鼻の利くのと足の早いのがある
Some dogs are chosen for scent, and others for speed.
犬に芸を仕込む
to teach a dog tricks
犬がチンチンする
A dog sits on his hind legs and begs.
能無し犬の高ぼえ
“A barking dog is never a good hunter.”
犬にかまれる
to be bitten by a dog
その犬にかまれるな
Don't let that dog bite you.
その犬にかまれないように気をつけて
Take care that the dog does not bite you.
飼犬に手をかまれる
One who plays with edged tools will cut himself.
飼犬に手をかまれしゃんすな
It is ill playing with edged tools.
あの犬は食いつきそうだ
That dog looks like biting.
犬が足に食いついた
The dog bit me in the leg.
犬が足へ食いつこうとした
The dog snapped at my leg.
あの犬は側へ寄ると危ない
The dog is not safe to touch.
犬ご用心
Beware of the dog!
犬をけしかける
to set a dog on a man
この犬は知らない人を見るととびつく
This dog will fly at a stranger.
犬がけんかする
Dog fight.
犬にけんかさせる
to set dogs fighting―fight dogs
犬げんか
a dog -fight
そんな物は犬も食わぬ
A dog will not touch it.
夫婦げんかは犬も食わぬ
One should not interfere in lovers' quarrels.
寒国では犬に橇を曳かせる
In cold countries,the sledges are drawn by dogs.
西洋では犬を家へ上げる
In foreign countries, they let their dogs into the house.
犬と猿のよう
They agree like cats and dogs―They live a cat-and-dog life.
犬は人につき猫は家につく
The dog attaches himself to his muster; the cat attaches herself to the house.
犬も歩けば棒に当たる
A walking dog will get something.
垣堅ければ犬入らず
“At open door dogs come in.”
犬にも豊年あり
“Every dog will have his day.”
犬の糞でかたきを取る
to throw dirt at a man
煩悩の犬追えども去らず
The passions are hard of control.
犬をつなぐ
to chain a dog
犬はつないである
The dog is chained.
つないだ犬
a chained dog―a dog on the chain
牝犬
a she-dog―a bitch(は忌語)
犬ころ
a pup―a puppy
野良犬
a cur
班犬
a black and white dog
狩犬
a hound―a pointer―a setter
犬殺し
a dog-killer
犬小舎
a kennel
犬張子
a papier-m?ch? dog
犬侍
a dog of a samurai
犬畜生にも劣る奴だ
He is worse than a beast.

content: 2. (=間者)a spy; an emissary

いぬ〔寝ぬ〕
〈自動〉To sleep; to go to bed; to retire to repose

content.content: つとに起き夜半に寝ぬ
to rise early and retire late

content:
いぬ〔戌〕
〈名〉The Dog (one of the twelve zodiacal signs)

content.content: 戌の年
the year of the Dog

content:
いぬき〔居抜き〕
〈名〉Quitting a house as it is

content.content: 居抜きのまま店を譲渡す
to transfer a business with its stock and goodwill

content:
いぬく〔射貫く〕
〈他動〉To shoot (one) through (with an arrow)

content.content: 頭を射貫く
to shoot one through the head

いぬくぐり〔犬潜り〕
〈名〉A dog-hole (in a fence)

content:
いぬけんか〔犬喧嘩〕
〈名〉A dog-fight

content.content: 犬けんかをさせる
to set dogs fighting―fight dogs

いぬごや〔犬小舎〕
〈名〉A kennel

いぬころし〔犬殺し〕
〈名〉A dog-killer

いぬじに〔犬死に〕
〈名〉A dog's death:(=する) to die a dog's death; to die in vain

いぬはりこ〔犬張子〕
〈名〉A papier-m?ch? dog

いぬほおずき〔斎葵〕
〈名〉The black nightshade

content:
いね〔稲〕
〈名〉The rice-plant

content.content: 今年は稲の出来が好い
The rice-plants have turned out well this year.
稲に穂が出る
The rice-plants put out their ears.
稲に穂が出た
The rice-plants are in the ear.
稲の穂が出揃った
The rice-plants are in full ear―The ears are all out.
稲に実が入る
The rice-plants fill.
稲を刈る
to reap the rice-plants
稲は十月刈り取る
The rice-plants are reaped in October.

content:
いねむり〔居睡り、居眠り〕
〈名〉A doze:(=する) to doze; to fall into a doze; to drop off into a doze; to fall asleep

content.content: 読書しながら居眠りする
to doze over a book
机にもたれて居眠り
Leaning on my desk, I dropped off into a doze.
彼は授業中に時々居眠りする
He often falls asleep during the lesson.
彼は本を読んで居眠りしている
He is dozing over a book―nodding over a novel.
居眠りしてはいかん
You must keep awake.

content:
いねむり〔居睡り、居眠り〕
〈名〉A doze:(=する) to doze; to fall into a doze; to drop off into a doze; to fall asleep

content.content: 読書しながら居眠りする
to doze over a book
机にもたれて居眠り
Leaning on my desk, I dropped off into a doze.
彼は授業中に時々居眠りする
He often falls asleep during the lesson.
彼は本を読んで居眠りしている
He is dozing over a book―nodding over a novel.
居眠りしてはいかん
You must keep awake.

content:
いのいちばん〔いの一番〕
〈形〉A 1

content.content: 彼はいつもいの一番にやって来る
He is always the first to come.

いのこり〔居残り〕
〈名〉Remaining behind:(執務の為なら) remaining in office beyond one's working hours:(学校の罰としてなら)being kept in bounds after school

content:
いのこる〔居残る〕
〈自動〉To remain behind:(執務の為なら)to remain in office beyond one's working hours:(学校の罰でなら)to be kept in bounds after school:(宴会などでなら)to sit out the others

content.content: 彼はいつも宴会で居残る
He always sit out the others at banquets.

content:
いのしし〔猪〕
〈名〉The wild boar

content.content: 猪の牝
a wild sow
猪の肉
brawn

いのししむしゃ〔猪武者〕
〈名〉A foolhardy warrior; a soldier of reckless valour

content:
いのち〔命〕
〈名〉Life; existence

content.content: 人の命は露よりももろし
“Life is a bubble.”
命は風前の灯
Life is a candle flickering in the wind.
長い月日に短い命
Time is long, but life is short―“Life is but a span.”
はかない命
frail life
今日明日も危ない命
His life hangs by a thread.
明日の日も知れない命
It is a precarious existence.
かけがえのない命だ
This is my only life―I have no life to spare.
老いさきの短い命だ
He has not long to live―He is not long for this world.
命長ければ恥多し
“To live long is to outlive much.”
命あっての物種
“While there is life, there is hope.”
武士は命より名を尚ぶ
The samurai values honour above life.
あの女なら命は要らぬ
I would die for her.
彼は命知らずだ
He is a desperate character―a dare-devil―reckless of his safety.
命乞いする
to pray for one's life―appeal to the Throne for clemency―(戦場でなら)―ask for quarter―cry quarter
命からがら逃げ伸びた
He escaped with bare life.
命冥加な奴だ
You are watched over by Special Providence.
読書は彼の命だ
Reading is as the breath of his nostrils to him.
速力は駆逐艦の命だ
Speed is the life of a destroyer.
命と頼む財産を失った
He lost his fortune which was his only resort.
命から二番目だ
It is next my heart.

content: 《a》(命が)

content.content: 命が惜しい
Life is dear to me―I hold my life dear―I cling to my life.
誰も命が惜しい
Life is dear to everybody.
国家に捧げた命だから惜しくはない
I do not cling to a life which I have offered to my country.
河豚は食いたし命は惜しし
“Honey is sweet, but the bee stings.”
俺の命が欲しいのか
Do they seek my life?
この命が欲しけりゃ熨斗をつけて進上する
If they want my life, they are welcome to it.
命が危ない
His life is in danger―He is in danger of losing his life―He is in peril of his life.
命が縮まる
One's life is shortened.
苦労をすると命が縮まる
“Care is a foe to life”―“Care preys on life”―“Care killed the cat.”
命が伸びる
One's life is lengthened―One takes a new lease of life.
じたばたすると命が無いぞ
Keep quiet, or you are a dead man.
そこ一歩でも動くと命が無いぞ
You stir from the spot on pain of death.
そんなことをしようものなら命が無い
It is as much as my life is worth to do such a thing.

content: 《b》(命に)

content.content: 命に係わる
to endanger one's life―(病なら)―prove fatal―(傷なら)―prove mortal
この病は命に係わることがある
This disease sometimes proves fatal―Some cases prove fatal.
傷は命に係わるかも知れぬ
The wound may prove mortal.
命に係わる問題だ
It is a matter of life and death to me―It is a hanging matter.
命には別状無し
His life is out of danger.
いくら儲かっても命には換えられぬ
Nothing can compensate for the loss of life.
命にかけても思い出せない
I can not recollect it for the life of me.

content: 《c》(命の)

content.content: 命の親
the preserver of one's life
君は僕にとっては命の親だ
You are the preserver of my life―You have saved my life―I owe you my life.
命の綱
one's means of livelihood
米は命の綱
“Bread is the staff of life.”
命の洗濯
a carnival
命の洗濯をする
to enjoy life―enjoy oneself
今日はうんと命の洗濯をしよう
We will enjoy ourselves to the full today.
命のやり取り
a struggle for life―a mortal combat
命のやり取りする
to struggle for one's life―fight for one's life―engage in mortal combat

content: 《d》(命を)

content.content: 命を取る
to take one's life
命を取ろうとする
to make an attempt on one's life
この病いには命を取られる
This disease proves fatal.
酒に命を取られた
Wine was the death of him.
流行病が多くの命を取る
An epidemic takes a toll of human life.
貴様の命を貰った
I will have your life―have your heart's blood.
命を助ける
to save one's life―save one from death―(殺そうと思った人の命なら)―spare one's life
命ばかりはお助けを
Spare me!―Have mercy on me!―Mercy!―(敵に向かってなら)―Quarter!
命を捨てる
to throw away one's life―lay down one's life
国のためなら命を捨てる
I would lay down my life for my country―give my life for my fatherland.
あたら命をただ捨てた
He threw away his precious life in vain.
彼は命を捨てて人を助けた
He saved others at the price of his life.
命がけで人を助けた
He saved others at the risk of his life.
命を惜しむ
to love life―cling to life
武士は命を惜しまぬ
The samurai does not fear to die―The samurai holds his life at nothing.
武士は命よりも名を惜しむ
The samurai values honour above life.
命よりも金を惜しむ人がある
Some people love money above life.
命をつなぐ
to support life―sustain life―keep alive
どうかこうか命をつなぐ
to manage to keep alive―keep body and life together
彼はどうして命をつないでいるか僕には解せぬ
How he manages to keep alive, is more than I can tell.
命を縮める
to shorten one's life―shorten one's natural term of existence
そんな無理をすると命を縮めるぞ
You are driving a nail in your coffin―adding a nail to your coffin―burning the candle at the both ends.
お前は俺にこんな苦労をかけて親の命を縮める奴だ
You will bring your father's gray hairs to the grave.
苦労をすると命を縮める
“Care is a foe to life”―“Care preys on life”―“Care killed the cat.”
命を伸ばす
to lengthen one's life―add to one's natural term of existence―take a new lease of life
危ない命を助かる、命を拾う
to have a narrow escape―be snatched from the jaws of death
命を拾った
I had a narrow escape―I was snatched from the jaws of death―It was a close shave―a close call.
命を賭ける
to stake one's life
命を的にかけてこの商売をする
One engage in this trade at the risk of one's life―neck or nothing.
命を投げ出す
to lay down one's life―sacrifice one's life
命を投げ出して人を助けた
He saved others at the risk of his life.
命を投げ出してかかる
to take one's life in one's hands―carry one's life in one's hands
命を投げ出してかかればどんなことでもできないことは無い
Nothing is impossible to the man who does not fear death.
間違ったら命をやる
I will answer for it with my life.
(追剥ぎが旅人に向かって)金を出すか命を寄越すか
Your money or your life―Stand and deliver!

content:
いのちがけ〔命懸け〕
〈名〉Staking one's life on the attempt:(形容詞に用いれば)desperate:(=で) at the risk of one's life; at the peril of one's life; at the hazard of one's life; neck or nothing

content.content: こりゃ命がけだ
This is a desperate attempt―neck or nothing.
命がけの仕事だ
It is a desperate business.
彼は命がけで僕を助けてくれた
He saved me at the risk of his life.
この商売は命がけだ
People engage in this trade at the risk of their lives.―Those who follow this trade, take their lives in their hands.
電車は命がけだ
One rides in a street-car at the risk of one's life.

content:
いのちからがら〔命からがら〕
〈副〉With bare life

content.content: 命からがら免れた
He escaped with bare life―barely escaped death.

いのちげ〔命毛〕
〈名〉The point (of a writing-brush)

いのちごいをする〔命乞いをする〕
〈自動〉To pray for one's life:(皇室へなら)to appeal to the Throne for clemency:(戦場でなら)to ask for quarter; to cry quarter

content:
いのちしらず〔命知らず〕
〈形〉Reckless; desperate; dare-devil

content.content: あれは命知らずだ
He is a reckless fellow―a desperate character―a dare-devil―a desperado―reckless of his safety.
この羅紗は命知らずです
This cloth will wear for ever.

content:
いのちびろい〔命拾い〕
〈名〉Escape from death; a narrow escape:(=する) to escape death; to have a narrow escape; to be snatched from the jaws of death

content.content: 命拾いをした
I had a narrow escape―I was snatched from the jaws of death―It was a close shave―It was a close call.
お蔭で命拾いをしました
You have snatched me from the jaws of death―You have saved my life―You have saved me from death.

content:
いのちみょうが〔命冥加〕
〈名〉Special Providence

content.content: 命冥加な奴だ
You are watched over by Special Providence.
命冥加が尽きる
to die

content:
いのり〔祈り〕
〈名〉Prayer; invocation; supplication:(食事前後のは)grace

content.content: お祈りを捧げる
to offer up prayers
お祈りする
to pray―(食事前後なら)―say grace
彼はお祈りしている
He is at his prayers―at his devotions.

content:
いのる〔祈る〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=祈祷する)to pray (to God for mercy); to invoke (aid of God); to supplicate (God―mercy―to God for mercy)

content.content: 神に祈る
to pray to God
人を祈り殺す
to pray a man to death
人を祈らば穴二つ
“Curses comes home to roost”―“A curse cuts both ways”―“Harm watch, harm catch”―“Harm set, harm get.”
心だにまことの
If but thy heart be e'er sincere
道にかないなば
And follow Truth's way
祈らずとても
The gods shall watch o'er thy career,
神や守らん
E'en though thou never pray.

content: 2. (=祈願する)to wish (one success―that one may succeed, etc.)

content.content: 幸福を祈る
I wish you happiness―I wish you may be happy―May you be happy!―I am anxious for your welfare.
万福を祈る
I wish you every happiness―May you enjoy every happiness!
成功を祈る
I wish you success―I wish you may succeed―May you succeed!―Success to you!―With best wishes for your success―(乾盃をしてなら)―I drink to your success.
全快を祈る
I wish you speedy recovery―I am anxious for your recovery.
天汝を守護せんことを祈る
May Heaven protect you!
神汝を祝福せんことを祈る
God bless you!
幸運を祈る
I wish you good luck―Good luck to you!
航海の無事を祈る
I wish you a happy voyage―A happy voyage to you!

content:
いはい〔位牌〕
〈名〉An ancestral tablet; a family tablet

content.content: そんなことをしては先祖の位牌に対してすまない
It is due to the memory of my ancestors to abstain from such actions.

content:
いはい〔違背〕
〈名〉Breach; infringement; infraction; violation; transgression; contravention; offence:(=する) to break, infringe, violate, transgress, offend against, trespass against (the law); to contravene, violate, break (the rule); to be contrary to, be against (the laws)

content.content: 法律に違背する
to break the law―infringe the law―violate the law―offend against the law
そんなことをしては法律違背になる
Such actions would be against the law―contrary to the laws.
規則に違背する
to violate the regulations―contravene the rules―break a rule
それは規則違背だ
It is against rule.
その処置は先例に違背している
The measure is against all precedent.
専売特許に違背せる物品
infringements on patents
信任違背
breach of trust
文法違背
bad grammar―a solecism

いばしんえん〔意馬心猿〕
〈名〉Passions hard of control; uncontrollable passions

content:
いはつ〔衣鉢〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: えはち〔衣鉢〕

いはつ〔遺髪〕
〈名〉Hair of the deceased

content:
いばら〔茨〕
〈名〉
1. The briar; the bramble; the thorn

content.content: 茨垣
a thorn hedge

content: 2. (=薔薇)the rose

いばる〔威張る〕
〈自他動〉
1. To be proud; to be haughty; to be stuck-up; to be puffed up; to be pompous; to be pretentious; to be pretending; to swell with pride; to put on side; to hold up one's head; to hold one's head high; to stand upon one's dignity; to look big; to talk big; to have influence

content.content: 彼は威張る
He puts on side―stands upon his dignity.
威張っている
He is proud―haughty―stuck-up.
あの人は学校で威張っている
He has influence in the school.
小役人は威張りたがる
Petty officials are apt to be pompous.
小役人のくせに威張っていいる
He is a Jack in office.
あの人は自分ばかり偉いつもりで威張っている
He is puffed up with a sense of his own importance.
威張りくさっている
He is swollen with pride―bloated with pride―inflated with pride―consumed with pride―eaten up with pride―high and mighty.
あんな者に威張らしておくのは慨歎に堪えぬ
It is a shame that such men should hold up their heads.
彼はあまり威張っているから凹ませてやって実に愉快だ
I am very glad to have humbled his pride.
これだけ書けりゃ威張ったもんだ
If you can write so well, you ought to be proud.
あれだけ金がありゃ威張ったものだ
His wealth ought to make him proud.
彼は威張っていて僕らにものも言わない
He disdains to speak to us.
威張っていて返事もしない
He will not deign to answer me.
威張ったことを言う
to talk big―talk tall
彼は相変わらず威張ったことを言っていたが、いよいよという時にへこたれてしまった
He had been talking big as usual, but faltered at the last moment.
威張って歩く
to strut along―stalk about―swagger about
島津とか毛利とかいうと威張った家柄だ
The Shimazus and Moris are families of high pretensions.
彼はちょいと威張った家に住んでいる
He lives in a pretending house―a pretentious house.

content: 2. (=何を威張る)to be proud of (one's birth); to take pride in (one's profession); to stand on, pride oneself on, value oneself on, pique oneself on, plume oneself on, peacock oneself on (on one's skill, etc.)

content.content: 彼は金を持って威張っている
He stands on his riches―He is proud of his wealth―He is a purse-proud man.
彼は英語ができるって威張っているからおかしい
He prides himself on his English.
あれだけ学問ができりゃ威張るのももっともだ
He may well proud of his scholarship―takes a just pride in his attainments.

content: 3. (=人に対して威張る)to domineer over (one); to lord it over (one); to be overbearing towards (one)

content.content: 彼は下々に対して威張りちらす
He domineers over his inferiors―lords it over his inferiors.
昔は西洋人が日本人に対して威張ったものだ
The foreigners used to lord it over the Japanese.
小役人に威張られるとしゃくにさわる
It is exasperating to be lorded over―domineered over―by petty officials.
あの先生は生徒に横柄で威張り過ぎる
He is too overbearing towards the students.

content:
4. 
〈その他〉

content.content: 彼は威張って及第した
He came off with flying colours.
大威張りで帰って来た
He returned in triumph.
この手際ならどこへ出しても威張ったものだ
The performance compares favourably with any.
この作ならどこへ持って行っても威張ったものだ
The work will bear comparison with the best of them.

content:
いはん〔違反〕
〈名〉Contravention; disobedience:(=する) to contravene, disobey, act contrary to (orders); to contravene, violate, break, depart from (a rule); to be contrary to, be against (rule or orders)

content.content: 命令違反
disobedience to orders
君の処置は命令違反だ
You have acted contrary to orders―disobeyed orders.
規則に違反する
to violate a rule―break a rule―depart from a rule
この規則に違反すべからず
This rule must not be departed from.
それは規則違反だ
It is against rule.
その処置は憲法違反だ
The measure is unconstitutional.
本条に違反した契約は無効とす
A contract in contravention of the present article shall be null and void.
文法違反
bad grammar―a solecism

content:
いはん〔違犯〕
〈名〉Breach; infringement; infraction; violation; transgression; contravention; offence:(=する) to break, infringe, violate, transgress, contravene, offend against, trespass against (the law)

content.content: 法律に違犯する
to break the law―infringe the law―violate the law―offend against the law
法律違犯
a violation of the law―an offence against the law
そんなことをしては法律違犯になる
Such action would be against the law―contrary to the laws.
法律違犯者
an offender against the law―a law-breaker―a culprit

content:
いび〔萎靡〕
〈名〉Decline; decay:(=する) to decline; to decay; to droop

content.content: 道徳萎靡して振わず
Morality has declined―decayed.

content:
いびき〔鼾〕
〈名〉A snore

content.content: 鼾をかく
to snore―drive one's pigs to market
行って見ると高いびきで寝ておった
I found him snoring loudly.
ここまで聞こえるようではずいぶん高いいびきをかいたとみえる
I must have snored pretty loudly to be heard here.

content:
いびたり〔寝漫〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ねしょうべん〔寝小便〕

content:
いびつ
〈形〉Crooked; distorted

content.content: いびつになる
to become distorted

content:
いひょう〔意表〕
〈名〉Unexpectedness

content.content: 言行人の意表に出る
His speech and actions are strange―His speech and actions will take you by surprise.
彼は往々人の意表に出るようなことをする
He will often spring a surprise upon people―spring a mine upon you.

content:
いびょう〔胃病〕
〈名〉A disordered stomach; stomachic disorder; dyspepsia; indigestion

content.content: 胃病を患う
to suffer from dyspepsia
胃病患者
a dyspeptic

content:
いひょうがい〔意表外〕
〈形〉Unexpected

content.content: 彼の言行は意表外だ
His speech and actions are strange―His speech and actions will take you by surprise.
彼は往々意表外なことをする
He will often spring a surprise upon people―spring a mine upon you.

content:
いびる
〈他動〉To maltreat; to torment; to persecute; to tease

content.content: 姑が嫁をいびる
A mother-in-law torments a bride.
いびり殺す
to torment one to death
いびり出す
to torment one out of the house
この子はお母さんをいびって何でも買って貰う
She will tease her mother out of anything she wants.

content:
いふ〔委付〕
〈名〉Abandonment:(=する) to abandon (something to some on)

content.content: 破船を保険会社に委付する
to abandon a wrecked ship to the underwriters

content:
いふ〔異父〕
〈名〉Different fathers

content.content: 異父兄弟
brothers by different fathers―uterine brothers

content:
いぶ〔慰撫〕
〈名〉Soothing; pacification:(=する) to soothe; to pacify

content.content: 人心を慰撫する
to pacify the excited people―“pour oil on the troubled waters.”

content:
いふう〔威風〕
〈名〉Majesty; dignity; an imposing air; a commanding presence:(=ある) majestic; dignified; imposing; commanding

content.content: 彼は威風堂々たるものだ
He is a man of commanding presence.
威風凛々として四辺を圧す
His imposing air overawes the people with whom he has to deal.

content:
いふう〔遺風〕
〈名〉A custom left by the preceding generations; a survival; a relic

content.content: これは旧幕時代の遺風である
This is a survival of the feudal times―a relic of the feudal times.
まだ封建時代の遺風が残っている
Some customs of the feudal times still survive.

content:
いぶかしい〔訝しい〕
〈形〉Suspicious

content.content: あの男は挙動がいぶかしい
His movements are suspicious.

content:
いぶかしげな〔訝しげな〕
〈形〉Wondering

content.content: いぶかしげな顔をして僕の話を聞いていた
He was listening to me with a wondering face.
いぶかしげに問い返した
He asked me back with a wondering air.

content:
いぶかる〔訝る〕
〈自動〉To wonder (if, whether, what, etc.)

content.content: どうしたわけかといぶかっていた
I was wondering what was the matter.

いふく〔威服〕
〈名〉Subjugation by power:(=する) to subjugate (the people) by power; to overawe (the people)

いふく〔畏服〕
〈名〉Submission from fear; awe:(=する) to submit from fear; to be awed:(=させる) to frighten (one) into submission

content:
いふく〔異腹〕
〈名〉Half-blood

content.content: 異腹の兄弟
half-brothers

いふく〔衣服〕
〈名〉Clothing; clothes; garments; raiment; dress; apparel

content:
いふく〔遺腹〕
〈形〉By a departed husband; posthumous

content.content: 遺腹の子
a posthumous child

content:
いぶし〔燻し〕
〈名〉Fumigation

content.content: いぶしをかける
to blacken by fumigation
銀にいぶしをかける
to oxidize silver

content: 〈形〉Smoked; oxidized

content.content: いぶし鮭
smoked salmon
いぶし銀
oxidized silver

content:
いぶす〔燻す〕
〈他動〉To fumigate (a room); to smoke (salmon); to oxidize (silver, etc.)

content.content: 室内を硫黄でいぶして消毒する
to disinfect a room by fumigating with sulphur
蚊をいぶし出す
to smoke off mosquitoes
狐をいぶし出す
to smoke out a fox

content:
いぶせき
〈形〉Gloomy; cheerless

content.content: いぶせき賤が伏屋
a lowly cottage
いぶせしと思う
If 'mong the rank and wilding growth
中にも選びなば
I choose with heedful mind,
薬とならむ
Who knows but I may chance upon
草もあるらん
Some salve to bless mankind?

content:
いぶつ〔遺物〕
〈名〉
1. (=かたみ)a relic; a survival; remains

content.content: 彼は旧幕時代の遺物だ
He is a relic of the feudal times―a survival of the feudal times.
石器時代の遺物
remains of the stone age

content: 2. (=遺産)a bequest; a legacy

content.content: 国体は先祖の遺物である
The national constitution is a legacy of our fathers.

content:
いぶつろん〔唯物論〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ゆいぶつろん〔唯物論〕

content:
いぶる〔燻る〕
〈自動〉To smoke; to smoulder

content.content: 薪が生だといぶる
Green wood smokes.
いぶっていたのが風にあおられてパっと燃え上がった
The smouldering mass, fanned by the wind, burst into flames.

content:
いぶんし〔異分子〕
〈名〉A foreign element

content.content: 彼は教員間の異分子だ
He is a foreign element among the teachers.
異分子の統一
unity in diversity

content:
いへん〔異変〕
〈名〉An accident; a mishap; a disaster; a calamity; a catastrophe; a cataclysm

content.content: (到着が遅いから)途中で何か異変があったのではないかと心配しておった
I feared lest there should have been some disaster on the road.

content:
いぼ〔疣〕
〈名〉A wart

content.content: 指にいぼができた
A wart has formed on my finger.

いほう〔異邦〕
〈名〉A foreign country; a strange land

content:
いほう〔違法〕
〈名〉Illegality; unlawfulness:(競技の違法)a foul stroke, a foul hit, a foul blow:(=の) illegal; unlawful

content.content: 違法処分
illegal measures
違法行為
an illegal action
違法者
an offender against the law―a law-breaker
違法罪
a sin of commission

content:
いぼう〔威望〕
〈名〉Influence and popularity

content.content: 威望一身に集まる
All hopes are centred on him.

いぼがえる〔疣蛙〕
〈名〉The toad

content:
いほく〔以北〕
〈前置詞相当〉North of

content.content: 白川以北は人間がおとなしい
North of Shirakawa, the people are gentle and mild.

いぼく〔遺墨〕
〈名〉The autograph of a departed person

いぼたろう〔疣取蝋〕
〈名〉Chinese wax

いま〔居間〕
〈名〉A sitting room; a living room:(英国では)a parlour:(一人用の居間は)a private room; a sanctum; a snuggery; a growlery; a den

content:
いま〔今〕
〈副〉
1. Now; nowadays; at present; at this moment:(名詞に用いれば)the present

content.content: 今を楽しむ
to live in the present
今は夏だ
It is summer now.
今は昔と違う
Things are not now what they used to be.
今や日本は一等国に列せり
Japan now ranks with the First-Class Powers.
今ちょっと手が放されない
I am engaged at this moment.
今現に地球が動いているのか
Is the earth moving at this moment.
今となってはしかたがない
It can't be helped now.
今でも
even now―still
今でも彼と文通している
I still correspond with him.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 今は便利な世の中だ
This is an age of conveniences.
それを聞くのは今が初めてだ
That is new to me.
今もって便りが無い
I have not heard from him yet.
それは今に始めぬことだ
It is an old story.
それが今は無い
It is a thing of the past.
今死んでも思いおくことさらに無し
If I were to die tomorrow, I should leave the world without regret.
機会のあるのを今や遅しと待っていた
I eagerly watched for a chance.
今は昔
once upon a time
今の
present―existing―current―modern―nowadays
今の主人
my present master
今の情態
the existing state of things
今の英語
current English
今の大臣はもとは書生だった
The present ministers were students once.
今の世には珍しい人だ
Such men are rare in modern times.
今の学生は意志薄弱だ
The students nowadays are infirm of purpose.
今の若い者はそれだから困る
That is the way with you young men nowadays.
これが今のはやりだ
This is now in fashion―quite the thing.
今の戦争は花々しいところが無い
Modern warfare lacks spectacular effect.
今のところこれだけありゃ間に合う
This sum will do for the present.
後の百より今の五十
“A bird in the hand is worth two in the bush. ”
今の有様では改革などは思いも寄らぬ
As matters stand―As things are―a reform is not to be thought of.
今のうちに用意をしておこう
I will make preparations at once.
止めるなら今の内
Stop me now or never!
今から
from now―hence―ago
今から百年後の日本が見たい
I should like to see Japan a hundred years hence.
今から十日ほど前のことだ
It happened some ten days ago.
今から行ってはもう遅い
It would be too late to go now.
今まで
till now―up to the present―up to date―down to date―hitherto―so far―all this while
今までのところでは万事都合好くいった
All has gone well so far.
今までに知れた事実はこれだけ
These are all the facts that are known up to date―dawn to date.
今の今までそうとは知らなんだ
I did not know till this moment that such was the case.
君は今までどこにいたか
Where have you been all this while?

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: これが今まで見たうちで一番好い
This is the best I have ever seen.
これは今までに無い事件だ
This is an unprecedented case.
これは今までに無いできだ
You have outdone yourself―eclipsed yourself.

content: 5. (=たった今)just; only just; but just; just now

content.content: 僕は今来たばかりだ
I have just come―only just come―but just come.
たった今来た
I came just now.
今六時打ったばかりだ
It has only just struck six.
彼と今別れて来たところだ
I have only just parted from him.
汽車が今たったというところへ行った
I found that the train had just started.
行ってみると医者が今来たというところだった
I found that the doctor had just come.

content: 6. (=今すぐ、今じきに)soon; at once; in a moment; this instant

content.content: 今すぐ来い
Come at once!―Come this instant!
今参ります
I'm coming.
今致します
I'm going to.
今できます
It will be ready in a moment.
汽車が今たつというところへ行った
I found the train on the point of starting.
時計は今十二時打つところだ
It is on the stroke of twelve.
今に
very soon―presently―in a minute―in a second―by and by―in time―soon enough
彼は今に来る
He will be here presently.
今に満月になる
It will be full moon by and by.
子どもを学校へ入れておけば今に立派な人になる
If you keep the boy in school, he will be a useful man in time
(子どもにそんなことを教えなくとも)今に覚え過ぎて困る
He will learn it soon enough.
今に自動車へ乗るような身分になって見せる
I shall ride in my motor-car yet.
今に見ろ
You shall see.
今にわかる
Time will show.
今に彼はきっと僕に降参するようになる
The time will come when he will yield to me.
今に世界が統一する
The day is not far distant when the world will be unified.
今に英語を知らないと人並の交際ができなくなる
It will not be long before the knowledge of English becomes necessary to ordinary intercourse.
今にも
(expect) every moment―(may) at any moment
彼は今にも来るかも知れぬ、今か今かと来るのを待っている
He may come at any moment―I expect him every moment.
病人は今にも知れない
The invalid may die at any moment.
今にも死ぬかと思った、今死ぬか今死ぬかと思った
I expected to die every moment―I felt as if my last hour had come.
今にも降り出しそうだ
It threatens to rain every moment.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 今にも落ちそうだ
It is ready to drop.
(疲れて)今にも倒れそうだ
I feel ready to drop.
船は今にも沈みそうだった
The ship seemed ready to sink.
女は今にも泣き出しそうだった
She was ready to cry.

content: 9. (=もう)more; other

content.content: 今一つ持って来い
Bring one more―Bring another.
今一つ召上がれ
Take one more cup!
今一人来る
One more is coming.
今一人入れます
There is room for one more.
今一つで十になる
One more will make ten.
今少し下さい
Give me a little more.
今一時間たてば月が入る
The moon will be down in another hour.
ここに今一つ解釈がある
There is another interpretation of the passage.
今一人のお方はどうなさいましたか
What has become of the other gentleman?
今一度
once more
今しばし
a little longer
今一目見て死にたい
O for another glimpse of her before I die!
今ひと奮発
another effort
今ひと息というところで負けた
Another effort, and I should have won the day.

content:
いまいちど〔今一度〕
〈副〉Once more; again

content.content: 今一度言ってご覧
Say it once more!―Say it again!
今一度やってご覧
Try again!
今一度見たいものだ
I should like to have another look at it.

content:
いまいましい〔忌々しい〕
〈形〉Vexing; vexatious; aggravating; exasperating; tantalizing; confounded

content.content: いまいましいじゃないか
How vexatious it is!―How aggravating it is!―How exasperating it is!―How tantalizing it is!
えい、いまいましい
How vexing!―Confound it!
いまいましい奴だ
What an aggravating fellow!―Confound the fellow!
いまいましい世の中だ
Life is full of vexations.

content:
いまいましがる〔忌々しがる〕
〈自動〉To be vexed (at anything)

content.content: 彼は失敗していまいましがっている
He is vexed at his failure.

content:
いまかいまかと〔今か今かと〕
〈副〉(To expect) every moment

content.content: 今か今かと彼の来るのを待っている
I expect him every moment.
(あの時は)今死ぬか今死ぬかと思った
I expected to die every moment―I felt as if my last hour had come.

content:
いまごろ〔今頃〕
〈副〉About this time; at this time (of the year, of day, of night); by this (time); now

content.content: 去年の今頃だった
It was about this time last year.
昨日の今頃だった
It was about this time yesterday.
明日の今頃来る
I shall come about this time tomorrow.
毎年今頃は荒れる
The weather is always stormy at this time of the year.
今頃(この深更に)彼はどこへ行くのかしら
Where can he be going at this time of night?
今頃そんなことを言い出しては困る
You must not recede from your promise at this time of day―at the eleventh hour.
今頃はいつも火事が頻繁だ
Fires are always of frequent occurrence at this time of the year.
今頃は京都へ着いたろう
He must have reached Kyoto by this.
先月誂えたのだから今頃はできているはずだ
As it was ordered last month, it ought to be ready by this.
彼は今頃は途中だろう
He must now be on the road.

content:
いまさら〔今更〕
〈副〉Now; at this time of day

content.content: いまさら合わす顔が無い
I dare not show my face at this time of day.
今さら言っても始まらぬ
It is no use talking now.
いまさら言っても後のお祭りだ
It is too late to talk now―It is a day after the fair.
いまさら言うまでも無いが
It does not justify repetition, but...
いまさら返らぬことながら
though it is now beyond recall
いまさらのように驚いた
I was surprised at it as if it were something new.
彼の行動はいまさらではない
His conduct is of a piece with his general character.

content:
いましがた〔今し方〕
〈副〉Just now; a little while ago

content.content: 僕はいましがた来た
I came just now.
彼はいましがたここにおった
He was here a while ago.

content:
いましばし〔今暫し〕
〈副〉A little longer

content.content: いま暫く我慢しろ
Hold out a little longer!
いま暫しご猶予を願います
Give me a little more time.

content:
いまじぶん〔今時分〕
〈副〉At this time of the year; at this time of day; at this time of night

content.content: いま時分は毎年荒れる
The weather is always stormy at this time of the year.
いま時分たつなどはもってのほかだ
You must not think of starting at this time of day.
いま時分(この深更に)どこへ行くのかしら
Where can he be going at this time of night?
いま時分(この年になって)そんなばかな真似はしない
I know better at this time of day.
いま時分そんなことを言い出しては困る
You must not recede from your promise at this time of day―at the eleventh hour.

content:
いましめ〔戒め〕
〈名〉
1. (=訓戒)admonition, warning; caution; precept:(=る) to admonish (one of one's duty); to warn (one of danger―one against a habit); to caution (one against error)

content.content: (何を)もって戒めとする
to take warning by anything
前車の覆るは後車の戒め
Take warning by another's failure.
犯則者を他の戒めに槍玉に上げてやるがよい
The offender ought to be made an example of as a warning to others.
彼は堕落学生の好い戒めだ
He is a good warning to erring students.
後日の戒めに彼を懲らしめてやった
I taught him a lesson as a warning for the future.
これをもって後来の戒めとせよ
Let this be a warning to you!
後来を戒める
to caution one for the future―warn one for the future―give one a warning―give one a caution
悪習に陥らぬように戒める
to caution one against bad habits
酒色を戒める
to warn one against wine and woman
危険を戒める
to warn one of a danger
本分を忘れぬように戒める
to admonish one of one's duty
身を戒める、自ら戒める
to be cautious―be circumspect―guard against evil―beware of evil
堅く暴挙を戒む
I solemnly warn you against violence.

content: 2. (=譴責、 懲罰)reproof; correction:(=る) to reprove (one for a fault); to correct (one for a fault)

content.content: 不心得を戒めた
I reproved him for his misconduct―corrected him for a misdemeanour.

いましめのなわ〔戒めの縄〕
〈名〉Bonds

いましめのみ〔戒めの身〕
〈名〉(To be)in bonds

content:
いますぐ〔今直ぐ〕
〈副〉At once; this instant

content.content: 今すぐ来い
Come at once!―Come this instant!
今すぐというわけには行かない
It can not be done at once.

content:
いまだ〔未だ〕
〈副〉(Not) yet;(“not”以外の打消に伴えば)as yet; never (before); so far

content.content: 墨痕いまだ乾かず
The ink is not yet dry.
いまだ来たらず
He has not come yet.
いまだ死せず
He has not died yet―He is not yet dead.
工事はいまだ着手の運びに至らず
The works are not yet ready for beginning.
彼の居所はいまだ不明だ
His whereabouts is as yet unknown.
この作はいまだ公にせしこと無し
The work has never been published.
いまだ参上仕りませぬ
He is not yet here, my lord.
いまだ拝顔の栄を得ず候えども失礼を顧みず一書拝呈仕候
I take the liberty of addressing you, though I have not the honour of your acquaintance.
選挙いまだ決せず
The election is not yet decided―The election hangs in doubt―hangs in the balance.
いまだ詳報に接せず
The particular have not been received so far.

content:
いまだかつて〔未だ曾て〕
〈副〉(Not) yet; never (in one's life)

content.content: いまだかつて成功せし者無し
No man has yet succeeded―No man has ever succeeded―No man has ever succeeded yet.
かかる偉人はいまだかつて見ず
I never saw such a great man in my life.
かかる偉人はいまだかつて無し
He is the greatest man that ever lived―A greater man never lived.

content:
いまだに〔未だに〕
〈副〉Still

content.content: その人はいまだに生存しているか
Is he still living?
あの家はいまだに明いている
The house is still vacant.
犯人はいまだに縛に就かぬ
The culprit is still at large.

いまどうしん〔今道心〕
〈名〉A novice; a neophite

content:
いまどき〔今時〕
〈副〉In these days; nowadays

content.content: いまどきの学生は意志薄弱だ
Students nowadays are infirm of purpose.
いまどきの学生には珍しい勉強家だ
Such hard-workers are rare among students nowadays.
いまどきそんなことをいう者は無い
Nobody says such things in these days.

content:
いまなお〔今尚〕
〈副〉Still

content.content: その人は今なお生存している
The man is still living.
その品は今なお存している
The article is still in existence―still extant.
その家は今なお存している
The house is still standing.

content:
いまにも〔今にも〕
〈副〉(To expect) every moment; (may) at any moment; ready (to do anything)

content.content: 彼は今にも来るかも知れぬ
He may come at any moment―I expect him every moment.
病人は今にも知れない
The invalid may die at any moment.
今にも降り出しそうだ
It threatens to rain every moment.
今にも死ぬかと思った
I expected to die every moment―I felt as if my last hour had come.
女は今にも泣き出しそうだ
She is ready to cry.
船は今にも沈みそうだ
The ship is ready to sink.
今にも落ちそうだ
It is ready to drop.
今にも倒れそうだ
(人なら)He is ready to drop―(物なら)―It is nodding to its fall―tottering to its fall.

いまふう〔今風〕
〈名〉Modern style; present fashion:(=の) fashionable; stylish

content:
いまもって〔今以て〕
〈副〉(Not) yet; still

content.content: 彼は今もって去らぬ
He is not yet gone.
今もって居る
He is still here.

content:
いまやおそしと〔今や遅しと〕
〈副〉Eagerly; impatiently

content.content: いまや遅しと待つ
to watch for anything
いまや遅しと機会のあるのを待った
I eagerly watched for a chance.

いまよう〔今様〕
〈名〉
1. (=今風)the modern style; modernism
2. (=今様歌)a kind of Japanese poem

content:
いまわ〔臨終〕
〈名〉The hour of death

content.content: いまはの際に
in the hour of death―in the article of death―in one's last moments

content:
いまわしい〔忌わしい〕
〈形〉Abominable; scandalous; disgusting

content.content: いまわしい風習だ
It is an abominable custom.
いまわしい風説が立っている
Scandalous rumours are afloat.
聞くもいまわしい
It is disgusting to hear.

いまわり〔居廻り〕
〈名〉The surrounding country; the environs; the neighbourhood

content:
いまをさる〔今を去る〕
〈副〉Ago; since; back

content.content: 今を去る十年前のことだ
It happened ten years ago―ten years since.

content:
いみ〔意味〕
〈名〉Meaning; sense; signification; significance(は深い意味); import; purport; effect:(=する) to mean; to signify

content.content: “Shrewd”とはどういう意味か
What do you mean by “shrewd”?―What is meant by “shrewd”?
「抜け目が無い」という意味だ
“Shrewd” means “wide-awake”.
“Pride goes before a fall”はどういう意味か
What do you mean by saying―What is meant by saying―that “Pride goes before a fall”?
ここの意味がわかるか
Do you know the meaning of this passage?
あの演説の意味がわかったか
Do you see the import of his speech?―the purport of his speech?
ここの意味がさっぱりわからぬ
I can not make out the meaning of this passage―I can make nothing of this passage.
ここの意味が判然とわからぬ
I can not get at the meaning of this passage.
意味を取る
to take the meaning―interpret a passage―construe a passage
大体の意味を取る
to grasp the general meaning
意味を取違える
to mistake the meaning
この語はどうにでも意味が取れる(意味が曖昧だ)
The word is ambiguous in meaning.
この語にはそんな意味は無い
The word does not convey such a meaning.
言外の意味を取る
to read between the lines
彼の言は言外に意味がある
His remarks must be read between the lines―More is meant than meets the ear.
この語はどういう意味に用いてあるか
In what sense is the word used?
「無用」という語をどうして「禁制」の意味に用いるようになったものか
How came the word(無用)to be used in the sense of “prohibition”?
彼はある意味において天才ともいうべし
He is a genius in a sense.
あらゆる意味において天才だ
He is a genius in every sense of the term.
彼は人のできないことができるという意味において天才だというのだ
I call him a genius in the sense that he can do what no one else can.
僕はそういう意味のことを言ったかも知れぬがそのような言葉を使うはずは無い
I may have said something to that effect, but I can not have used such words.
彼は文法廃すべしという意味のことを言った
He said something to the effect that grammar should be done away with.
単数と複数で意味の違う名詞がある
Some nouns have different meanings in the singular and plural.
言葉の意味を充分に発揮する
to bring out the full signification of a word.
これは意味の深い話だ
This is a story of deep significance―a significant story.
これは意味の広い語だ
This is a word of comprehensive meaning―a comprehensive term.
意味深長
to be profound in meaning―pregnant with meaning―significant―abstruse―recondite―oracular
文字通りの意味
literal meaning―grammatical sense
英語で「優待」といえば「金をどっさり出す」の意味を含んでいる
“Handsome treatment” implies “coming down handsomely”.
意味ありげな顔をした
He gave a significant look―a meaning look―an expressive look.
意味ありげに
significantly―expressively

content:
いみ〔忌〕
〈名〉
1. (=喪)mourning

content.content: 忌みがかかる
to go into mourning―to be in mourning
忌み日
days of mourning
忌み明け
the end of mourning―the expiration of days of mourning

a tabooed word

a thing to be abstained from―a tabooed thing

いみありげな〔意味有りげな〕
〈形〉Significant, meaning, expressive (look, etc.)

いみありげに〔意味有りげに〕
〈副〉Significantly; expressively

いみきらう〔忌嫌う〕
〈他動〉To abominate, abhor, detest, loathe (anything)

いみじき
〈形〉
1. (=勝れた)excellent
2. (=著しき)remarkable
3. (=非凡な)extraordinary; out of the common

いみしんちょう〔意味深長〕
〈形〉(To be) profound in meaning, pregnant with meaning, significant, abstruse, recondite, oracular

content:
いみな〔諱〕
〈名〉A posthumous name

content.content: 諱を賜う
to give one a posthumous name

いみょう〔異名〕
〈名〉Another name; an alias

content:
いみん〔移民〕
〈名〉(=移住)emigration:(移住者)an emigrant:(来住)immigration:(来住者)an immigrant:(=する) to emigrate; to immigrate

content.content: 移民団
a colony
移民会社
an emigration company
移民制限法
an immigration restriction law―an anti-immigration law

content:
いむ〔忌む〕
〈他動〉
1. (=忌み嫌う)to abominate, abhor, detest, loathe (anything)
2. (=避ける)to avoid, shun, eschew, taboo (a word, etc.)

content.content: しの字を忌む人がある
Some people taboo the syllable “shi”.
悪事を忌む
to eschew evil
担ぎ屋は42の電話番号を忌む
Some superstitious people avoid telephone numbers containing the combination 42.

いむべき〔忌む可き〕
〈名〉Abominable; detestable; loathsome

content:
いめい〔威名〕
〈名〉Fame; renown

content.content: 威名を世界に轟かす
to win a world-wide fame

content:
いも〔芋〕
〈名〉(=馬鈴薯)the potato:(甘藷)the sweet-potato:(里芋)the taro:(トロロ芋)the yam

content.content: 芋畑
a potato patch―a potato field

content:
いもうと〔妹〕
〈名〉A younger sister

content.content: 妹娘
a younger daughter
義理の妹
a sister-in-law
妹分
a younger sister by courtesy

content:
いもがり〔妹狩り〕
〈名〉Sweethearting

content.content: 妹狩り行く
to go sweethearting

いもじ〔湯文字〕
〈名〉A chemise; a shift

content:
いもせ〔妹背〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ふうふ〔夫婦〕

content:
いもの〔鋳物〕
〈名〉(事)casting:(物)cast iron

content.content: これは鋳物か打物か
Is this cast iron or wrought iron?
鋳物師
a founder
鋳物場
a foundry

いもほり〔芋掘り〕
〈名〉A rustic; a bumpkin; a clodhopper

いもむし〔芋虫〕
〈名〉A large caterpillar

content:
いもん〔慰問〕
〈名〉Condolence; consolation; an inquiry after one's health; a call of sympathy:(=する) to condole with (the afflicted); to console (the unfortunate):(病人に対してなら)to inquire after one's health; to express one's sympathy with (the sick)

content.content: 慰問状
a condolatory letter―a letter of condolence
慰問袋
a comfort bag
慰問使
an Imperial messenger sent to inspect the condition of the men at the front

いもんぶくろ〔慰問袋〕
〈名〉A comfort bag

content:
いや
〈間投詞〉Oh!; Ah!

content.content: いや大変だ
Great Heavens!
いやしまった
Hang it!―Damn it!

content:
いや〔厭〕
〈叙述形容詞〉I will not; I do not like

content.content: あんな人のところへお嫁に行くのはいやだ
I will not marry such a man.
娘はお嫁に行くのはいやだと言う
She says she will not―refuses to―get married.
娘がいやだと言うのを両親が無理往生に嫁にやった
They forced her inclinations.
金を貸してくれ、いやか
Lend me some money, will you?
そんなことをするのは何を貰ってもいやだ
I would not do such a thing for the world―Nothing can induce me to do such a thing.
男ならいやとは言えまい
No man, who is a man, can refuse to do it.
いやなものを無理にとは言わぬ
I will not force you to do anything against your will.
おいやでしょうが暫くご辛抱を願います
I wish you would put up with it for a while, though against your will.
僕は仕事がいやなのではない
Not that I dislike the work―Not that the work is not to my taste.
誰だって友人の扶助を受けるのはいやだ
No one likes to live on the bounty of his friends.
いやならお止しなさい
You need not do it if you do not like it.
君がいやなら他を探そう
If you won't do it, I'll find some other man.
いやで幸い好かれちゃ困る
I am glad you don't like me; I should be sorry if you did.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 謝るのはいやなものだ
It goes against the grain―goes against the stomach―to apologize.
謝るのがどうしてもいやだった
I kicked at apologizing.
あの人は見るもいやだ
I can not bear the sight of that man.
牛肉の匂いを嗅ぐのもいやだと言う人がある
Some people can not bear the smell of beef.
今日は人に面会するのはいやだ
I am in no mood to receive company.
いつまでも人に言われるのがいやだ
I shall never hear the end of the affair.
戦争はいやだ
We deprecate war.
いやになる
to be disgusted with―be sick of―be weary of―anything
この商売は儲からないからいやになった
I am disgusted with my business, which brings me no profit at all.
世の中がいやになった
I am sick of life―weary of the world.
いみじみいやになった
I am heartily sick of it―sick at heart.
つくづく考えてしみじみいやになった
I have thought myself sick at heart.
矢も楯も堪らないほどいやになった
I feel an irresistible dislike―I am thoroughly sick of it.
思い出すといやになる
It makes me sick to think of it.
思い出すのもいやだ
I can't bear the thought of it.
いやになるほど食う
to surfeit oneself with sweets
いやになるほどお世辞を言う
to surfeit one with compliments
まんざらいやであるまい
She is not altogether amiss, eh?
いやと言うのを無理に飲まされた
I was made to drink against my will.

content: 〈形〉(=な) undesirable (thing); disagreeable (person or thing); unpleasant (feeling); distasteful (task); unwelcome (guest); disgusting (manners); hateful (man); odious (person); obnoxious (custom); execrable (roads); beastly (weather); offensive, nasty, vile, villainous (taste or smell); nauseous, fulsome (flattery); horrible (man); dreadful (experience, etc.):(=に) awfully; devilishly; deucedly

content.content: いやな天気だ
It is disagreeable weather―nasty weather―beastly weather.
いやな仕事
a distasteful task―uncongenial work―drudgery
試験の答案を調べるくらいいやな仕事は無い
There is no drudgery like looking over examination papers.
何とも言えないいやな匂いだ
It has a vile smell.
何とも言えないいやな味がする
It has a villainous taste.
いやな顔をする
to make a wry face―pull a long face―look blue
いやな顔もせずに金を出した
He gave the money willingly.
いやな顔もせずに朝から晩まで働く
She works cheerfully from morning till night.
いやな奴
What an odious creature!―What a horrible man!
いやな心持になってきた
An unpleasant feeling has come over me.
いやな課業だ
Confounded task!
オーいやだ
How disgusting!―How dreadful!―Faugh!
お互いにいやな口なら一つ利いたことが無い
We have never had a harsh word between us.
いやな男の親切よりも好いたお方の無理が好い
I prefer the unkindness of the man I love to the kindness of the man I hate.
いやに気どっているね
He is awfully prim.
いやに真面目くさっているね
He is awfully solemn.
いやに澄ましているじゃないか
He looks provokingly grave.

content:
いや〔否〕
〈応答詞〉No:(打消の疑問に対しては)yes

content.content: (行くかに対して)否、行かん
No, I won't.
(知らないかに対して)否、知っている
Yes, I know.
否と言う
to say no―say one nay―reply in the negative―refuse to do anything―refuse one a favour
君には何を頼まれても否と言えぬ(あなたのことなら)
I can refuse you nothing.
男に急所を握られているから何を言われてもいやと言えない
He has a hold upon her, so she is at his mercy.
否だ否だ
I will not hear of it.
お前が行く、そりゃ否だ否だ
I will not hear of your going.
彼は否と言い出したらどうしても聴かない
When he puts his foot down, nothing can move him.
否とかぶりを縦に振る
She says “No” and nods assent.→『いやがおうでも〔否が応でも〕』→『いやでもおうでも〔否でも応でも〕』

content:
いやいや〔厭々乍ら〕
〈副〉Unwillingly; reluctantly; against one's will; with a bad grace

content.content: いやいやながら承知した
I reluctantly gave my consent.
いやいやながら訴えたのだ
I proceeded against him much against my will.
彼はいやいやそうに謝った
He apologized with a bad grace.

content:
いやおう〔否応〕
〈名〉Yes or no

content.content: 否応の返答をする
to say yes or no
ぜひ否応の返答が聞きたい
I must have your answer, yes or no.
巡査が否応を言わさず彼を引張って行った
The policeman marched him off by force―without more ado.

content:
いやおうなしに〔否応無しに〕
〈副〉Whether one will or not; whether willing or not; willy-nilly; nolens volens; against one's will; by force; by compulsion; on compulsion

content.content: 徴兵は否応無しだ
You must serve in the army whether you will or not.
否応無しに飲まされた
They made me drink against my will.
否応無しに証文を書かした
We made him sign a paper by force―by compulsion.
否応無しに約束したのだからその約束は無効だ
I made my promise on compulsion, so it is not binding.

いやがうえにも〔いやが上にも〕
〈副〉To crown all; to cap all

content:
いやがおうでも〔否が応でも〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: いやでもおうでも〔否でも応でも〕

content:
いやがらせ〔厭がらせ〕
〈名〉A disagreeable thing

content.content: いやがらせを言う
to say disagreeable things

content:
いやがる〔厭がる〕
〈他動〉To dislike (anything); to be unwilling (to do anything); to be loath (to do anything); to be averse (to anything); to have an aversion (to anything); to refuse (to do anything)

content.content: 彼は働くことをいやがる
He is unwilling to work―He is averse to working―He has an aversion to working.
いやがるものを無理にとは言わぬ
I will not force her to do anything against her will.
娘が嫁に行くのをいやがる
She refuses to get married.
娘がいやがるのを両親が無理往生に嫁にやったのだ
They forced her inclinations.
だから君は女にいやがられるのだ
That is why you are disliked by the girls.

content:
いやき〔厭気〕
〈名〉Aversion; repugnance

content.content: 彼は女にそろそろ厭気がさしてきたのだ
He begins to feel repugnance to her.

content:
いやく〔意訳〕
〈名〉Free translation:(=する) to translate freely

content.content: 直訳でなく意訳する
Translate the passage freely, instead of literally.

content:
いやく〔違約〕
〈名〉Breach of promise; infraction of contract; default:(=する) to break a promise; to break one's word; to infringe a contract; to default

content.content: 彼は違約した
He has broken his promise―He is in default.
違約者
a defaulter
違約金
a forfeit―a penalty

content:
いやく〔医薬〕
〈名〉Medicine; medical treatment; medical aid

content.content: 医薬を施す
to treat one medically―subject one to medical treatment
医薬その効無く昨夜永眠仕候
In spite of medical aid, he passed away last night.

content:
いやしい〔賤しい〕
〈形〉
1. (=下賤な)humble (occupation); low (birth); lowly (people); low-lived (man); menial (office)

content.content: 身分の賤しい人
lowly people―people of low condition
賤しい職業
a humble occupation―a menial service
今は(小使のような)賤しいことをしているが昔は何某と言われた身だ
Though he now holds a menial office, he has seen better days.
素性の賤しい女だ
She is a woman of low birth―a low-born woman.
細君は素性が賤しい
His wife is beneath him in birth.
彼は素性の賤しい女と結婚したのが一生の失錯だった
He has the imprudence to marry beneath him.→『いやしからぬ〔賤しからぬ〕』

content: 2. (=卑劣な)base (character); mean (action); ignoble (action); vile (nature)

content.content: 彼らは人間中の最も賤しい者だ
They are the vilest of mankind.
賤しい心
a base mind―a sordid mind
賤しい行為
a mean action―a base action―an ignoble action
品性の賤しい人だ
He is a man of mean character―a man of base character.

content: 3. (=野卑な)vulgar (expression); coarse (manner); gross (expression)

content.content: 賤しい言葉を使う
He use vulgar language―coarse language―gross language.
ふうが賤しい
He has coarse manners―gross manners.

content: 4. (=賤しむべき)contemptible (fellow); despicable (motive, etc.)

いやしからぬ〔賤しからぬ〕
〈形〉Respectable; decent; gentle

content.content: 彼は賤しからぬ生まれだ
He is of gentle birth―of gentle blood.
賤しからぬ男だ
He is a decent sort of a chap.
賤しからぬ風体の男だ
He is respectably dressed―a man of respectable appearance.

content:
いやしくも〔苟も〕
〈副〉Any; at all:(=する) to neglect

content.content: いやしくも紳士なら約束を履行するだろう
If he is anything of a gentleman, he will keep his promise.
いやしくもこれをするからには立派にやれ
If you do it at all, do it well.
いやしくも戦う以上はあくまで戦え
If you do fight at all, fight it out.
いやしくも教育ある者ならこれくらいのことは心得ているはずだ
A man of any education ought to know it.
いやしくも軍人たる者が降参などとはもってのほかだ
A soldier worthy of the name should never think of surrender.
一言一句苟もせず
He weighs every word he utters―He is guarded in his speech―He can bridle his tongue.
(彼が文を作るに)一字一句苟もせず、片言隻語苟もせず
He is choice of his words.
一挙一動苟もせず
He is guarded in his conduct―He is circumspect.

content:
いやしみ〔賤み〕
〈名〉Contempt; disdain; scorn

to be despised―be held in contempt

content:

〈他動〉To despise (a man); to contemn (a person or thing); to regard (anything) with contempt; to hold (anything) in contempt; to disdain (a mean action); to scorn (a mean fellow); to think scorn of (a man, etc.)

content.content: 人を賤しむものでない
You should not despise people―regard people with contempt―hold people in contempt.

いやしむべき〔賤しむべき〕
〈形〉Contemptible (fellow); despicable (character, etc.)

content:
いやしめる〔賤める〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: いやしむ〔賤む〕

いやしんぼう〔賤しん坊〕
〈名〉
1. (=くいしんぼう)a greedy fellow
2. (=けちんぼう)a miser

content:
いやす〔癒す〕
〈他動〉To cure (a disease―one of a disease); to heal (a wound―one of a wound)

content.content: 病を癒す
to cure(one of) a disease
傷を癒す
to heal (one of) a wound
渇を癒す
to quench one's thirst―slake one's thirst
腹を癒す
to revenge oneself―have one's revenge―wreak one's grudge―glut one's ire

content:
いやでも〔厭でも〕
〈副〉Though against one's will

content.content: いやでもあろうが暫く辛抱してくれ
You must put up with it for a while, though against your will.

content:
いやでもおうでも〔否でも応でも〕
〈副〉Whether one will or not; whether willing or not; willy-nilly; nolens volens

content.content: 否でも応でも徴兵に行かにゃならぬ
You must serve in the army whether you will or not.
小僧を否でも応でも学校へやる
He shall go to school, whether willing or not.

content:
いやに〔厭に〕
〈副〉Awfully; confoundedly; devilishly; deucedly

content.content: いやに気どっているね
He is awfully prim.
いやに真面目くさっているね
He is confoundedly solemn.
いやに人の顔を見る男だ
He has a confounded way of staring at people.
電灯がいやに暗いな
The electric light is confoundedly dim.
どうした、いやに澄ましているじゃないか
What is the matter with you? You are looking devilishly grave.
いやに改まっているじゃないか
You are deucedly ceremonious.
あの男はいやにキチンとしている
He has a smug air―a spruce air.

content:
いやはや
〈間投詞〉Oh, dear, dear!; Well, well

content.content: いやはや困ったものだ
Oh, dear, dear! What shall I do with him?
いやはやとてもお話しになったものじゃない
Well, well, well, it is simply unspeakable.

content:
いやまし〔弥増し〕
〈副〉More and more

content.content: 学校はいやましお盛んなそうで
I am glad to hear that your school is more and more flourishing.
借金がいやまし増える
The debts go on increasing.

content:
いやます〔弥増す〕
〈自動〉To increase more and more; to go on increasing

content.content: 暑気はいやますばかり
It grows hotter and hotter―The heat goes on rising.

content:
いやみ〔厭味〕
〈名〉Irony; a disagreeable remark

content.content: 厭味を言う
to make disagreeable remarks
厭味たらたらさ
He made himself very disagreeable―He was disagreeableness itself.
彼の厭味がしゃくにさわった
I was stung by his disagreeable remarks.
厭味たっぷりの男だ
He is a disagreeable fellow.
厭味の無いさっぱりした男だ
He is a frank, agreeable man―There is nothing disagreeable about him.

content:
いやらしい〔厭らしい〕
〈形〉Horrid (man); horrible (behaviour); disgusting (manner); nauseous (flattery); fulsome (compliments, etc.)

content.content: いやらしいお老翁さんだ
He is a horrid old man.
いやらしいことを言う人だ
He says such horrible things.
いやらしい真似をする人だ
He behaves horribly.
女に向かっていやらしいことをする
He will take liberties with you.
女に向かっていやらしいことを言う
to make advances to a woman

content:
いゆ〔癒ゆ〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: いえる〔癒える〕

いゆう〔畏友〕
〈名〉A respected friend

content:
いよいよ〔愈々〕
〈副〉
1. (=益々)more and more

content.content: 学校はいよいよ栄える
The school grows more and more flourishing.
いよいよ多くなる
to increase more and more―go on increasing
いよいよ少なくなる
to grow less and less―go on decreasing
いよいよ出でていよいよ面白い
It becomes more and more interesting.
いよいよ出でていよいよおかしい
I am more and more tickled.
いよいよ出でていよいよ奇
It is extremely curious―exceedingly strange.
いよいよ御清栄奉賀候
I trust you are in the enjoyment of excellent health.

content: 2. (=とうとう)at last

content.content: いよいよ休暇になった
The holidays are here at last.
いよいよ来月出発致します
I have decided to leave next month.
いよいよ戦争が始まりそうだ
War seems about to break out.
いよいよという時に彼はへこたれた
He faltered at the last moment―at the supreme moment.
いよいよという時にへこたれないように常に覚悟が大事だ
We must be prepared for the worst, lest our heart should fail us at the supreme moment.
いよいよという時に尻込みした
He receded at the eleventh hour.
いよいよとなったら彼は降参した
When it came to the push, he gave in.
いよいよとなれば僕だってただは居らぬ
When things come to the push, I will not be idle.
いよいよという段になったら僕が応援する
When the worst comes to the worst, I will come to the rescue.
いよいよということが無ければ彼は働かない
He will not work, unless he is put to the push.
いよいよという時まで延ばす
to drive it to the last minute
いよいよ冬になった
Winter has set in in earnest.

content: 3. (=間違い無く)really; fairly; in earnest

content.content: いよいよ発狂だ
He is really mad.
いよいよそうと決まれば打っちゃっておけぬ
If that is really the case, we can not leave it alone.
今度はいよいよ困ってしまった
I am fairly at my wits' end.
今度はいよいよ閉口した
I am fairly reduced to a nonplus.
いよいよ土用に入った
The dog-days have fairly set in.
戦いがいよいよ始まった
The battle has begun in earnest―in good earnest―in real earnest.
彼の有罪なことがいよいよ確かになった
His guilt no longer admits of any doubt.

content:
いよう〔威容〕
〈名〉Dignity; presence; mien; a dignified mien

content.content: 威容を正す
to assume a dignified attitude―(西洋では)―draw oneself up―(日本では)―sit up straight
威容を正して控えていた
I found him seated in a dignified attitude.
威容堂々たる人
a man of commanding presence―of majestic mien

content:
いよう〔異様〕
〈形〉Strange; odd ; queer; singular; fantastic; grotesque; uncouth

content.content: その様子が異様に思われた
His appearance struck me as strange.
彼らは異様ないでたちだ
They are fantastically dressed.
異様な意匠
a grotesque design
異様な考え
a singular idea
異様に見える
It looks strange.
異様に聞こえる
It sounds strange.
こういうと異様に聞こえるだろうがしかし事実だ
Strange as it may sound, it is true for all that.
異様な感じがする
I feel queer―I have a strange feeling―I have an odd feeling.

content:
いよだつ〔弥立つ〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: よだつ〔弥立つ〕

content:
いらい〔以来〕
〈接続詞、前置詞相当〉Since

content.content: 父が亡くなって以来、伯(叔)父の世話になっています
I have lived with my uncle since my father died―(前置詞に訳せば)―since my father's death.
病人は一昨日以来何も食べません
The invalid has tasted no food since the day before yesterday.
一別以来三カ月になる
It is three month since we parted―since I saw you last.
ここに来て以来始終この家に住まっている
I have lived in this house ever since I came here―since I have been here.
開闢以来の大事件だ
This is the greatest event since the world began―since the creation of the world.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 二十年以来こんな大雪は無い
We have not had such a snowfall for twenty years.
二十年以来の大雪だ
This is the heaviest snowfall we have had for twenty years.

content: 〈副〉Hereafter; henceforth; in future

content.content: 以来慎みます
I will be more careful in future.

content:
いらい〔依頼〕
〈名〉
1. (=頼ること)dependence; reliance:(=する) to depend on (others); to rely on (self); to lean on (public opinion); to look to (one) for assistance

content.content: 君は人に依頼し過ぎる
You depend too much on others.
君は人に依頼してはいかん
You must not depend on others―You must rely on yourself―You must be self-reliant―You must have self-reliance―You must learn to help yourself.
家族は一本のやせ腕に依頼している
The family leans upon a broken reed.
僕はほかに依頼すべき友人が無いから

東京の大部分は水道に依頼している

content: 2. (=頼み)a request:(=する) to request, ask (one to do something)

content.content: 彼に通弁を依頼した
I asked him to interpret for me.
依頼に応ずる
to comply with one's request―accede to one's request―oblige one
遺憾ながらご依頼に応じかねます
I am sorry I can not oblige you―I regret to say that I am not in a portion to comply with your request.
彼は僕の依頼を快諾してくれた
He readily complied with my request.
依頼に応じて行ってやった
I went in compliance with his request.
ご主人のご依頼によって参上致しました
I called at the request of your master.
人の依頼を聴く、依頼を聴かぬ(はねつける)
to grant one's request―refuse one's request

content: 3. (=委託)trust:(=する) to entrust (one with a matter―a matter to one); to place (a matter) in one's hands

content.content: あなたにこの事件をご依頼致します
I will entrust you with the matter―entrust the matter to you―place the matter in your hands.
事件を依頼した弁護士
the lawyer entrusted with the matter
弁護士に依頼した事件
the matter entrusted to the lawyer
弁護士を依頼する
to retain a lawyer
(弁護士の)依頼人
a client

You must not think of depending on others―You must rely upon yourself―You must be self-reliant―You must have self-reliance―You must know self-help―You must learn to help yourself.

〈自動〉To be irritated; to be nettled; to chafe (against, etc.)

いらっしゃい
〈命令法〉Come in, sir!; Welcome!; You are welcome!:(木戸番が言えば)Walk up! Walk up!

content:
いらっしゃる
〈自動〉(Honorific for) to come, go, be

content.content: 好くいらっしゃいました
You are welcome―I am glad to see you.
これはいらっしゃい
Here you are, sir!
田中さんがいらっしゃいました
Here is Mr. Tanaka.
芝居へいらっしゃいましたか
Have you been to the play?
佐藤さんは時々いらっしゃいます
Mr. Sato often comes to see us.
伊藤さんは近頃ちっともいらっしゃいません

山田さんはいらっしゃいますか

貴方は山田さんでいらっしゃいますか
Are you Mr. Yamada?―Have I the honour of addressing Mr. Yamada?

Walk up! walk up!

content:
いらぬ〔要らぬ〕
〈形〉Needless; unnecessary; superfluous

content.content: そんなことをするのは要らぬことだ

要らぬことをするな
You may spare yourself the trouble.
要らぬ費用を省く

Do not meddle in others' affairs!―Mind your own business!

content:

二ポンド入りの茶筒

この徳利は二合入りだ

content.content: 入相の鐘

content:
いりくち〔入口〕
〈名〉An entrance; a mouth; an inlet; a gate; a door; way in

content.content: 入口の番をする
to guard the entrance―keep the door
家の入口

港の入口

停車場の入口

content:

content.content: 入り組んだ事件だ

入り組んだ構造だ

入り組んだ問題だ

入り組んだ文章だ

いろいろ入り組んだ事情がある

入り組んだ細工だ

〈名〉Power; force

content.content: 威力を振るう
to exert one's power―make one's power felt
日本はよろしく威力を東洋に振るうべし
Japan ought to make her power felt over the East.
下瀬火薬は威力をたくましうした
The Shimose powder developed its full power.
土人は威力をもって服従せしむるよりほかは無い
We must force the natives into submission.
陸奥艦は一大威力を日本海軍に添えたり
The Mutsu has added a new power to the Imperial navy.
金の威力は恐ろしいものだ
Such is the power of wealth.

content:
いる〔居る〕
〈自動〉
1. (=どこにどうしている)to be; to be found

content.content: 彼はまだいるか
Is he still here?
もういない
He is gone.
君は何をしているか
What are you doing?―How are you engaged?
著述をやっている
I am writing―I am engaged in literary work.
お前は遊んでばかりいてはいけない
You must not be idle―I can not have you idle.
休暇中は毎日家にいます
I shall always be at home―You will always find me at home―during the holidays.
泣かずにいられない
I can not but cry―can not help crying.
笑わずにいられない
I can not but laugh―can not help laughing.
行ってみたら彼は勉強していた
I found him at his books.
行ってみたらその人は死んでいた
I found him dead.
いても立ってもいられない
I am in agony.

content: 2. (=何をどうしている)to have (something how)

content.content: 彼は鉄砲を担いでいる
He has a gun on his shoulder.
犬が何かくわえている
The dog has something in his mouth.
一人の女は子どもを抱いている
One woman has a child in her arms.
いま一人の女は子どもを負ぶっている
The other woman has a child on her back.

content: 3. (=居合わす)to be present; to be by

content.content: 彼はいない
He is absent.―He is away.
ちょうど誰もいなかった
No one happened to be by.
君がいないと淋しい
I miss you very much.
彼がいないと困る
I shall miss him―I can not spare him.
彼はいなくともけっこう間に合う
I can do without him―He can be very well done without.
彼はいない方が好い
His room is better than his company―I prefer his room to his company.
親のいる前であんなことを言うものでない
You should not say such things in the presence of your parents.

content: 4. (=住んでいる、泊まっている)to live; to reside; to stay; to inhabit (a place); to occupy (a house or a room)

content.content: 僕は伯(叔)父の家に居る
I live with my uncle.
小石川に学者が居る
Scholars live in Koishikawa.
あの人は日本に久しく居る
He has lived long in Japan.
上海に日本人がたくさん居る
Many Japanese reside in Shanghai.
君はいつまでここに居るか
How long shall you stay here?
あの島に人が居るか
Is that island inhabited?
人は居ない
It is uninhabited.

content: 5. (=自然にいる)to be found

content.content: 虎はインドにいる
Tigers are found in India.

content: 6. (=続いてどうしている)to keep (doing something); to remain (how); to do nothing but (do something)

content.content: 子どもがひと晩泣いていた
The child kept crying all night.
犬が夜通し吠えていた
The dog kept barking all night.
(どうかこうか)借金だけはせずにいる
I manage to keep out of debt.
彼は始終黙っていた
He remained silent all the time.
女は泣いてばかりいる
She does nothing but cry.
彼は朝から晩まで酒ばかり飲んでいる
He does nothing but drink from morning till night.

content: 7. (=常にどうしている)to go (how)

content.content: 飯を食わずにいる
I go without my meals.
彼は水を飲まずにいる
He goes without drinking water.
酒を飲まずにいる
He goes dry.
ラクダは幾日も幾日も飲まず食わずにいるというのは事実でない
It is not a fact that the camel can go without eating or drinking for days.
子どもらはボロを下げている
The children go in rags.
土人は常に武装している
The natives go armed.

content:
いる〔射る〕
〈他動〉To shoot

content.content: 矢を射る
to shoot an arrow
弓を射る
to shoot with bow and arrow
的を射る
to shoot at a mark
人を射る
to shoot a man with an arrow
毒矢を射られる
to be wounded by a poisoned arrow
彼は弓を射ることが上手だ
He is a good archer.
射あてる
to hit the mark
射損う
to miss the mark
射殺す
to shoot one dead
頭を射抜く
to shoot one through the head
眼光炯々{けいけい}人を射る
He has piercing eyes.
利を射る
to be mercenary―sordid

content:
いる〔煎る〕
〈他動〉To parch (peas); to roast (beans); to fire (tea)

content.content: 豆をいる
to parch beans
いりたての豆
fresh parched beans―beans hot from the oven
機関砲は豆をいるような音がする
A machine-gun rattles.
いりつけられるような暑さだ
The heat is scorching.

content:
いる〔鋳る〕
〈他動〉To cast (a statue); to found (a bell); to mint (coin); to strike (coin); to coin (metal)

content.content: 立像は青銅で鋳てある
The statue is cast in bronze.

content:
いる〔入る〕
〈自他動〉
1. To enter; to go in; to come in; to get in; to penetrate into

content.content: 大学に入る
to matriculate
政界に入る
to go into politics―enter upon one's political career
床に入る
to get into bed
軍籍に入る
to enter the army―become a soldier
箕作氏の門に入る
He entered Mr. Mitsukuri's school.
病は口より入る
Diseases enter at the mouth.
深く敵地に入る
to penetrate deep into the enemy's territory
隅田川は東京湾に入る
The Sumida falls into―empties into―the Bay of Tokyo.
仏門に入る
to enter the Buddhist priesthood
仏道に入る
to be converted to Buddhism
悟道に入る
to be spiritually enlightened
佳境に入る
The interest deepens―The plot thickens―Now comes the cream of the story.
討議に入る
to open a debate
博徒の仲間に入る
to join the gamblers
鉄道工夫の群に入る
to join a gang of trackmen
亡き人の数に入る
to go over to the majority―join the majority
総論より各論に入る
to descend from generals to particulars
八犬伝は伝奇小説の部類に入る
The “Hakkenden” falls under the head of romances.
英語は入り易く極め難い
English is easy to learn, but hard to master.
無用の者入るべからず
No admittance except on business.
入りやすいところ、入り難いところ
a place easy of excess―difficult of access
郷に入っては郷に従え
“Do at Rome as the Romans do.”
穴より出でて 穴に入る
“From dust thou comest, and to dust returnest.”
手に入る
to come into one's possession
この金はどうして手に入ったか
How did you come by this money?
稲は実が入る
The rice-plants fill.
気に入る
to please one―take one's fancy
この家が気に入った
I am pleased with this house―I have taken a fancy to this house.
悦に入る
to go off into raptures (over anything)―chuckle to oneself―rub one's hands
笑つぼに入る
to make merry (over anything)―go off into convulsions

content: 2. (=日月が入る)to set; to go down

content.content: 日は西山に入る
The sun sinks below the horizon.
英領は日が入らぬ
The sun never sets on the British Empire.
日の入らぬ国
the Empire on which the sun never sets

content: 3. (=季節に入る)to set in

content.content: 入梅に入る
The rainy season sets in.
寒に入る
The cold season sets in.
もう土用に入った
The dog-days have set in―We are in the dog-days.
有卦{うけ}に入る
One's lucky years begin.
新世紀に入る
We are at the threshold of a new century.

content:
いる〔要る〕
〈自動〉To want; to need; to require; to take; must have

content.content: 金が少し要る
I must have some money―(英国では)―I want some money―I am in want of money―(米国では)―I need some money―I am in need of money―(いずれにても)―I stand in need of money.
金は一文も要りません
No money is needed―It will not cost a cent.
暇が要る
It takes time―requires time.
人手が要る
It take many men―requires a number of hands.
家内五人で月二百円要る
With a family of five, one must have two hundred yen a month.
近頃は金の要ることばかりある
I have had many outlays of late.
何をするにも金の要ることばかりだ
Whatever we may do, money is the first consideration.
当分この金は要らない
I do not need this money―I can do without this money―for the present.
要らない本があったら貸してくれ給え
Lend me any books you can spare.
あの女なら命は要らぬ
I would die for her.
うまい物を食って運動さえしていりゃ医者は要らぬ
Good food and exercise will keep the doctor away.

content:
いるい〔衣類〕
〈名〉Clothing; clothes; garments; raiment:(一人所有の衣類全部)one's wardrobe

content.content: 女は衣類を質入れして男に入り揚げた
She pawned her wardrobe to lavish the money upon her lover.

content:
いるす〔居留守〕
〈名〉Pretence of absence

content.content: 居留守を使う
to pretend to be out―be “not at home” to some one
僕が行くといつも不在とばかりで居留守を使う
He is always not at home to me―He is never at home to me.

content:
イルミネーション
〈名〉Illumination

content.content: 各艦は美麗にイルミネーションを施した
The ships were all beautifully illuminated.

content:
いれあげる〔入れ揚げる〕
〈他動〉To lavish money on (an actor, etc.)

content.content: あの芸者は稼いで取った金を皆男に入れ揚げるのだ
She spends all her earnings on her lover.

content:
いれあわせ〔入れ合わせ〕
〈名〉Compensation:(=する) to compensate for, make up for (some want)

content.content: この次に入れ合わせを致します
I will make up for your disappointment next time.

いれい〔異例〕
〈名〉An exception; an anomaly

content:
いれかえる〔入れ替える〕
〈他動〉To replace

content.content: ランプの心を入れ替える
to replace the old wick by a new one
心を入替えます
I will amend―reform―turn over a new leaf.

content:
いれかけ〔入れ掛け〕
〈名〉Suspension of a performance

content.content: 相撲が雨の為に入れかけになった
Owing to the rain, the wrestling matches were suspended.

content:
いれかわり〔入れ変わり〕
〈名〉A change

content.content: 職員に入れ変わりがある
There is a change in the staff.

content:
いれぐち〔入れ口〕
〈名〉(=自動器の銭入れ口)A slit

content.content: 入れ口に銭を入れる
to slip a coin into the slit

content:
いれげ〔入れ毛〕
〈名〉False hair; a pad

content.content: 入れ毛をする
to use false hair
入れ毛をしない女は殆ど無い
Nearly every woman has false hair.

content:
いれこ〔入籠〕
〈名〉A nest of boxes

content.content: この重箱は入籠になっている
These boxes fit into each other.

いれじち〔入れ質〕
〈名〉Pawning:(=する) to pawn (an article)

content:
いれずみ〔入墨〕
〈名〉(事)tattooing:(物)a tattoo:(=する) to tattoo (the body)

content.content: 背中一面に入墨してある
His back is tattooed all over.

content:
いれぢえ〔入れ智慧〕
〈名〉A suggestion; an inspiration; a hint; a tip; a cue:(=する) to suggest an idea to (one); to inspire (one) with an idea; to prompt (one to do something); to give (one) a hint; to give (one) a tip; to put an idea into one's head; to put (one) up to (anything)

content.content: きっと誰かの入れ知恵に違いない

Some one must have suggested the idea to him―put the idea into his head―put him up to it―given him a hint―given him a tip―He must have been inspired by some one―been prompted by some one―been put up to it by some one―taken the cue from some one.
この論文は誰かの入れ知恵だろう
This article must have been inspired by some one―It must be an inspired article.
金に困った時ある友人の入れ知恵で質に置くことを覚えた
When I was hard up for money, a friend suggested to me the idea of pawning.

content:
いれちがい〔入れ違い〕
〈名〉Passing (one) in coming in or going out

content.content: 一人の男が僕と入れ違いに入ってきた
A man came in as I went out.

いれちがう〔入れ違う〕
〈他動〉To put (anything) in the wrong place

いれちがえる〔入れ違える〕
〈他動〉To put (anything) in the wrong place

いれね〔入れ値〕
〈名〉An offer; a bid

content:
いれば〔入れ歯〕
〈名〉A false tooth; an artificial tooth

content.content: 入れ歯をする
to have a false tooth put in
金の入れ歯
a gold-plugged tooth

いれまぜる〔入れ混ぜる〕
〈他動〉To mix (one thing with another)

content:
いれめ〔入れ目〕
〈名〉An artificial eye; a false eye; a glass eye

content.content: あの人は入れ目をしている
He has a glass eye.

content:
いれもの〔入れ物〕
〈名〉A receptacle; a vessel

content.content: 何かこれを入れる入れ物は無いか
Is there anything to put this in?
入れ物は皆ふさがっている
The vessels are all full.

content:
いれる〔煎れる〕
〈受動〉To be parched; to be roasted

content.content: 豆が煎れた
The peas are well parched―The beans are well roasted.

content:
いれる〔入れる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=物を入れる)to put in; to take in; to let in; to introduce; to insert; to admit

content.content: 財布をたもとに入れた
I put my purse in (or into) my pocket.
この手紙を郵便箱に入れて下さい
Please put this letter in the post―drop this letter in the post.
口に入れる
put anything in one's mouth
あたら口へ茶を入れる
My thirst is worthy of a better cause.
歯を入れる
to put in a false tooth―have a false tooth put in
足駄に歯を入れる
to put supports in a rain-clog
旗を入れる
to take in the flag
砂糖を入れる
to put in sugar―sweeten
西洋では茶に牛乳と砂糖を入れる
Foreigners drink their tea with milk and sugar.
着物に綿を入れる
to stuff a gown with cotton
この箱に何が入れてあるか
What is in this box?―What does this box contain?
この箱に何を入れておくか
What do you keep in this box?
君は金をどこへ入れておくか
Where do you keep your money?
本にしおりを入れる
to insert a book-mark in a book
書類に文句を入れる
to insert some words in a document
指輪に宝石を入れる
to set a gem in a ring―set a ring with a gem
明りを入れる
to let in the light―admit the light
窓から明りを入れる
The window lets in the light―admits the light.
風を入れる
to let in the fresh air―air a room

content: 2. (=人を入れる)to let in; to admit; to show in; to usher in

content.content: 生徒を入れる
to admit a student
二十歳以上の者は入れぬ
Students over twenty years of age are not admitted.
入場券の無い者は入れることができぬ
Those who have no admission-tickets can not be admitted.
この名刺を出すと入れてもらえる
This card will gain you admission.
この札を持って行くと無料で入れてくれる
This ticket will admit you free of charge.
君だけ特別に入れて上げよう
I will make room for you.
病室へ入れてくれなかった
I was not let into the sick-room―admitted into the sick-room.
クラブへ入れてもらう
to gain admission into a club
人を客間へ入れる
to show a man into the parlour―usher a guest into the parlour
人を牢屋へ入れる
to put a man in prison―cast a man into prison―imprison a man
門戸を開放して外人を入れる
to open the door to foreigners
大学へ入れる
to matriculate a student

content: 3. (=雇い入れる)to engage; to hire; to take

content.content: もっと職人を入れる必要がある
We must hire more men.
学校へ教員を入れる
to engage a teacher for the school
あきがあったら入れて上げよう
I will take you when there is a vacancy.

content: 4. (=含める)to include

content.content: 雑費を入れて百円か
100 yen, inclusive of expenses?
雑費を入れずに百円
100 yen, exclusive of expenses.
利息を入れての勘定か
Is that inclusive of interest?
利息を入れずに
exclusive of interest
下女下男を入れて家族七人
There are seven of us, inclusive of the servants.
勘定に入れる、勘定に入れぬ
to take anything into account―leave anything out of account
年齢を勘定に入れなければならぬ
We must take the age into account.
遠くなったのを勘定に入れないのが間違いだった
I made a mistake in leaving the increased distance out of account.
馬をお買いになれば鞍はおまけに入れます
If you will buy the horse, I will put in the saddle―throw in the saddle―throw the saddle into the bargain.
女を入れないで十人ある
There are ten of us without counting the women.
茶を入れる
to make a tea
西洋ふうに茶を入れることを知っているか
Can you make tea in the foreign way?
利息を入れる
to pay the interest
家賃を入れる
to pay the rent
屋敷へ魚を入れる
to supply a family with fish―serve a family with fish
病人を病院へ入れる
to send an invalid to (the) hospital―(病院の方から言えば)―take in a patient―admit a patient
木にはさみを入れる
to prune a tree
米を倉に入れる
to garner the rice―garner away the rice―garner up the rice
筆を入れる
to revise a work―make corrections―add a few touches―touch it up
みだりに筆を入れる
to dabble with the text―garble the text
人の耳に入れる
to tell one something―inform one of something
このことは親父の耳に入れたくない
The affair must not come to my father's ears―come to my father's knowledge.
お耳に入れておきたいことがある
There is something which I wish to bring to your knowledge.
このことは彼の耳に入れておかなければならぬ
He must know it.
彼は人が何を言っても耳にも入れぬ
He gives no heed to advice or warning.
彼は人の歎願を耳にも入れぬ
He turns a deaf ear to people's entreaties―He is deaf to entreaty.
ご覧に入れましょう
I will submit it to your inspection―I will show it you.
仕事に身を入れる
to put one's heart into one's work
彼は学問に身を入れている
He gives himself, body and soul, to his studies.
身を入れて働く
He works with a will.
仕事に力を入れる
to bend to one's work―lie down to it
下腹に力を入れる
to strain the abdomen
声に力を入れる
to strain the voice
言葉に力を入れる
to emphasize a word―lay stress on a word
力こぶを入れる
to interest oneself in some cause
つまらないことに力こぶを入れている
His zeal is worthy of a better cause.
念を入れる
to take care―give attention
念に念を入れよ
You can not be too careful―Make assurance doubly sure.
手に入れる
to get possession of―possess oneself of―anything
ばくち宿へ手を入れる
to raid into a gambling-house―make a raid on a gambling-den
家に手を入れる
to repair a house
探りを入れる
(傷なら)to probe a wound―(人の意向なら)―sound one's views―feel one's pulse―throw out a feeler―(世間の意向なら)―feel the pulse of the public―fly a kite
故障を入れる
to raise an objection―interpose a veto
くちばしを入れる
to interfere in a matter―meddle in one's affairs―put in an oar
横槍を入れる
to put in a word―interpose
ちゃりを入れる
to indulge in pleasantries―to be facetious
茶々を入れる
to put in one's oar―put a spoke in one's wheel
東京へペストを入れずにおわった
We have succeeded in keeping the pest at bay.
